story:
Peoples of the Earth Coffee is prepared as a homeopathic remedy to help remind us of our ONENESS ~ serving to restore Mother Earth and bring us back into UNITY.

More than just another specialty coffee, Peoples of the Earth Coffee is spiritually-infused, naturally-grown and exquisite tasting, with an economic model devoted to societal, cultural and environmental restoration for the safe keeping of our Mother Earth.  We are pre-selling the coffee through this campaign (see the perks in the sidebar).  These funds will enable the first shipment of coffee from Colombia that will kickstart the full-fledged business (made possible through your contributions).  When the campaign is successful and complete, we will be able to have a continual supply of the coffee to be purchased directly from our website. This campaign is a very special opportunity to get the coffee early and be a grassroots supporter!

SHIPPING IS FREE IN COLOMBIA:

If you want a perk and are in Colombia please make a donation instead of a contribution in the amount of the perk you desire.  Write us a note specifying the perk and include your shipping address.  This is to avoid being charged shipping costs (that are bundled into the perk/contributions).

ENVÍOS GRATIS EN COLOMBIA:

Si quieres una recompensa en Colombia, en vez de una contribución por favor hacer una donación en el monto de la recompensa que desees. Escribirnos una nota especificando la recompensa e incluye tu dirección. De esta manera aseguramos que no se cobre el costo del envió que está incluido a las contribuciones. 

The People of La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta

La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta mountain range (Colombia) is home to the native American Tayrona culture; consisting of the Kogui, Wiwa, Arhuaco and Kankuamo. Living in one of the most unique regions of the world, an area marked for its diversity and abundance, which they refer to as The Heart of the World, these four pueblos (indigenous tribes) have thrived for millennium.  In their simple yet profound wisdom, these ancient peoples – a living example of sustainability after thousands of years preserving their relationship with Mother Earth – have come to share with the world their insight and ongoing actions/initiatives for Global transformation and Mother Earth Restoration. 

The way of life and culture of the Four Peoples of the Earth, for the most part has been virtually untouched by the modern world.  Their mission, which they see as their Sacred Responsibility in the Web of Life  since the origins of time, is to preserve Universal Balance on Mother Earth.  Because they continue to see the global, social and bio-cultural crisis escalating beyond critical levels – even after years of raising awareness about pressing issues that we are all very familiar with – they have now been instructed or mandated to seek concrete, complementary action(s) to fulfill this mission.


The Coffee

One of the seeds found in La Sierra, and of course in all of Colombia, is the coffee bean itself, which in her original nature possesses all of the attributes necessary to interact in the global arena. The Elders view the seed of the coffee as a sacred element that will communicate their story; a story infused in the bean itself, which when taken to the cup brings awareness to the importance of our sacred relationship with the Earth herself.

From their spiritual perspective:

Since the origins of time, before coffee was ever a plant, she was a woman dressed in Earth, who in her lunar cycles would sow her red seed in the land.

This seed embodies a Mother, which contains the stories that once again connect us with the “life originating principles” and through a golden thread of ancestral memories, sustains us in unity with the Earth.

The coffee is prepared as a homeopathic remedy to help remind us of our ONENESS, serving to bring us back into UNITY as peoples of the Earth.  Each plant is cultivated with cultural and spiritual values that preserve the sacred balance of nature and sustain life on the planet.

Coffee is abundant in certain regions of La Sierra and is much sought after in the world market for its distinctive qualities. This handpicked, shade-grown, bird-friendly, natural and wild coffee derives its unique characteristics from the diversity of its surroundings. The coffee we will be working with from this region is sought after for its bright flavours and clean palate. This strain of Tipica coffee is “naturally” grown and interacts in its respective ecosystem through the principles of reciprocity, or complimentary relationships; in other words without pesticides and without harming the environment.  In essence, it is another vital element of the ecosystems of La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta that helps sustain the diverse range of flora and fauna. Peoples of the Earth Coffee will bring about restoration processes within other coffee producing communities through their exemplary ancient cultural methods. 


Our Commitment

To be an economic model based on inclusion, cooperation, dialogue and reciprocity, and harmonious relationships for restoring and safe guarding Mother Earth and her people. Ultimately, we are creating a company that surges in the local and global economy whose identity is based on care of the people and care of the earth. We integrate all participating members through a cohesive relationship model that will enrich our individual and collective existence. Our coffee will always be insured throughout the process and our impeccability to service will guarantee full traceability of every bean.

Our model is founded on direct relationships with producers; providing social and financial stability for community members, while ensuring quality and consistency in the coffee bean. The fostering of this relationship will create opportunities for sustainability in this endeavor and will make us one of the leading suppliers of coffee from this region. 


Our Vision

Through our experience and knowledge in the logistical requirements, we intend to take the bean from "the tree to the cup,” at our upcoming Peoples of the Earth CAFÉs, assuring the delivery of our coffee to the national and international market places. This further step will allow the story and content behind our endeavor to take on full meaning and purpose in its reach worldwide. 

The fostering of this relationship – from tree to cup – will create opportunities for sustainability and  that brings prosperity to all involved through values and principles, particularly to our originating (grassroots) communities world wide.


Your Participation:

The thick of the coffee harvest in La Sierra just began in October 2015 and based on altitude and other factors will continue until early 2016.

Your contributions (through pre-buying the Peoples of the Earth Coffee: see the perks in the sidebar) will enable us with these start-up expenses:

  • Purchase of parchment directly from growers IN their communities!
  • Transportation
  • De-hulling
  • Exporting
  • Rent
  • Roaster
  • Insurance
  • Taxes
  • Marketing
  • Graphics
  • Packaging and Labeling

All of which is necessary to kick-start the Peoples of the Earth Coffee business and get the first batch of coffee delivered to our roaster in Durango, Colorado and prepared for the end-consumer. 

The Impact

In an unprecedented moment in Human History, the Peoples of the Earth from La Sierra and all over the world call upon Humanity to assure a transformed global society that leaves a legacy for all our Children of clean air, fresh water, fertile soil and harmony in the Human Spirit.

This is an opportunity to be a part of our exemplary business model, which will extend outwardly from Colombia to then integrate into our global community. The profits given back to the communities of La Sierra will be used to ensure quality product while achieving economic autonomy for the peoples and the recovery of ancestral lands.  Modern developments at the base of the mountain have begun to affect ancient cultural practices and threaten their way of life. 

Your interaction with this coffee:

  • 52% of the profits from your contribution go to support the communities (so they can continue to preserve their cultural identity by living coherently with pre-ancient norms as they carefully tend to each stage of the coffee).
  • The other 48% will support Mother Earth Restoration Initiatives around the Entire World, which will be guided by the ancestral authorities of La Sierra.

Current Initiatives:

The lands that are recovered are to forward the creation of Temples for Awareness that will serve as beacons of light to guide us back to living in accord with Life Originating Principles (Universal Values).

The Elders of La Sierra have determined this is the moment in time to reach out to the Entire World for global support to recover lands that hold spiritual/cultural/environmental significance, which enhance humanity’s ability to restore harmony in ALL dimensions of life.

♦ Recovery of Ancestral Lands ♦

We present the first cases for the recovery of lands: the Elders have given a definitive plan of action that begins with the recovery of specific sacred sites.

  • Sacred Site of the Spiritual Mother of the Original Seeds (for a deeper analysis on the Original Seeds):
    100.5-hectare tract of land within the ancestral territory of the Four Peoples of La Sierra.  [We are honored to present the extraordinary in depth analysis from Mamo Palia here in the Dialogue for the Restoration of the Original Seeds, listen to the audio in his original language with translation and/or read the transcription.]
  • Sacred site where negativity is gathered and transformed into nourishment for Mother Earth Restoration and the Unification of Peoples:
    80-hectares tract of land located on the Southern face of the La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

♦ Fukushima Initiative/Restoration of the Waters ♦
An initiative that is intended to specifically address the grave situation brought about by the Fukushima Nuclear Plant crisis and the toxicity left that remains in our oceans affecting all life on the planet.

Complementary action sought: The next step for the stabilization of the Fukushima crisis (as part of the overall work seeking restoration of natural order) consists in visiting Mt. Etna in Italy. This pending journey will implement a process and spiritual work that Elders bring to restore the foundations of the temple of life, answering a call based on their mission to remain “vigilant to all events that take place upon the Earth.”

The Mother Earth Restoration Trust

The people of the Earth invite each of us to make our own personal declaration of intent that we will each do our part in healing ourselves, thus our world and being the shift in consciousness towards Mother Earth Restoration.

In service to the Mother we extend our heartfelt gratitude to each and every one of you and look forward to a long lasting relationship as we embark on this journey together to remember our ONENESS as PEOPLES OF THE EARTH.

story:
http://www.nbc11news.com/home/headlines/Graff-Dairy-will-reopen-in-December-and-provide-employment-for-10-homeless-teens-330022701.html
It's a 50 year old business, that is in need of major upgrades in equipment.  While we were hoping we could limp along and make it work, the new health and safety codes have made it required to replace the equipment before opening our doors, which we were not expecting.  It is our sincere hope with this endeavor to encourage our youths to embrace entrepreneurial opportunity and to assist them in achieving self-sufficiency through a stable work environment and to grow into successful members of society. 
Due in part to being over 55 years old and as well, a desire to bring the production facilities up to today's health and safety standards, we need to regroup and refinance.  This is a big deal, new pasteurizers, homogenizers, health and safety controls, and all in an effort to observe all current codes.  To maintain top quality healthy diary products back to the Grand Junction market.  Together we can bring the dream alive.  
The dream of building hope, generating a brighter future and building a viable business to teach teens the art of entrepreneurship! 
Here's a list of our needs:
2 soft serve ice cream machines
pasteurizer
homogenizer
electrical panel
milk shake machines 
food prep area
three bay sink
roofing 
flooring
decking 
lighting
appliances 
food handlers
refuse area
coffee machine
tables
 chairs 
bump and jumps 
outdoor tents 
playground equipment
signage 
commercial doors
drive through window
menu order intercom

By Amy Hamilton 
Wednesday, September 30, 2015

Double scoop for Graff Dairy

 "In an announcement made Tuesday at the dairy,  Darin Carei purchased the Graff Dairy building and its operations. Teenagers who seek shelter at The House, a landing spot and service organization for homeless youth, will be the first to be offered employment at the dairy, 581 29 Road."

"Executive Director of The House John Mok-Lamme said the partnership will be a good fit for youth who have trouble landing and keeping jobs, largely because of trauma they have endured.

The real-life work experience can also help youths gain skills in a safe setting,"

"The business should be open long hours to serve coffee starting at 6 a.m. and there are plans to stay open until 10 p.m. in the hot summer months to accommodate sweet tooths seeking ice cream.  The low-slung former residence will be remodeled to resemble a red barn. The drive-thru will be rerouted to the back of the building and seating will be available out front. And, of course, the building will be equipped with solar panels that should offset most of the energy costs of the operation."

story:
It started as a hobby

I started dabbling in the world of DMX lighting for my own band, with not much knowledge and minimal equipment.

Alot of smaller venues don't have decent lights, and the venues that do, usually don't know how to control them, let alone make a band look that much better on stage.

Occasionally, I've been asked to bring the lights that I do have to a few shows locally and would really like to make a part time job out of it.

We were featured on Chauvet Lighting's website on our use of their lights.   http://chauvetdjblog.com/band-profile-myparasites

What We Need & What You Get

I've come across a great opportunity to get some new lighting at some very competitive prices. 
I'll have rewards and perks of our band music, and merchandise, as well as doing lighting for venues and bands!

The Impact

Your help will give me the start that I need to get this venture off the ground and make it a reality. Touring bands who come through New Orleans will have professional lighting with a knowledgeable lighting designer and making them look great on stage.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools and tell your friends!

story:
Buzzing Around

80% of the world's population is already doing something amazing that can help provide sustainable food for our Children and Grandchildren. The Western World has been slow to catch on, but you can join us on our mission to expand our food knowledge and develop a healthy, sustainable and delicious food source that will provide food security for the future generations.

Our Australian based company, Edible Bug Shop, has developed a range of innovative retail products, which use Edible Insects as a SUPERFOOD ingredient. Instead of reaching for a packet of chips, we aim to get you snacking on some protein rich VitaBug Protein Balls or Chilli & Garlic Snack Crickets. 

Some of you might be thinking..YUCK, but please read on, because it wasn't that long ago that eating SUSHI was considered an unusual dinner option!

By the year 2050 the world's population will grow to over 9 billion people, and our current food production methods just won't be able to cope. It is predicted that we will need 70% more meat, have 15% less biodiversity and over 1 billion people will be without fresh water. 

The FAO has identified Edible Insects as one solution to the problem. 

  • By replacing one meat based meal per week with insects, you can save over 100,000L water every year
  • Insect production requires less space, and can be farmed vertically, leaving more farmland available for crops such as vegetables and grain
  • Insects don't waste energy maintaining their body temperature, so convert most of what they eat directly into body mass. 10kg of grain will produce 1kg of beef OR 9kg of yummy crickets

  • Farming insects creates 1/100th of the amount of Carbon Dioxide as beef production, so reduces the impact on the environment. 

Over the past 8 years, we have been growing our edible insect range slowly, reinvesting profits back into the company to help develop new and exciting products, and to help make our edible insect breeding facility as environmentally sustainable as possible. We are now at the point where we are ready to launch our new VITABUG range of products into retail stores, and we would like you to join us in doing this. 

VitaBug uses both whole, and powdered (invisible) insects and focuses on making super yummy products that happen to be healthy, sustainable and natural too. The aim of the brand is to provide a somewhat unfamiliar food ingredient (the edible insects) and present them in a familiar way. It is our responsibility to make Edible Insects more popular in Western Cultures and we believe our future population will embrace edible insects as a sustainable food item, which will decrease the stresses our planet feels through traditional livestock production. 

By contributing towards our campaign, you will not only help us launch our VITABUG range into retail stores, you will be helping introduce the world to a sustainable, delicious and healthy food source- EDIBLE INSECTS

We have retail stores on standby and they would love to make our VITABUG range available to their customers, we just need a little help from you to help us JUMP into the market and complete our full scale launch. 

Over the past 8 years, our business has educated, enticed and evolved. Now we want to share our passion for EDIBLE INSECTS with the world, by launching sustainable and delicious insect products and you can help us do it. 


From the very beginning, our aim has been to normalise insects as a source of food worldwide, and we have been recognised for it! Here are just some of our awards, with the most recent being 2015 Excellence in Sustainability and 2014 Excellence in Innovation. 


What We Need

We need $5,000 to get things started. This will go towards

  • Printing our new range of packaging
  • Some professional photos of our products for brochures and website
  • Purchasing of bulk ingredients to make our production more streamlined
  • EDUCATION- Putting our staff in retail stores to  help teach consumers about the benefits of edible insects as a food source. This will include cooking demonstrations and in store tastings
If we do not raise the $5,000 required to take this big JUMP into our retail launch, we will still be able to take small steps. Every little contribution will be used to purchase as many bulk ingredient as possible, and we will launch products in small stages. 
If we raise over the $5,000...and we hope we do... we will use the additional funds to complete our HACCP and ISO certifications- We already have the processes in place and require the audit to be completed for the final certification assessment. 

The Good Stuff... THE PERKS

Even the tiniest contribution will be reward! Our entry level perk includes a eBook containing delicious Edible Insect recipes from some super creative people, and it only gets better from there. See the PERKS to the right of screen, to see what your contribution will include

  • Our eBook contains 10 recipes, which will show you how versatile cooking with insects can be
  • Our reformulated Orange and Macadamia Performance Bar has been in production since 2008, and has recently undergone a facelift. It is 100% natural, paleo and is a good source of protein and micronutrients. 
  • All contributors- no matter how big or small, will be recognized in a dedicated section of our website. 
  • These Chilli & Garlic Cricket Snacks are our most popular product. We have recently changed the formula to have a bigger chilli kick. The 20g pack is a great alternative to nuts or chips, it has 12g of protein, 44% RDI calcium, 40% RDI Iron, 100% RDI copper, zinc, manganese, magnesium with heaps of essential amino acids and B12 vitamins. 


  • We have been working hard to educate the public about the benefits of edible insects, and now you can help us too! As part of your perk, you can contribute to our educational video, which will initially be shown in Schools around Australia as part of our incursion program. Schools will be invited to include the video as part of their Sustainable Foods outcomes and you will be one of the stars. 
  • If you fancy yourself as a budding food technologist we have a fantastic perk that money can't buy. You will work with our Product Development Manager to help develop a new flavour for our VitaBug Performance Bar range. Our bars use Cricket protein as a natural superfood ingredient. You will be able to suggest possible flavour combinations, receive in development samples of our top picks and then send through your feedback. Your feedback will help us create an amazing new variety that will be in stores around the world. 
  • A customised diner for 2 using some delicious edible insect ingredients? One of our high level perks includes a dinner for 2 at a restaurant close to you where the chef will create a once in a life time special dinner experience using a variety of edible insects. Your Instagram and Facebook pages will go crazy with LIKES when they see the amazingly unique food that only you get to try. If you are in Australia, you will receive a visit from Skye- So you can chat about all things bugs and if you are not located in Australia, we will organise a Skype call with Skye so you can ask her any questions and get the low down on edible insects as a future food source.


  • Skye is an Entomologist and Food Scientist  and has been working hard to develop her business breeding insects for human consumption since 2007. If you choose to contribute $2000+ you will receive mentorship for 1 year from Skye. This perk is perfect for the budding bug-entropnenur who is looking to start their own bug based business. Skye's unique combination of skills means she can provide advice on legislation, food labelling and packaging, shelf life, product development, manufacturing, certifications, insect breeding and controls. 

Global Impact

By joining us in our edible insect project, you will not only be helping us take the step from small scale to large scale production of our retail products, you will also be helping normalise insects as a genuine source of protein for our growing population. 

Even the smallest contribution WILL make a difference! 

  • We have already developed an extensive range products which are ready to hop onto the shelves. These are already available through our online store, and your investment will help us produce these in larger quantities for wholesale orders in our own commercial kitchen. 
  • By having skills in both Food Science and Entomology, I believe I am the prefect person to introduce edible insects to the world. I will do this by providing tasty, healthy products that can enjoyed by everyone. 
  • By reinvesting our profits we have been able to establish Australia's first edible insect farm and develop techniques to help make the insects safe to eat. We have also been able to set up our very own commercial kitchen, to make sure we can produce high quality insect based foods using our own staff and equipment. This level of control means we have been able to establish an Australian Made product that is compliant with HACCP and GMP regulations.
  • Our successful online store has been growing steadily since 2007 and our customer base has grown so big in Australia that we believe the time os right to make our products available on a larger scale.

More About Me!

I am a 32 years old Entomologist and Food Scientist and have had a passion for bugs since childhood. I have now passed on this passion to my children, Marley (3 years), Saxon (1.5 years) and Connor (6 Months). That's right...I am completely crazy. I live with my husband and children in Western Sydney (Australia) and completing this project will help make our production process more streamlined, meaning I get to spend more time with my beautiful family. Owning your own business is hard work, it takes years of dedication and sacrifice. We have been doing ground work for the Edible Insect community for years, and now is the perfect time to launch our products in retail stores. Here's a picture of my family taken at Connor's naming day. We obviously don't dress like this all the time, it had a SUPERHERO theme. 

Challenges

The main challenge we face is the ability to convince the general public that eating insects is a good thing! We plan to do this in the following ways

  • Providing INFORMATION about why we should be eating insects
  • Ensuring our products are safe to eat
  • Educating our children about the environmental and health benefits of eating insects
  • Developing delicious ready to eat retail products that people will want to buy again and again
  • Working with Chefs to produce recipes containing edible insects. This will show people how to use them in their everyday diets. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money, you can still help us spread the word about the benefits of EDIBLE INSECTS. 

  • Get Jumping, buzzing, Tweeting and Stinging everyone you know. Help spread the word about our campaign so we have the greatest chance of success. 
  • Use the SHARE tools to tell your friends about our campaign
  • Follow us on Twitter (@bugshop1), Facebook (/lovevitabug) OR (Butterfly Skye's)  and Instagram (@bugshop) for campaign updates and interesting facts.

Visit our website

www.ediblebugshop.com.au
story_txt:
Buzzing Around
80% of the world's population is already doing something amazing that can help provide sustainable food for our Children and Grandchildren. The Western World has been slow to catch on, but you can join us on our mission to expand our food knowledge and develop a healthy, sustainable and delicious food source that will provide food security for the future generations.
Our Australian based company, Edible Bug Shop, has developed a range of innovative retail products, which use Edible Insects as a SUPERFOOD ingredient. Instead of reaching for a packet of chips, we aim to get you snacking on some protein rich VitaBug Protein Balls or Chilli & Garlic Snack Crickets. 
Some of you might be thinking..YUCK, but please read on, because it wasn't that long ago that eating SUSHI was considered an unusual dinner option!



By the year 2050 the world's population will grow to over 9 billion people, and our current food production methods just won't be able to cope. It is predicted that we will need 70% more meat, have 15% less biodiversity and over 1 billion people will be without fresh water. 
The FAO has identified Edible Insects as one solution to the problem. 


By replacing one meat based meal per week with insects, you can save over 100,000L water every year
Insect production requires less space, and can be farmed vertically, leaving more farmland available for crops such as vegetables and grain
Insects don't waste energy maintaining their body temperature, so convert most of what they eat directly into body mass. 10kg of grain will produce 1kg of beef OR 9kg of yummy crickets


Farming insects creates 1/100th of the amount of Carbon Dioxide as beef production, so reduces the impact on the environment. 


Over the past 8 years, we have been growing our edible insect range slowly, reinvesting profits back into the company to help develop new and exciting products, and to help make our edible insect breeding facility as environmentally sustainable as possible. We are now at the point where we are ready to launch our new VITABUG range of products into retail stores, and we would like you to join us in doing this. 
VitaBug uses both whole, and powdered (invisible) insects and focuses on making super yummy products that happen to be healthy, sustainable and natural too. The aim of the brand is to provide a somewhat unfamiliar food ingredient (the edible insects) and present them in a familiar way. It is our responsibility to make Edible Insects more popular in Western Cultures and we believe our future population will embrace edible insects as a sustainable food item, which will decrease the stresses our planet feels through traditional livestock production. 
By contributing towards our campaign, you will not only help us launch our VITABUG range into retail stores, you will be helping introduce the world to a sustainable, delicious and healthy food source- EDIBLE INSECTS

We have retail stores on standby and they would love to make our VITABUG range available to their customers, we just need a little help from you to help us JUMP into the market and complete our full scale launch. 
Over the past 8 years, our business has educated, enticed and evolved. Now we want to share our passion for EDIBLE INSECTS with the world, by launching sustainable and delicious insect products and you can help us do it. 




From the very beginning, our aim has been to normalise insects as a source of food worldwide, and we have been recognised for it! Here are just some of our awards, with the most recent being 2015 Excellence in Sustainability and 2014 Excellence in Innovation. 


   What We Need
We need $5,000 to get things started. This will go towards


Printing our new range of packaging
Some professional photos of our products for brochures and website
Purchasing of bulk ingredients to make our production more streamlined
EDUCATION- Putting our staff in retail stores to  help teach consumers about the benefits of edible insects as a food source. This will include cooking demonstrations and in store tastings

If we do not raise the $5,000 required to take this big JUMP into our retail launch, we will still be able to take small steps. Every little contribution will be used to purchase as many bulk ingredient as possible, and we will launch products in small stages. 
If we raise over the $5,000...and we hope we do... we will use the additional funds to complete our HACCP and ISO certifications- We already have the processes in place and require the audit to be completed for the final certification assessment. 

The Good Stuff... THE PERKS
Even the tiniest contribution will be reward! Our entry level perk includes a eBook containing delicious Edible Insect recipes from some super creative people, and it only gets better from there. See the PERKS to the right of screen, to see what your contribution will include


Our eBook contains 10 recipes, which will show you how versatile cooking with insects can be

story:
The Story:

For many years I have seen families and adult children struggle with their aging parents or disabled loved ones.  My goal is to create a no hassle site with resources and tools to help navigate and manage these situations.  As an executive in the health care industry, I am acutely aware of the struggles that families go through and the lack of information in a clear, concise and no hassle fashion. In addition to the site itself - one of the first tools that I will publish is a binder/notebook that helps keep track of and trend vitals data that families need to keep track of.  It will adult children and families navigate the health system and keep track of very important information.

story:
A RESTORATIVE RETURN

Hello and welcome!  I am Michael Imperatore, owner and designer of a small furniture and design business.  Through this campaign page, I am hoping to raise enough capital funds to take my business to a new place — a place where the returning men and women from our United States Armed Forces can find healing in a new career.  This employment opportunity is set to combat ongoing unemployment faced by veterans coming home after having finished their tours, with a creatively hands-on outlet as they readjust to civilian life.

I have been working on constructing the foundation for this company for the last year and a half.  I have given a lot of time and energy, putting together the marketing and media, acquiring the workshop and retail spaces, and prototyping designs for the showroom.  I believe that everyone, especially those who give of themselves so selflessly, deserves the chance to have a career they can be proud of — one that helps them wake up everyday to feelings of accomplishment and fulfillment.

I want to provide several of our troops with that chance, after returning home to retire their uniforms, and continue on to the next phase of their lives.  My company will offer a safe, creative, and constructive environment for our respected Vets to learn a lasting and lucrative art form, to provide for their families, and find a healthy way to work through the reentry process.


YOUR GENEROSITY

With your help, I am working to raise $80,000 in working capital to cover a 6-month period of the following: salary for 3 veterans, rent, marketing campaign, materials required to produce product for our distributors and showroom, and to finish our website, which will premiere a monthly auction for a one-of-a-kind piece.  Auction proceeds will be donated to a different charity for veterans, each month.

We have several donation and investment levels that are accompanied with unique offers, ranging from beautiful tabletop mini gardens that are sealed in casted resin, original decor pieces, custom furniture preferences, and our high-end exclusively designed casted countertops with your choice of encased designer metals, mummified plants, and exotic hardwoods.  


THE IMPACT

 All funds donated will go towards bringing this vision to life.  Whether we are able to reach our financial goal or come close to it, plans for this venture will move forward.  I believe in this worthwhile endeavor making a huge difference in the lives of many who have given so much of themselves for us, Americans, to be able to fully experience our dreams and lifestyles.  It’s time that we give back to them and make sure that they can provide for themselves and their families, when they come home.  However, I cannot do it alone.  So, please, help me as I travel down this road to improve the lives of many individuals who deserve it, by giving them purpose and a way to continue contributing to society.  Thank you!



OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please, help me get the word out about this campaign so that we can get these incredible individuals training in a new trade and introducing them to a new career.

Don’t forget your indiegogo tools!!!!

And that’s all there is to it!

story:
Poppin' Stop is a family owned gourmet popcorn shop located in Hephzibah, Georgia.  Not only do we serve gourmet popcorn and treats but we use our venue as a cultural hub to host fieldtrips for kids, art events, meetings and much more for the community.  Through our popcorn fundraisers, we've been able to help schools, churches and other organizations raise much needed money.  

We are asking you to invest in our campaign so that we can continue to grow and help our community!

story:
Each of us is an artist of our days; the greater our integrity and awareness, the more original and creative our time will become. 
― John O'Donohue

For years, Saint Mary's School in the heart of downtown Chelsea was home to the Chelsea Center for the Arts. In 1998, the owner of the building - actor Jeff Daniels - gave the organization permission to use the building for its program as long as the non-profit was in business. When the board of directors decided to close its doors, the property went back to Daniels, and the decision was made to sell it.

In 2010, the building (which sits on .43 acres of property at 400 Congdon Rd.) was listed in the National Register of Historic Places. Part of our mission is to restore and continue to care for this 90-year-old building.

We are John and Debra Goodell, and we have lived in this community since 2005. We have a passion for running smart businesses. We have spent time in this building as both participants and supporters, and we know how much this space means to both the immediate neighborhood and the surrounding community.

Our vision for Chelsea Creative Commons includes:

  1. A flexible-use performance space (approximately 4,000 square feet) in the restored Great Hall holding up to 200 moveable seats. Uses might include: theater, music and dance performances; artists residencies (Purple Rose Theater, improvisation troupes); speaker series; town hall meetings; private events; open gym with kid and teen space
  2. A dedicated coworking space for independent workers. Secured keyless access, movable furniture, abundant power outlets, and high speed WiFi make for a flexible and productive environment. Space for private phone calls, a stocked kitchenette, day-use lockers and a multifunction printer/scanner/copier. 
  3. A home to the Chelsea Film Festival, the brainchild of Chelsea Creative Commons with classes and screenings held in the Great Hall on state-of-the-art equipment.
  4. Public green space and community gardens, open to the public year-round. Additional green rooftops will be added during our first year.
  5. Space for intergenerational language immersion programs.
  6. A public gallery and exhibition space (outdoor and indoor).
  7. Residence for homeschool programs and related curriculums.
  8. An open community room: grab a cup of coffee, charge your phone, change a baby, sit and relax.

Have an idea? 

Our team operates on one principal: the best idea wins. 

Check out our Facebook page for thoughts and comments. Share your talents, passion and money. Help us create this place together.

Are you in?

story:
Hello There!

What was your big dream when you were a kid? Do you still have that dream?

We have been dreamers all our lives––and have shared our dream to make the world a more dream-fulfilling place for the most deserving people.

Dream On is a reality TV show with a social purpose. We want to encourage everyday people to dream again and we want to make help those dreams come true.  

Watch the teaser video here 

We have networks and production executives from all over the world who are interested in the show. Now we just need a little help from the global community of dreamers.

Each episode will center around an inspiring dreamer and his/her life story, and some of the personal struggles they have faced along the way.  The dreamer is then met by our Dream On hosts and taken on a journey towards fulfilling their life goal. We will use these individual stories as a platform to explore and raise awareness of various social issues.

Dreams come in different sizes, shapes and magnitudes; at the same time, dreams have no boundaries, no age limit and no discrimination. 

 

The first season will focus on marginalized talents: those who have struggled in life, suffered from unfortunate circumstances yet they are resilient, strong, positive and talented. Dream On's first season is mainly going to be in Hong Kong, although the stories and characters we share are universal. Season two will be expanded to the rest of Asia; season three, the world!

Dream On is more than just a reality series. Our dream is to grow into a community of people, across the globe, who share the same belief and want to do something about their dreams or help someone fulfil their dreams. Dream On is about finding the people with talent and connecting them with different individuals or organisations so they can fulfil their dreams together. 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Season one is a 6-part series, each episode from pre-production to production to post production will cost us $20,000 USD, broken down as follows:

Pre-Production: $2,000 USD

Production: $12,000 USD

Post-Production: $6,000 USD

We are currently pitching the show to TV channels in Asia as well as the US and Europe. We will also explore online distribution opportunities via internet-only and new media companies.

However, we do not wish to compromise on quality. $20,000 USD is a budget for TV quality regardless of whether we broadcast the show on TV or online.

We know that $120,000 USD is an ambitious amount. Therefore, we are doing a flexible funding campaign, where every $20,000 USD raised, we will be able to complete one full episode. 

We have thought long and hard about our rewards program and we decided against any material perks. The essence of Dream On is about the spirit to build a community, we don't necessarily need anything physical to symbolize that. Dream On is all about the soul, love and energy than it is about a t-shirt, mug or CD. As a result, our perks are all intangible and they are something we create from the heart. 

 

 

 

We have put together an advisory board of talented industry veterans to advise and help us along the way:

Paul Jackson: A renowned TV Producer in the UK who has worked with the likes of Gordon Ramsay and Matthew Perry.

Sean Lee Davies: A celebrity host and TV Executive Producer in Asia.

Zoe Rocha: An Emmy Award Winning Producer from the UK.

Ralf Little: Renowned Actor, Writer and Producer from the hit British TV Show 'The Royle Family'.

We are so grateful to have these members believing in us and guiding us, but that's only part of the help. 

This is where we need YOUR help. The more money we can raise, the greater our chances of finding a broadcaster to air our show and the more freedom we will have to create a show that is true to our vision.

"When we dream alone, it's just a dream. When we dream together, it's reality" - John Lennon

Let’s Dream On together!!!!

Risks & Challenges

We are planning a trip to Singapore in September / October 2015 to pitch to international broadcasters. As much as we are doing everything in our power to pitch to them, there is no guaranteed success. Yes we can go on forever and ever to look for interested parties, but we are here to set ourselves a timeline.

If by the end of 2015 / early 2016 if we are unable to find broadcasters who are interested, then we will make this an online series. And this 6 part series would be aimed to air in Q2 of 2016.

We will provide updates along the way using  social media and document our journey throughout.

Also it's not easy to find these Dream On  characters, especially the marginalized individuals who want to share their stories. So besides us looking for Dream On characters in Hong Kong we are also looking for them internationally. If you know of any great stories that would be perfect for Dream On, please feel free to contact us through any of our media channels! 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't help financially, don't fret! Dream On is about building the community regardless of your socio-economical background. Money is just one of many ways you can help. You can still help us by spreading the word! Share, Tweet, Like and talk about Dream On with all your friends. Share the IndieGoGo link with everyone and help us build momentum.

Twitter: @dreamontheshow

Instagram: @dreamontheshow

Nick's Instagram: @nickydaryanani

Nick's Twitter @nickdaryanani

Nat's Instagram: @natnat4eva

Facebook: www.facebook.com/dreamontheshow

This is one of the greatest ways you can help us if you've donated or not. We encourage everyone who believes in Dream On to do this!

 

 

Contact

If you wish to get in contact please access our social media pages or drop us an email: dreamontheshow@gmail.com
story_txt: Hello There!What was your big dream when you were a kid? Do you still have that dream?We have been dreamers all our lives––and have shared our dream to make the world a more dream-fulfilling place for the most deserving people.Dream On is a reality TV show with a social purpose. We want to encourage everyday people to dream again and we want to make help those dreams come true.  Watch the teaser video here We have networks and production executives from all over the world who are interested in the show. Now we just need a little help from the global community of dreamers.Each episode will center around an inspiring dreamer and his/her life story, and some of the personal struggles they have faced along the way.  The dreamer is then met by our Dream On hosts and taken on a journey towards fulfilling their life goal. We will use these individual stories as a platform to explore and raise awareness of various social issues.Dreams come in different sizes, shapes and magnitudes; at the same time, dreams have no boundaries, no age limit and no discrimination.  The first season will focus on marginalized talents: those who have struggled in life, suffered from unfortunate circumstances yet they are resilient, strong, positive and talented. Dream On's first season is mainly going to be in Hong Kong, although the stories and characters we share are universal. Season two will be expanded to the rest of Asia; season three, the world!Dream On is more than just a reality series. Our dream is to grow into a community of people, across the globe, who share the same belief and want to do something about their dreams or help someone fulfil their dreams. Dream On is about finding the people with talent and connecting them with different individuals or organisations so they can fulfil their dreams together.    What We Need & What You GetSeason one is a 6-part series, each episode from pre-production to production to post production will cost us $20,000 USD, broken down as follows:Pre-Production: $2,000 USDProduction: $12,000 USDPost-Production: $6,000 USDWe are currently pitching the show to TV channels in Asia as well as the US and Europe. We will also explore online distribution opportunities via internet-only and new media companies.However, we do not wish to compromise on quality. $20,000 USD is a budget for TV quality regardless of whether we broadcast the show on TV or online.We know that $120,000 USD is an ambitious amount. Therefore, we are doing a flexible funding campaign, where every $20,000 USD raised, we will be able to complete one full episode. We have thought long and hard about our rewards program and we decided against any material perks. The essence of Dream On is about the spirit to build a community, we don't necessarily need anything physical to symbolize that. Dream On is all about the soul, love and energy than it is about a t-shirt, mug or CD. As a result, our perks are all intangible and they are something we create from the heart.    We have put together an advisory board of talented industry veterans to advise and help us along the way:Paul Jackson: A renowned TV Producer in the UK who has worked with the likes of Gordon Ramsay and Matthew Perry.Sean Lee Davies: A celebrity host and TV Executive Producer in Asia.Zoe Rocha: An Emmy Award Winning Producer from the UK.Ralf Little: Renowned Actor, Writer and Producer from the hit British TV Show 'The Royle Family'.We are so grateful to have these members believing in us and guiding us, but that's only part of the help. This is where we need YOUR help. The more money we can raise, the greater our chances of finding a broadcaster to air our show and the more freedom we will have to create a show that is true to our vision."When we dream alone, it's just a dream. When we dream together, it's reality" - John LennonLet’s Dream On together!!!!Risks & ChallengesWe are planning a trip to Singapore in September / October 2015 to pitch to international broadcasters. As much as we are doing everything in our power to pitch to them, there is no guaranteed success. Yes we can go on forever and ever to look for interested parties, but we are here to set ourselves a timeline.If by the end of 2015 / early 2016 if we are unable to find broadcasters who are interested, then we will make this an online series. And this 6 part series would be aimed to air in Q2 of 2016.We will provide updates along the way using  social media and document our journey throughout.Also it's not easy to find these Dream On  characters, especially the marginalized individuals who want to share their stories. So besides us looking for Dream On characters in Hong Kong we are also looking for them internationally. If you know of any great stories that would be perfect for Dream On, please feel free to contact us through any of our media channels!    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't help financially, don't fret! Dream On is about building the community regardless of your socio-economical background. Money is just one of many ways you can help. You can still help us by spreading the word! Share, Tweet, Like and talk about Dream On with all your friends. Share the IndieGoGo link with everyone and help us build momentum.Twitter: @dreamontheshowInstagram: @dreamontheshowNick's Instagram: @nickydaryananiNick's Twitter @nickdaryananiNat's Instagram: @natnat4evaFacebook: www.facebook.com/dreamontheshowThis is one of the greatest ways you can help us if you've donated or not. We encourage everyone who believes in Dream On to do this!  ContactIf you wish to get in contact please access our social media pages or drop us an email: dreamontheshow@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

'Beit Yehuda' was built in 1877 in one of the then-new neighborhoods in Jerusalem, outside the Old City walls.  It has an antique look and feel and its almost 140 years of history give it a unique ambiance. Its traditional feel, simplicity and warmth attract all kinds of Jews, making it a unique meeting place for all sects, each of which finds his place here. 

My name is David Engelhart, and I am one of the gabai'm, or administrators, of this synagogue. My friends and I have volunteered to manage it and its activity. We have a lot on our hands if we want to keep this unique synagogue up and running. And when dealing with such sensitive and meaningful material, we need to make sure we invest enough, and invest wisely.

Supporting this project is first and foremost an incredible merit - a piece of Jerusalem's history will be carried on, with your help.
Even more so when we are talking about a shul, a place of prayer and Torah learning, which has great potential to serve the neighborhood, which is gradually regentrifying.


What We Need 

We need funding for a general renovation of the structure itself, including:

  • Fixing the roof after 2 winters of rain damage
  • Providing respectable bathrooms, especially for the women's section
  • Renovating the utilities for safer and cleaner use
  • A new entrance
  • Fixing up and cleaning of the courtyard 
  • Cleaning and preserving the original stone floor
  • And much more
Anyone who is inclined to make a specific contribution to honor or commemorate a loved one (e.g., furniture, entrance, etc.) is welcome to contact me for more details and possibilities.
No money goes to any personal cause, everything will be invested in the shul whether the goal is reached or not.

A Bit More About "Beit Yehuda"

This shul is one of the few Ashkenazi shuls in the area. In the past, it housed the "Torat Yerushalayim" yeshiva, which was a branch of Rabbi A.I. Kook's Merkaz HaRav yeshiva. More recently it was known as one of the shuls where the Tzitz Eliezer, Rabbi Eliezer Yehuda Waldenburg was known to daven.
It was an active community shul and beit midrash for decades. Recently, however, the original population died out or moved away, and currently a handful of committed congregants are striving to rejuvinate it.
The shul's furniture is intact since the 1930s. The walls all around were decorated by a famous Jerusalem painter, Yitzchak Beck, with beautiful drawings of four of Israel's holy sites, one on each wall.
In the shul we found old books stored away, some dating back to over 200 years ago! 
The shul has a spacious yard with an opening to an old water cistern. People are shocked to know that such a place exists, as it is quite hidden away from the main streets.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Does our cause speak to you?

  • We would appreciate your donation, big or small, every little bit moves us forward!
  • Please! Share our cause with others, this is also a great help. You can make use of the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
English

VER EN ESPAÑOL

In short: Help us transform a community

  • The problem: Globally, the lack of secure sanitation takes the lives of more than five thousands each day, 90% of them are children under five years old. In Ecuador, there are 3 million people without access to secure sanitation; most of them live in rural and semiurban areas where traditional alternatives are not adequate due to high costs and abundant water consumption. 

  • The solution: To tackle this problem, Fundacion In Terris co-developed and promotes a Decentralized Sanitation Unit (DSU), which includes a pedal-operated ecological toilet that is 100% decentralized, doesn’t require water or energy to operate and transforms human waste into compost. It's comfortable and safe, it's  adequate for rural areas where centralized sewage systems are unavailable or would be too expensive

  • A tough reality: There exists a gap between the costs of adequate sanitation solutions and the capacity of payment of those who lack access to it. That’s why they tend to use improvised and unsafe solutions. 

  • A community to prove our subsidy+microfinance model: La Unión is a small rural community with 200 families who lack access to adequate sanitation and clean water. They are committed to change their situation by paying a $10 monthly fee to finance 30% of their DSU.

  • Your contribution: To eliminate this gap and finance the remaining 70%, we propose a Mixed Contribution Scheme in which everyone contributes: the local government (subsidy), private companies and YOU, to deliver a DSU to each family that will include the toilet, a urinary, and a rainwater collection system.  

The problem

The solution

The Decentralized Sanitation Unit provides safe and sustainable sanitation and captures rain water for handwashing. Is a comfortable and safe. It includes the “Taladro de la Tierra” a pedal-operated urine diverting dry toilet which works through an internal auger that oxygenates, dehydrates and mixes waste with sawdust transforming it into plant fertilizer (compost). 

An awards winner solution co-developed by Fundación In Terris, Critical Practices LLC and Ambiente Creativo.


¿Why do we need your contribution?

There exists a gap between the cost of an adequate sanitation solution and what people have in their pockets.

Here is where we propose that all of us join forces to achieve a sustainable solution.

We called it MIXED CONTRIBUTION. It is a shared responsibility, and the benefits impact us all, that’s why we should all put a piece of the puzzle, even YOU…

This time we will try our model in La Unión, a small rural community of 200 families. They don’t have access to drinkable water or sanitation. They depend on fishing, with an average income of $200 per family per month. They have committed to pay a USD$10 monthly fee for 20 months. This is a great effort for them, but its only 30% of the total cost of the DSU.


We think sanitation is a shared problem. That’s why we are launching this mixed contribution campaign, in which public institutions, companies, NGOs and small donors will contribute to provide adequate sanitation for this community.

  • To achieve the installation of 50 toilets, we need USD$42.650. Each Decentralized Sanitation Unit costs USD$694,50, which includes the Earth Auger sanitation system and a functional housing (see next section). 
  • Hogar de Cristo, an ONG that provides hundreds of houses annually in Ecuador, and Rotary Club, have already committed over USD$12.000 in funding. We expect that through a combination of funding from local public institutions, private companies and small donors such as you, we will achieve an estimate of USD$21.650. This includes the transportation and installation of the 50 toilets, plus additional central costs (i.e: communication, this campaign, monitoring and documentation expenses)
  • If additional funding is achieved, we will be able to donate more toilets to the community. If the required funds are not totally gathered, we will install the proportional amount of toilets.

¿What will the beneficiary receive?

  • Each family  will get:

-1 (one) Taladro de la Tierra system

-1 (one) cabin where to install the toilet
-Complementary accessories such as:
   -Cover material supply (sawdust)
   -2 (two) containers for collecting and storing compost
   -1 (one) rainwater collection system
   -1 (one) sink
   -1 (one) urinary


¿How we will use funds?

  • We will deliver a DSU for every $454,30 collected through Crowdfunding+local governments+other donants.
  • After the 50 units have been reached, 1 toilet will be installed for every $694,30 collected through Crowdfunding+local governments+private companies+other donors. This is because Hogar de Cristo’s funds are only for 50 units.

¿What will you get if you help us  help them?

Every donor will receive a customized digital postcard of the family they helped. A final video will be prepared and sent, in which each family thanks the donors that helped them get a DSU.

Other ways in which you can help

If you aren't in conditions to contribute economically during this campaign, don't worry. There are other ways in which you can help us achieve this great goal:
  • Share this opportunity so that your friends and families can also contribute.
  • Visit www.fundacioninterris.org and share information about this innovative solution.
Fundacion In Terris and Ambiente Creativo
WE ARE GOOD ON WHAT WE DO
In Terris and Ambiente Creativo constitute a hybrid model of work. The team has over 10 years of experience in the development of projects related to eco-efficiency and sustainable development.

Our work has been recognized

  • Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation : Grand Challenge Exploration (2011) and Reinventing the Toilet (2013)
  • Premios Latinoamérica Verde (2013)
  • Frequent participation in congresses and conferences about sanitation and sustainable development.
  • Our work has had had  broad coverage in the national press (El Mercurio, El Extra, El Universo, Construya, El Comercio, El Telégrafo, El Expreso) and international press (Yahoo News, Harvard Kennedy School, Washington Post)


Our model



Español

En pocas palabras: Ayúdanos a transformar una comunidad

  • El problema: La falta de acceso a saneamiento adecuado mata más de 5mil personas al día, el 90% son niños menores de 5 años. En Ecuador hay 3 millones de personas sin acceso a saneamiento seguro, la mayoría de ellos en ubicados en sectores rurales y periurbanos donde el sanitario común y las soluciones convencionales no son una alternativa por su alto consumo de agua y por el alto costo.

  • La solución: Fundacion In Terris co-desarrolló y promueve la Unidad de Saneamiento Descentralizado (USD), que incluye un sanitario ecológico operado por un pedal, que es 100% descentralizado, no requiere ni agua ni energía para operar, y convierte los desechos en fertilizante para plantas. Es además cómodo y seguro, y es adecuado para zonas rurales donde los sistemas de saneamiento centrales no están disponibles o serían demasiado costosos.

  • Una dura realidad: Existe una brecha entre lo que cuesta una solución sanitaria adecuada y la capacidad de pago de quienes no tienen acceso al saneamiento. Por eso optan por soluciones improvisadas y riesgosas.

  • Una comunidad: La Unión es una comunidad rural de 200 familias, que no tiene acceso a saneamiento adecuado ni a agua potable. Ellos se han comprometido a cambiar su situación aportando $10 mensuales por familia, para cubrir el 30% del costo de una USD.

  • Tu aporte: Para eliminar esta brecha y cubrir el restante 70%, proponemos un esquema de RECAUDACIÓN MIXTA en el que TODOS contribuimos: el gobierno local (subsidio), la empresa privada y TÚ, para entregar a cada familia una Unidad que incluirá sanitario, urinario, y sistema de captación de aguas lluvias.

El problema

La Solución

La Unidad de Saneamiento Descentralizado provee saneamiento seguro y sostenible, y captura agua de lluvia para el lavado de manos. Es cómodo y seguro. Incluye el “Taladro de la Tierra” un sanitario seco con separador de orina que funciona a través de un taladro interno que oxigena, deshidrata y mezcla los desechos con aserrín, transformándolos en abono para plantas.

 Es una solución ganadora de diversos premios que fue co-desarrollada por Fundación In Terris, Critical Practices LLC y Ambiente Creativo. 



¿Por qué necesitamos tu contribución?

Existe una "brecha" entre el costo de una solución adecuada y el dinero que tienen los pobres en sus bolsillos. 

Aquí es donde proponemos que todos unamos fuerzas para desplegar una solución sostenible. Lo llamamos CONTRIBUCIÓN MIXTA. Esta es una responsabilidad compartida, y los beneficios nos impactan a todos, por lo que todo el mundo puede poner una pieza en el rompecabezas, incluso tú... 

Esta vez vamos a probar nuestro modelo en La Unión, una comunidad rural de 200 familias. No tienen acceso a agua potable ni saneamiento. Ellos dependen de la pesca, con un ingreso promedio por familia de $200 al mes. Ellos se han comprometido en el pago de $ 10 por mes durante 20 meses para conseguir un aseo. Esto es un gran esfuerzo para ellos, pero es sólo el 30% del costo total. 

Contribución mixta

Creemos que el saneamiento es un problema de todos. Es por que proponemos este esquema de contribución mixta, en el que instituciones públicas, compañías, ONG y pequeños donantes podrán contribuir para proveer saneamiento adecuado a estas familias.

  • Para alcanzar 50 unidades, necesitamos USD$42.650. Cada Unidad de Saneamiento Descentralizado tiene un costo de USD$694,50, valor que incluye el Taladro de la Tierra y una caseta funcional (Ver siguiente sección).
  • Hogar de Cristo, una ONG que provee cientos de casas anualmente en Ecuador, y el Rotary Club, ya han comprometido más de USD$12.000 en financiamiento. Esperamos que, a través de una combinación de financiamento de instituciones públicas, compañías privadas y pequeños donantes como tú, lograremos un estimado de USD$21.650. Esto incluye el transporte e instalación de 50 unidades, más costos adicionales. (Por ejemplo: comunicación, esta campaña, costos de monitoreo y documentación)
  • Si se logra recaudar financiamiento adicional a la meta, podremos donar más sanitarios a esta comunidad. Si los fondos requeridos no se completan, instalaremos la cantidad proporcional de sanitarios.

¿Qué recibirá el beneficiario?


  • Cada familia recibirá:

-1 (una) sanitario taladro de la tierra

-1 (una) caseta donde se instalará el sanitario

-Accesorios complementarios como:

   -Material de cobertura

   -2 (dos) contenedores para recolectar y almacenar el abono

   -1 (un) sistema de recolección de agua lluvia 

   -1 (un) lavamanos 

   -1 (un) urinario

¿Cómo van a ser usados los fondos?

  • Entregamos una unidad por cada  $454,30 colectados a través de Crowdfunding+gobiernos locales+otros donantes.
  • Una vez que se alcancen 50 unidades, 1  sanitario será instalado por cada $694,30 recaudados a través de Crowdfunding+gobiernos locales+compañías privadas+otros donantes. Esto es porque los fondos Hogar de Cristo’s funds son solo para 50 unidades.

¿Qué recibirás si nos ayudas a ayudarlos?

Cada donante recibirá una postal digital personalizada de la familia a la que ayudó. Un video final será preparado y  enviado, en el que la familia agradece a las personas que le ayudaron a conseguir su sanitario.

Otras formas en que puedes ayudar

Si no estás en condiciones para contribuir económicamente durante esta campaña, no te preocupes. Hay otras formas en que nos puedes ayudar a conseguir esta meta:

  • Comparte esta oportunidad con tus amigos y  familiares que podrían contribuir.
  • Visita www.fundacioninterris.org y comparte información sobre esta solución innovadora.

Fundacion In Terris y Ambiente Creativo

SABEMOS LO QUE HACEMOS

In Terris y Ambiente Creativo constituyen un modelo híbrido de trabajo. El equipo tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos de Eco-eficiencia y Desarrollo Sostenible.


Nuestro trabajo ha sido reconocido

  • Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation : Grand Challenge Exploration (2011) and Reinventing the Toilet (2013)
  • Premios Latinoamérica Verde (2013)
  • Frequent participation in congresses and conferences about sanitation and sustainable development.
  • Nuestro trabajo tiene amplia cobertura de prensa nacional (El Mercurio, El Extra, El Universo, Construya, El Comercio, El Telgrafo, El Expreso) e internacional  (Yahoo News, Harvard Kennedy School, Washington Post)

Nuestro modelo

Visit www.fundacioninterris.org and share information about this innovative solution.
Fundacion In Terris and Ambiente Creativo

WE ARE GOOD ON WHAT WE DO
In Terris and Ambiente Creativo constitute a hybrid model of work. The team has over 10 years of experience in the development of projects related to eco-efficiency and sustainable development.


Our work has been recognized



Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation : Grand Challenge Exploration (2011) and Reinventing the Toilet (2013)


Premios Latinoamérica Verde (2013)


Frequent participation in congresses and conferences about sanitation and sustainable development.


Our work has had had  broad coverage in the national press (El Mercurio, El Extra, El Universo, Construya, El Comercio, El Telégrafo, El Expreso) and international press (Yahoo News, Harvard Kennedy School, Washington Post)






Our model










Español



En pocas palabras: Ayúdanos a transformar una comunidad

El problema: La falta de acceso a saneamiento adecuado mata más de 5mil personas al día, el 90% son niños menores de 5 años. En Ecuador hay 3 millones de personas sin acceso a saneamiento seguro, la mayoría de ellos en ubicados en sectores rurales y periurbanos donde el sanitario común y las soluciones convencionales no son una alternativa por su alto consumo de agua y por el alto costo.

La solución: Fundacion In Terris co-desarrolló y promueve la Unidad de Saneamiento Descentralizado (USD), que incluye un sanitario ecológico operado por un pedal, que es 100% descentralizado, no requiere ni agua ni energía para operar, y convierte los desechos en fertilizante para plantas. Es además cómodo y seguro, y es adecuado para zonas rurales donde los sistemas de saneamiento centrales no están disponibles o serían demasiado costosos.


Una dura realidad: Existe una brecha entre lo que cuesta una solución sanitaria adecuada y la capacidad de pago de quienes no tienen acceso al saneamiento. Por eso optan por soluciones improvisadas y riesgosas.
Una comunidad: La Unión es una comunidad rural de 200 familias, que no tiene acceso a saneamiento adecuado ni a agua potable. Ellos se han comprometido a cambiar su situación aportando $10 mensuales por familia, para cubrir el 30% del costo de una USD.


Tu aporte: Para eliminar esta brecha y cubrir el restante 70%, proponemos un esquema de RECAUDACIÓN MIXTA en el que TODOS contribuimos: el gobierno local (subsidio), la empresa privada y TÚ, para entregar a cada familia una Unidad que incluirá sanitario, urinario, y sistema de captación de aguas lluvias.




El problema

La Solución



La Unidad de Saneamiento Descentralizado provee saneamiento seguro y sostenible, y captura agua de lluvia para el lavado de manos. Es cómodo y seguro. Incluye el “Taladro de la Tierra” un sanitario seco con separador de orina que funciona a través de un taladro interno que oxigena, deshidrata y mezcla los desechos con aserrín, transformándolos en abono para plantas.
 Es una solución ganadora de diversos premios que fue co-desarrollada por Fundación In Terris, Critical Practices LLC y Ambiente Creativo. 









¿Por qué necesitamos tu contribución?
Existe una "brecha" entre el costo de una solución adecuada y el dinero que tienen los pobres en sus bolsillos. 


Aquí es donde proponemos que todos unamos fuerzas para desplegar una solución sostenible. Lo llamamos CONTRIBUCIÓN MIXTA. Esta es una responsabilidad compartida, y los beneficios nos impactan a todos, por lo que todo el mundo puede poner una pieza en el rompecabezas, incluso tú... 
Esta vez vamos a probar nuestro modelo en La Unión, una comunidad rural de 200 familias. No tienen acceso a agua potable ni saneamiento. Ellos dependen de la pesca, con un ingreso promedio por familia de $200 al mes. Ellos se han comprometido en el pago de $ 10 por mes durante 20 meses para conseguir un aseo. Esto es un gran esfuerzo para ellos, pero es sólo el 30% del costo total. 

Contribución mixta
Creemos que el saneamiento es un problema de todos. Es por que proponemos este esquema de contribución mixta, en el que instituciones públicas, compañías, ONG y pequeños donantes podrán contribuir para proveer saneamiento adecuado a estas familias.



Para alcanzar 50 unidades, necesitamos USD$42.650. Cada Unidad de Saneamiento Descentralizado tiene un costo de USD$694,50, valor que incluye el Taladro de la Tierra y una caseta funcional (Ver siguiente sección).


Hogar de Cristo, una ONG que provee cientos de casas anualmente en Ecuador, y el Rotary Club, ya han comprometido más de USD$12.000 en financiamiento. Esperamos que, a través de una combinación de financiamento de instituciones públicas, compañías privadas y pequeños donantes como tú, lograremos un estimado de USD$21.650. Esto incluye el transporte e instalación de 50 unidades, más costos adicionales. (Por ejemplo: comunicación, esta campaña, costos de monitoreo y documentación)

Si se logra recaudar financiamiento adicional a la meta, podremos donar más sanitarios a esta comunidad. Si los fondos requeridos no se completan, instalaremos la cantidad proporcional de sanitarios.









¿Qué recibirá el beneficiario?






Cada familia recibirá:-1 (una) sanitario taladro de la tierra
-1 (una) caseta donde se instalará el sanitario
-Accesorios complementarios como:
   -Material de cobertura
   -2 (dos) contenedores para recolectar y almacenar el abono
   -1 (un) sistema de recolección de agua lluvia 
   -1 (un) lavamanos 
   -1 (un) urinario



¿Cómo van a ser usados los fondos?


Entregamos una unidad por cada  $454,30 colectados a través de Crowdfunding+gobiernos locales+otros donantes.
Una vez que se alcancen 50 unidades, 1  sanitario será instalado por cada $694,30 recaudados a través de Crowdfunding+gobiernos locales+compañías privadas+otros donantes. Esto es porque los fondos Hogar de Cristo’s funds son solo para 50 unidades.


¿Qué recibirás si nos ayudas a ayudarlos?
Cada donante recibirá una postal digital personalizada de la familia a la que ayudó. Un video final será preparado y  enviado, en el que la familia agradece a las personas que le ayudaron a conseguir su sanitario.
Otras formas en que puedes ayudar

Si no estás en condiciones para contribuir económicamente durante esta campaña, no te preocupes. Hay otras formas en que nos puedes ayudar a conseguir esta meta:


Comparte esta oportunidad con tus amigos y  familiares que podrían contribuir.
Visita www.fundacioninterris.org y comparte información sobre esta solución innovadora.


Fundacion In Terris y Ambiente Creativo
SABEMOS LO QUE HACEMOS

In Terris y Ambiente Creativo constituyen un modelo híbrido de trabajo. El equipo tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos de Eco-eficiencia y Desarrollo Sostenible.



Nuestro trabajo ha sido reconocido


Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation : Grand Challenge Exploration (2011) and Reinventing the Toilet (2013)
Premios Latinoamérica Verde (2013)
Frequent participation in congresses and conferences about sanitation and sustainable development.
Nuestro trabajo tiene amplia cobertura de prensa nacional (El Mercurio, El Extra, El Universo, Construya, El Comercio, El Telgrafo, El Expreso) e internacional  (Yahoo News, Harvard Kennedy School, Washington Post)




Nuestro modelo

story:
Help us create MeaningfulAct: an online social community based on #gratitude

You'll be able to send a private, personal card to someone who has affected your life: whether a mentor or teacher, or someone you've admired from afar. You can create an entire page to someone, including video, pics and personal notes, and invite other people who know them to contribute their stories and appreciation. Like a personal yearbook that grows with you, the site offers collective timelines based on how we've affected others, not only how we see ourselves.

Take the awkwardness out of the positively personal by sharing on a site dedicated to helping you express appreciation. You'll have complete control of your privacy and sharing options - you’ll share your gratitude(s) with only those who you want to, when you want to. 

It's designed to be immersive like a great lecture, good book, or deep conversation with a friend. We call this Slow Social Media: Something to Savor, not just something to scan.

Whether your parent or your child, an old friend or a new one, we all benefit from telling people what they've meant to us and hearing how we've positively influenced others.

Appreciation is contagious; help us #spread the good stuff.


Backstory

Last summer, my dad was preparing for heart surgery. Along with  intense medical questions about whether or not he would want to be resuscitated, he had his own intensely personal questions: Did I live a meaningful life? Did I affect people?

That’s when I realized: we need a space for this. Before the emergency surgery or the retirement, the graduation or the remission, we need a space to let those people in our lives know: You Affected Me.

I spent five years working in hospice, spending time with people in their dying process and learning a heck of a lot about living. I learned that there’s still time… until there isn’t. Don’t wait. It’s never too soon to tell someone how they have positively impacted your life.


The Goal of this Campaign

Together, we can develop and build an inspiring online community  to encourage, support, and spread expressions of gratitude. We have a great team in place, ready to work and make it happen upon funding.


Other Ways to Support MeaningfulAct

  • Share this campaign with friends, family, and colleagues! (You can use the share tools on this page, or here's the link for your convenience: http://igg.me/at/meaningfulact)

  • Blog or write  about our  campaign—we're open to answering questions, bearing our souls, providing witty and pithy quotes - whatever it takes to #spreadthegoodstuff (please contact Mark Cohen at mark @ meaningfulact.com).

  • Follow us on Twitter, @actofgratitude,  use the hashtag #gratitude, and #spreadthegoodstuff

  • Start thinking about who has positively affected your life and let them know. Feel the warmth.


What If We Surpass Our Goal?

If we surpass our website development goal of $60,000, we’ll be able to increase our marketing budget to reach more people sooner and spread the good stuff to where it’s needed most. (We’ll also be forever grateful to each and every one of you!)


Why Flexible Funding?

We chose to use flexible funding in this campaign so people could have the option of paying with credit cards. In the case we don't reach our development goal of $60,000, the money will go towards developing a beta version of the site and offer evidence of market for future financing. Basically, we’re going to build this thing sooner or later. It’s just too important a project to let it remain unexpressed.


Questions

To ask questions about this campaign, please email Kate Sadowsky at kate@meaningfulact.com.


Perks

Do good, and look good doing it. 

Contribute $15 and spread the good stuff with this static cling sticker

Contribute $25 and get some help saying Thanks to the people in your life with our Fill-In-the-Blank appreciation cards.

Contribute $50 and choose a tee that speaks for you (men's and women's sizes available, in all three taglines)

Contribute $100 and get sleeves on that tee. Choose your slogan. Men's and women's sizes.

Contribute $150 and warm your body along with your heart



Our Campaign in the News
