story:
Who We Are

At the Studio Creative Group, we believe that anyone with a passion for the performing arts deserves the chance to perform at their absolute best. Whether it is stage, screen, or voice acting; dancing, singing, or even filmmaking, we are here to provide performers with tools to enhance their skills. No matter where you are in your journey as a performer, you will find a home within our community of dedicated artists. 

The Studio Creative Group is the brainchild of husband and wife team, Joey and Allison Maxwell. Together, they bring over 40 years of performing experience to the table. From ballet to voice over, stage to screen, creation to performance, this duo has done it all! 

We are, at our core, a place for dreamers and doers to come together and create. Whether you're looking to hone a craft, have some fun, or create some magic, The Studio Creative Group can help make your dream a reality. 

But we can't do it alone.  Walt Disney said, "You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make that dream a reality." Through a community of teachers and students, contributors and creators, we can make this dream a reality. 

What We Do

We will be offering two different types of classes in order to make the performing arts not only accessible to everyone, but also effective for performers of all skill levels. 

Master Classes - Purchase your Master Class Perk and Save!

These courses are taught as an 8 week series by the most highly qualified instructors in the region. Available only by pre-registration, these highly interactive Master Classes are designed as progressive courses of study, helping performers master their craft along the way. With a heavy focus on the techniques required for each discipline, artists will learn the tools necessary to develop, enhance, and perfect their skills on-stage, on-camera, or behind the microphone. ​

We offer Master Classes in...

Acting

Introduction to Acting Techniques - Mondays and Wednesdays from 8pm to 10pm. Classes Start on Monday, September 11th, 2017!

Advanced Acting Techniques - Tuesdays and Thursdays from 8pm to 10pm. Classes Start on Tuesday, September 12th, 2017!

Voiceover

Getting Started in Voiceover - Tuesdays and Thursdays from 6pm to 8pm. Classes Start on Monday, September 11th, 2017!

Voice

Vocal Performance - Thursdays and Fridays from 6pm to 8pm. Classes Start on Thursday, September 14th, 2017!

Weekly Workouts - Discounts Available for One or More Workouts in the Perks!

Designed for performers of all skill levels, our Weekly Workouts are a fun and exciting way to practice your craft in a safe and comfortable environment. These are drop-in courses with no commitment or attendance requirement. You are welcome to join us for as many or as few workouts as you need. Each week, performers will gather together to practice their craft in a group setting, guided by one of our highly experienced and qualified coaches. During the workouts, you will each perform in front of the group, with an opportunity for each workout member to give constructive feedback. These sessions allow you to not only enhance your skills, but your critical eye and ear as well, further enhancing your own performance. ​

Weekly Workouts will be offered in multiple disciplines...​

Acting

Monologues - Tuesdays from 7pm to 8pm. Classes Start on Tuesday, September 12th, 2017!

Scenes - Thursdays from 9:30pm to 10:30pm. Classes Start on Thursday, September 14th, 2017!

On-Camera  - Fridays from 9:30pm to 10;30pm. Classes Start on Friday, September 15th, 2017!

Vocals​

Solo Singing - Fridays from 7:30pm to 8:30pm. Classes Start on Friday, September 15th, 2017!

Ensemble Singing - Fridays from 8:30pm to 9:30pm. Classes Start on Thursday, September 14th, 2017!

Voiceover

Voiceover Workout - Tuesdays from 6pm to 7pm. Classes Start on Thursday, September 12th, 2017!

As a film production company, we are also able to offer performers added bonuses, like audition and reel taping, casting services, and even the opportunity to appear in our commercial and film projects! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our first fundraising goal is $15,000. With that, we could secure the physical space to house The Studio, furnish it, buy the light bulbs, the chairs, and the coffee. We have found a great location big enough to provide classrooms, a dance studio, a sound stage, a recording studio, and a green room.

Of course, that is just the beginning. Anything above and beyond our initial goal will go toward making The Studio bigger and better! State of the art video and recording equipment. Top of the line sprung floors, designed to absorb shock, enhance performance, and reduce the risk of injury.  A Keurig for the Green Room. The ability to provide a wider array of classes with Master instructors in a decked out professional studio space.  

The Studio Creative Group is the only place of its kind in the region. A unique place where you can explore, learn, and perfect your craft in a one stop shop experience designed for all genres of the performing arts, guided and directed by a staff that are truly experts in their fields.  Whether you are gearing up for an audition, exercising your skills in the off season, or simply looking for a fun new hobby, The Studio has you covered! No matter your goals or skill level, you'll find a warm and inviting place to explore and create. 

Any funds raised will go directly into making The Studio a reality, in whatever capacity allowed. That may mean subletting a different space, foregoing a green room, sharing a microphone, or trading in our Keurig for an old fashioned coffee pot. But our commitment to the Performing Arts community and providing top notch classes with expert instructors remains. 

Risks & Challenges

Any dream or new venture comes with risks and challenges. For The Studio, the biggest challenge we face is a sustainable enrollment in classes. And that's where you come in. We named our company The Studio Creative Group because we truly want this to be a group and a community of passionate artists learning, creating, and having fun together. Right now, The Studio is a "group" of two. We want a group of two hundred. By contributing, enrolling in classes, lending your time and expertise, we can overcome this challenge and grow The Studio Creative Group into a true tour de force in the Performing arts community.

We are passionate and hardworking, and have dedicated our lives to learning, creating, and turning ideas into realities. We truly believe that we have a plan and an idea that will revolutionize performing arts in our area, bring people together, and that we can offer an invaluable service to the region. Whether its choreographing dances or making movies, we have relied on intuition, creativity, and hard work to get the job done. And now, we’re reaching out to like-minded individuals to help make this dream a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't make a difference! 

If you can't make a donation, there are still ways to help! Get out there and make some noise! Share our campaign on your social media, tell your neighbor, grab a paintbrush and put your artistic flair on The Studio walls.

story:
Short Summary

Klase’ Beauty Supply’s focuses on creating a destination for customers seeking exceptional, quality hair and beauty products. This company prides itself on providing high customer satisfaction by rendering excellent customer service, quality products, and an enjoyable atmosphere for consumers. Coca Chanel said it best, “A girl should be two things Classy & Fabulous.” With there being only one beauty supply store in the Byram area, this company will convenience those who are seeking a beauty supply store that caters especially to their needs and those who can never seem to get off work early enough to catch the beauty supply store before it closes. The demand and support from community members, family, and friends; as well as, my ambitions to open a friendly, community-based beauty supply store, has made Klase’ Beauty Supply, LLC one of great potential.

I am the owner, Shonte Perry and I have worked diligently to make this business successful. I have acquired a good amount of clientele from advertising the business on social media. I have what it takes to excel beyond the customer's expectations. Klase’ Beauty Supply expects its growing reputation to lead to new clients that support the company’s anticipated growth. In January of this year, I was laid off from my job of 3 years. My mom suffered a heart attack and survived a quadruple bypass surgery, I have faced several challenges this year. After researching and considering the positives over the negatives, I decided to pursue my dream and open my beauty supply store. Many are afraid of the risks and challenges associated with this type of company, but I am up for the challenge. I am very passionate and knowledgeable about the beauty supply industry and eager to acquire many new skills as I travel along this journey.

What We Need & What You Get

In addition to the donations received from Indiegogo, I have also started a raffle fundraiser in which I will be giving the winner a Bobbi Boss Wig from the product line that will feature in the store. I am requesting $1000. My total start-up expenses are estimated to be $38,000. However, I have completed the process of drafting a business plan to apply for a line of credit. $450 + $30 app fee = $480 is to take storefront location off the market. The remaining $520 will be put into a business account and used for the purchase of liability insurance and utility expenses. 

The Impact

Beauty Supply Stores have experienced overall growth over the past five years, despite a few bumps in the road during the recession. Rising disposable income levels and new product introductions will continue to support revenue growth moving forward. Nevertheless, competition is on the rise from the Korean and Asian communities. Revenue growth is expected to improve over the next five years, growing at an average annual rate of 3.2% to $58.7 billion. There is a disparity of African American owned beauty supply stores. Many like myself are realizing that upon entering individual stores, many do not have products that cater to our needs and many store owners lack the customer service required to keep customers coming back. I started an online hair extension store and began to generate a lot of consumer support. I decided to stop being the middle man and look for ways to own my store. In the Hinds County MS area, there are several African American Hair Extensions Stores, but none are full beauty supply stores. My goal is to bring Hinds County, its first African American Owned Beauty Supply Store in a great city that is rapidly expanding. 

Risks & Challenges

Running a beauty supply store involves long work hours, and it can also be tiring physically, particularly when stock needs moving and re-arranging. Owning any small business in a struggling economy is difficult. But when your passion is beauty and hair care, why not follow it while being able to make a living doing something you love. Sure, getting off the ground is a hassle, but once that initial investment goes through we will be up and running. The fees incurred when maintaining any small business add up as weeks and months progress. Two kinds will typically visit the store: return and walk-ins. The majority of this business may rely on return customers (those who come in and see the same smiling face with exceptional customer service skills every few weeks or months). Having discounts for consumers is a great way to show how you love anyone who gives the store repeat business. Walk-ins are always welcome. There will be display prices near the entrance of the storefront, along with promotions. This process will help attract new business. POS software for beauty supply stores makes keeping records of discounts and promotions incredibly simple. Above all else – beauty supply stores, just like many other small businesses, have to stay hip to current trends. Informing my sales associates of the latest name brand product information will be beneficial in driving up sales. Offering different incentives (door prizes, gift cards, discounts, etc.) will appeal to a variety of my potential customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

I have started a fundraiser raffle, and I am looking forward to in the future generating enough revenue to give back to the community, sponsor programs that help encourage young ladies to be classy & successful. I have a social media platform already set up for my business. I plan to create other strategies to become more active in the company to get consumers a chance to understand that Klase' Beauty Supply, LLC is not just a store we are a community that dares anyone to dream!! Please be sure to check us out on Facebook & Twitter @klasebeautysupplyllc. SHARE, SHARE, SHARE *** A little bit can go a long way ***
story_txt:
Short Summary
Klase’ Beauty Supply’s focuses on creating a destination for customers seeking exceptional, quality hair and beauty products. This company prides itself on providing high customer satisfaction by rendering excellent customer service, quality products, and an enjoyable atmosphere for consumers. Coca Chanel said it best, “A girl should be two things Classy & Fabulous.” With there being only one beauty supply store in the Byram area, this company will convenience those who are seeking a beauty supply store that caters especially to their needs and those who can never seem to get off work early enough to catch the beauty supply store before it closes. The demand and support from community members, family, and friends; as well as, my ambitions to open a friendly, community-based beauty supply store, has made Klase’ Beauty Supply, LLC one of great potential.

I am the owner, Shonte Perry and I have worked diligently to make this business successful. I have acquired a good amount of clientele from advertising the business on social media. I have what it takes to excel beyond the customer's expectations. Klase’ Beauty Supply expects its growing reputation to lead to new clients that support the company’s anticipated growth. In January of this year, I was laid off from my job of 3 years. My mom suffered a heart attack and survived a quadruple bypass surgery, I have faced several challenges this year. After researching and considering the positives over the negatives, I decided to pursue my dream and open my beauty supply store. Many are afraid of the risks and challenges associated with this type of company, but I am up for the challenge. I am very passionate and knowledgeable about the beauty supply industry and eager to acquire many new skills as I travel along this journey.

Please be sure to check us out on Facebook & Twitter @klasebeautysupplyllc. SHARE, SHARE, SHARE *** A little bit can go a long way ***

story:
Cuties Coffee Bar is a tool to create space and fund community events in Los Angeles. We have been providing space for the queer community over the past year with our popular monthly event "Queers, Coffee & Donuts," and our weekly newsletter. Now we want a space that is open 7 days a week.

Bars, nightclubs, and LGBT centers have been important venues for queer activism and we want to see more local spaces for queers and allies to interact. We want daytime businesses where we can see familiar and friendly faces from our community behind the counter serving us. We want spaces where we know our identities will be respected and understood. We want spaces where we can just be.

Feelings of isolation impact the LGBTQIA+ community deeply and that strain is increasing. For queer folks, leaving the house and going out in the world can feel like a radical and herculean task. You are giving people something to look forward to, whether it's a smiling face behind the coffee bar in the morning or workshops and classes in the evenings. With Cuties, queer folks in Los Angeles (and those arriving in our city for sanctuary) will know there's a place for them waiting with open doors and open hearts.

We have an exciting  location that’s perfect for a community oriented coffee bar. While the building is in great shape, the interior does need renovation. We’ll be updating the plumbing, building a new bar, adding seating, upgrading security, and improving accessibility.

Cuties Coffee Bar is happening, even if we don’t reach our Indiegogo goal. We are prepared to fill any fundraising gaps with a small business loan and continue with our work as planned.

Time and budget over-runs are the norm for retail build-outs. To help counteract this, we are overseeing all of the projects in the shop until we open and doing many of the projects ourselves. For larger and more complex projects we are working with skilled tradespeople who can deliver. Our budget includes overages for materials and labor.

Rewards

In addition to creating a safer space for queer folks, you’ll receive exclusive rewards from this campaign. Proudly wear your support for Cuties with a limited edition enamel Donor Pin or show off your identity with a set of enamel Pronoun Pins.

There’s also a limited run of hand thrown coffee mugs by ceramicist Becki Chernoff. At higher donation levels we’ll laser etch your name onto a subway tile that will grace the walls of the coffee bar.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in what we're doing, please share this campaign. Share it within the community. Share it with allies and let them know this is a way they can show up. We've made a page of easily sharable messages for Facebook and Twitter here. If you’re in the LA area, you can help by distributing fliers and business cards around the city to advertise this campaign. Email us at fund@hicuties.com for more info.

You can also support us by being present in the community. Sign up for our weekly newsletter  highlighting queer events in Los Angeles or like us on Facebook.

Press!

 

Update 1 - February 12th:

Go the extra tile for your love. It’s almost Valentine’s Day! Flowers wilt, milk chocolates can give you gas, puppies poop everywhere. This Valentine’s Day consider making a grand gesture that will last.

Starting at $100 we’ll laser the names you and your loved one (up to 70 characters) onto a subway tile that will grace the walls of our coffee bar for all to see. Want more space to say what you feel or commemorate all the folks in your big, loving, queer family? At $200 you’ll get double the characters (140 to be exact) to express yourself and your love!

Let’s celebrate love: queer love, trans love, romantic love, aromantic love, love of smashing the patriarchy, love of our friends, love of our partners, love of ourselves. By memorializing your love in a Cuties tile you’ll be showing folks where your heart is and you’ll be showing queer folks in LA that you love them too.

Take a peek at the images below to see an example of the laser etching process that can enshrine your love on our walls.

 

Update 2 - February 15th

Hey Cuties! We took occupancy of our space last week!

We are now ready for a little bit of infrastructure improvement and eager to clean up the floors and the walls. You can see our progress in the picture below.

Right now we are at 18% of our funding goal. Do you know anyone else that can help us reach 100%? Please share the campaign with them. 

We've put together a few different ideas for you to share it easily at http://hicuties.com/share

Thank you for your generosity thus far. 

 

Update 3 - February 22:

Beautiful ceramics and hot coffee belong together. If you contribute $150 you can take home a one-of-a-kind reward to commemorate your support.

LA-based ceramic artist Becki Chernoff is creating mugs available exclusively during our indiegogo campaign! The mugs are hand thrown and each one comes with its own unique design. We love her playful yet grounded aesthetic.  When describing the mugs she's creating for us she said, "I'll be using tape resist and soldate clay which is a stoneware with matte white glaze"

We visited Becki in the studio for a peak into her process. Enjoy the video below and let photos to wet your appetite for this special reward. You can see more of Becki's work by following her on instagram @bxceramics. She also offers private wheel throwing tutoring sessions if you're an aspiring or seasoned ceramicist. 

Update 4 - March 21:

Leslie has been to QCD since the very beginning. In the video below he talks to us about building community and what a physical Cuties location would mean to him.

Update 5 - March 21:

We have approval on our plans from the Los Angeles Health Department. You can see renders of the coffee shop below.

story: My name is Jamal and I'm an aspiring business owner. My business, "Kitchen 5 Catering" is a small event catering and personal chef service. I plan to travel to clients and cook for them and their guests. The name kitchen 5 comes from my cooking classes in high school. The classroom was split into 5 kitchens, mine being kitchen 5. That's where I started to learn the basics and really get serious about cooking. 5 years later, I'm looking at making my dream come true. The money from this fundraiser is going to supplies and equipment that will allow me to blow away my guests with great food and service.

That's where I started to learn the basics and really get serious about cooking. 5 years later, I'm looking at making my dream come true. The money from this fundraiser is going to supplies and equipment that will allow me to blow away my guests with great food and service.

story:
Fed up with 2-Party Politics?

We believe in the following:

  • Breaking up the 2-party system by modifying our voting to create a wider political spectrum that better reflects you - an american voter. Term limits and ending the "winner take all" instant runoff election system in favor of newer, proven and more representative systems.
  • One human, one vote. We believe government is by and for the people. More money does not deserve more votes. We intend to end super pacs and the policies leading to "the best government money can buy". This party will officially prohibit "super pac" business contribution.
  • You deserve a voice. The simple fact is many average voters feel disempowered, disconnected and disgusted with our current political process. This also means government should reflect the citizens at large. This is your chance to make your voice heard.
  • It's time for Government 2.0. Within the party, we intend to use technology first to shape party policies, voter engagement, and increase efficiency as never before. This also means tax reform, and the coming unemployment boom caused by disproportionate technology ownership.
  • Workers need protection. In the war between Labor vs. Capital, we believe capital - investors and big business - has already won. Government is the only way to re-balance power.

The question is, do you believe this too?

Every revolution started somewhere...

Every major revolution in history started by a group with one key ingredient: belief. 

The United States started with a revolutionary small group who decided it was time to "leave the nest" of Great Britain. At that time, it was easy to dismiss it. 

Our battle is not with guns - but with hearts and minds. 

Who are we?

Two brothers, from a blue and red state and point of view, but neither happy about the lack of choices:

  • Roger, an internet marketer and developer in Los Angeles, CA (a firmly "blue state")
  • Tracy, an aviation engineer and former police chief in Minneapolis, MN and having run for local office with the Republican party.

Join the Conversation

We don't claim to know all the answers. Your voice can be heard and shape policies, then bills and legislation. Unlike a traditional (188 year old (D), 162 year old (R)) political party, all party processes, from selection of official platforms and selection of candidates will be handled online.

This is a political party for today's world.

To make your voice heard, donate as little as $1.

Note as is central to our mission, more donation does not buy you more votes. We'd love for you to donate more, but you'll still get just one vote.

That said, at this state - the exploratory initial conversation - you must donate at least $1 to get involved, and should be a legal voting citizen of the United States.

What am I Funding?

All funds at this point will go to research and setup of infrastructure. We'll identify "swing districts" - areas of the U.S. that vote either way and may be "politically in play". 

It is likely to be the 2024 or 2028 election before a presidential candidate is ready, due to the nature of how the current political system works. Our rough timeline is something like:

  • Immediately: Setup of infrastructure with a secure social platform for each contributor to voice their opinion and vote on issues and get involved.
  • 2018: Local candidates in "swing districts" are put in place, with substantial online support from the party. This is not a presidential election cycle and thus voter turnout is lower, but that is to our advantage. We believe we can, using technology, help party candidates reach local and state office.
  • 2020: We need a 5% national vote to be included as a major party in the following election cycle.
  • 2024: Serious runs and party recognition for state governments, focused on swing states.
  • 2024 - 2032: Presidential campaign. This won't be attempted until the party has traction.

Yes, we know this is "the long game", but if we do nothing, what will happen? Do you recall Bush vs. Gore? Obama vs. Romney or McCain? Without action the future is likely to be similar to the past. 

We find that untenable, and hope you do too.

Your contribution gets you invited to the 1.0 platform where you'll have an opportunity to vote on candidates and issues within the party. 

We've deliberately set the funding amount as low as possible so as to start the conversation. Currently, we have earmarked:

  • First $5,000: Technology and basic legal infrastructure including setup of a legal Non Profit
  • $5,001 on up: Whatever it takes to start building momentum, beginning with local government in swing areas. This will involve legal, marketing, candidate registration fees or other support. It may also involve outreach to existing legislators to shape bills that put forth our agendas above.

Political Revolution is Inevitable.

We don't claim to know all the answers.

Every policy we create is subject to approval by attorneys in the sense that we are interested in creating a new political party within the current existing laws for purpose of modifying them per the goals outlined above.

We believe the current 3rd parties don't reflect our positions,
and that there isn't a single, clear, center party - until now.

Current 3rd-party candidates have some valid points but with other positions we may not share. Both Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump, regardless of how you feel about their beliefs are proof that people want change, and are willing to look to outsiders to get it.

We believe a new party is needed, with very strong marketing. A current problem is that most believe a 3rd party cannot win, and thus "throwing their vote away" - creating a self-fulfilling prophecy, in which they indeed cannot win.

This is essentially a marketing problem, a problem of faith. For that reason, it's time for a new brand, new candidates, and a new party.

For this reason we intend to start from the ground up - local, then state, then finally federal office, demonstrating that our candidates can and do win, and best represent the government you want.

We believe in the United States. We believe in democracy. We believe we can take back our government.

The question is...

do you?

Join us.

 

What are your policies on...

Abortion, gay rights, oil pipelines, space exploration, kittens...

This has not all been formally defined yet, however, the currently involved people are of the belief that when it comes to religion, that's up to you, but forcing others to your belief is not cool. If you disapprove of gay marriage, then don't get one. They won't "use up all the love". If you're against abortion, don't get one. As for space exploration and kittens, they're pretty cool.

Our true party agendas are outlined above. Beyond that, the conversation is open, and may be up to individual candidates.

 

What if I cannot give?

The party and platform will of course be open to every U.S. voter in time. Not contributing today doesn't bar you from anything long term. That said, we, speaking frankly, need (1.) money to get things rolling, and (2.) engaged voters who care, and believe this is a way to "make america great again".  We encourage you to check this page next year to see updates on our progress and hopefully register as a United Center Party voter.

Share via Facebook.

Some fine print:

  • The fundraising on this platform is for a limited-term exploratory committee and initial draft of infrastructure. After Jan 1st, 2017, assuming successful funding, fundraising will be moved to the new political platform directly and/or for candidates directly and this page will be closed.
  • We are not attorneys, but (1.) welcome the help if you are, and (2.) all terms i.e. online in-party voting etc. is subject to legal review. 

 

Additional Reading:

  • Can the constitution even be changed? Yes - smart people and constitutional scholars have answered this before - besides, at time of writing, women and slaves couldn't even vote.
    • https://www.quora.com/Can-the-US-Constitution-b...
  • Breaking up the 2 party system: See
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u7JBXja7SAY
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MiEt6703L1o
    • List of US political parties - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_political...
  • 3rd Party Politics
    • http://www.john-uebersax.com/plato/thirdparty.htm
    • http://ivn.us/2012/11/01/why-5-matters-to-gary-...
    • http://www.fec.gov/info/toolkit.shtml#party
    • http://www.nytimes.com/2003/10/19/nyregion/crea...
  •  

Comments from citizens / voters / involved:

Friend's Comment #1: >>>>
FYI - I do NOT agree with this fairy tale goal you and so many other friends have about 'breaking up the 2 party system'. First off, I don't think it would even work unless we changed to a parliamentary system, but even if it did work, I don't think it will ever happen. I just felt I needed to say that. I didn't want to imply I was endorsing that, i think third party voters in this election are f*****g dangerous
>>>

I like this comment. It speaks to common beliefs - so, let's jump in :-)

1. Call me crazy, but who says the constitution cannot be changed? At the time of its writing, women and slaves couldn't even vote. 

Is it impossible? We are of the belief the system is ready to be updated and that it can be, though we're not sure yet how. Your contribution goes toward whatever we can do to make progress in this direction.

Here's the constitution as it stands: http://constitutioncenter.org/media/files/const... for anyone who cares to read the details.

2. "3rd party voters...dangerous". (A.) the fact that voting 3rd part is considered "dangerous" is a testament to just how broken the current system is. (B.) 3rd party candidates have in fact won on the state level, and in this election, we sort of agree in some way - we, as a party, will not put forth candidates until we have some real momentum - due to the broken "winner take all" nature of our current system.

Join the Conversation
We don't claim to know all the answers. Your voice can be heard and shape policies, then bills and legislation. Unlike a traditional (188 year old (D), 162 year old (R)) political party, all party processes, from selection of official platforms and selection of candidates will be handled online.
This is a political party for today's world.
To make your voice heard, donate as little as $1.
Note as is central to our mission, more donation does not buy you more votes. We'd love for you to donate more, but you'll still get just one vote.
That said, at this state - the exploratory initial conversation - you must donate at least $1 to get involved, and should be a legal voting citizen of the United States.
What am I Funding?
All funds at this point will go to research and setup of infrastructure. We'll identify "swing districts" - areas of the U.S. that vote either way and may be "politically in play". 
It is likely to be the 2024 or 2028 election before a presidential candidate is ready, due to the nature of how the current political system works. Our rough timeline is something like:

Immediately: Setup of infrastructure with a secure social platform for each contributor to voice their opinion and vote on issues and get involved.
2018: Local candidates in "swing districts" are put in place, with substantial online support from the party. This is not a presidential election cycle and thus voter turnout is lower, but that is to our advantage. We believe we can, using technology, help party candidates reach local and state office.
2020: We need a 5% national vote to be included as a major party in the following election cycle.
2024: Serious runs and party recognition for state governments, focused on swing states.
2024 - 2032: Presidential campaign. This won't be attempted until the party has traction.

Yes, we know this is "the long game", but if we do nothing, what will happen? Do you recall Bush vs. Gore? Obama vs. Romney or McCain? Without action the future is likely to be similar to the past. 
We find that untenable, and hope you do too.
Your contribution gets you invited to the 1.0 platform where you'll have an opportunity to vote on candidates and issues within the party. 
We've deliberately set the funding amount as low as possible so as to start the conversation. Currently, we have earmarked:

First $5,000: Technology and basic legal infrastructure including setup of a legal Non Profit
$5,001 on up: Whatever it takes to start building momentum, beginning with local government in swing areas. This will involve legal, marketing, candidate registration fees or other support. It may also involve outreach to existing legislators to shape bills that put forth our agendas above.


Political Revolution is Inevitable.
We don't claim to know all the answers.
Every policy we create is subject to approval by attorneys in the sense that we are interested in creating a new political party within the current existing laws for purpose of modifying them per the goals outlined above.
We believe the current 3rd parties don't reflect our positions,and that there isn't a single, clear, center party - until now. 
Current 3rd-party candidates have some valid points but with other positions we may not share. Both Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump, regardless of how you feel about their beliefs are proof that people want change, and are willing to look to outsiders to get it.
We believe a new party is needed, with very strong marketing. A current problem is that most believe a 3rd party cannot win, and thus "throwing their vote away" - creating a self-fulfilling prophecy, in which they indeed cannot win.
This is essentially a marketing problem, a problem of faith. For that reason, it's time for a new brand, new candidates, and a new party.
For this reason we intend to start from the ground up - local, then state, then finally federal office, demonstrating that our candidates can and do win, and best represent the government you want.
We believe in the United States. We believe in democracy. We believe we can take back our government.
The question is...
do you?
Join us.
 

What are your policies on...
Abortion, gay rights, oil pipelines, space exploration, kittens...
This has not all been formally defined yet, however, the currently involved people are of the belief that when it comes to religion, that's up to you, but forcing others to your belief is not cool. If you disapprove of gay marriage, then don't get one. They won't "use up all the love". If you're against abortion, don't get one. As for space exploration and kittens, they're pretty cool.
Our true party agendas are outlined above. Beyond that, the conversation is open, and may be up to individual candidates.
 What if I cannot give?The party and platform will of course be open to every U.S. voter in time. Not contributing today doesn't bar you from anything long term. That said, we, speaking frankly, need (1.) money to get things rolling, and (2.) engaged voters who care, and believe this is a way to "make america great again".  We encourage you to check this page next year to see updates on our progress and hopefully register as a United Center Party voter.Share via Facebook.Some fine print:
The fundraising on this platform is for a limited-term exploratory committee and initial draft of infrastructure. After Jan 1st, 2017, assuming successful funding, fundraising will be moved to the new political platform directly and/or for candidates directly and this page will be closed.
We are not attorneys, but (1.) welcome the help if you are, and (2.) all terms i.e. online in-party voting etc. is subject to legal review. 
 Additional Reading:
Can the constitution even be changed? Yes - smart people and constitutional scholars have answered this before - besides, at time of writing, women and slaves couldn't even vote.https://www.quora.com/Can-the-US-Constitution-b...

Breaking up the 2 party system: See
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u7JBXja7SAY
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MiEt6703L1o
List of US political parties - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_political...



3rd Party Politics
http://www.john-uebersax.com/plato/thirdparty.htm
http://ivn.us/2012/11/01/why-5-matters-to-gary-...
http://www.fec.gov/info/toolkit.shtml#party
http://www.nytimes.com/2003/10/19/nyregion/crea...


 
Comments from citizens / voters / involved:Friend's Comment #1: >>>>FYI - I do NOT agree with this fairy tale goal you and so many other friends have about 'breaking up the 2 party system'. First off, I don't think it would even work unless we changed to a parliamentary system, but even if it did work, I don't think it will ever happen. I just felt I needed to say that. I didn't want to imply I was endorsing that, i think third party voters in this election are f*****g dangerous>>>I like this comment. It speaks to common beliefs - so, let's jump in :-)1. Call me crazy, but who says the constitution cannot be changed? At the time of its writing, women and slaves couldn't even vote. Is it impossible? We are of the belief the system is ready to be updated and that it can be, though we're not sure yet how. Your contribution goes toward whatever we can do to make progress in this direction.Here's the constitution as it stands: http://constitutioncenter.org/media/files/const... for anyone who cares to read the details.2. "3rd party voters...dangerous". (A.) the fact that voting 3rd part is considered "dangerous" is a testament to just how broken the current system is. (B.) 3rd party candidates have in fact won on the state level, and in this election, we sort of agree in some way - we, as a party, will not put forth candidates until we have some real momentum - due to the broken "winner take all" nature of our current system.

story:
Intro

Netgen has implemented eZ Tags extension years ago and maintained it ever since. Kudos to the chief maintainer Edi. :) It was the most used taxonomy solution for eZ Publish legacy and is still used in legacy projects.

With the introduction of the new eZ generation, some work was done to support the extension as a field type. The result was the new repo which holds the Tags Bundle and which provides the possibility to code front side tag features for eZ Publish 5 and eZ Platform.

Since the eZ Platform UI has started to be used recently, there is a need to support tag management on the UI level too. 

What We Need & What You Get

We will need to invest a significant amount of hours to extend the functionalities of Tags Bundle for eZ Platform UI, hence we require funding. The first rough estimations show that we need 150 hours just for the implementation, some hours for open sourcing it, etc.

The results of the effort will be these 3 features: 

  • Content type field UI (for managing Tags field on the content type level)
  • Content field UI (for adding/removing tags )
  • Tags management section (for all actions on tags, to be added to the admin section of eZ Platform UI)

Once implemented, we will open source the work as part of the above-mentioned Tags Bundle repo. 

The Impact

Since there is no generic taxonomy solution out there, this project will add more value to the eZ Platform UI. It will be possible to upgrade some older eZ projects to eZ Platform if the blocking factor to do so was the tagging support.  

Perks

We encourage you to donate any amount you like but we created 2 perks for the big donors:

  1. Tags Hero - you will be mentioned and praised on the Tags Bundle page. Additionally, we will give you one ticket for Web Summer Camp 2017 on the Croatian coast (soon to be announced on http://websummercamp.com).
  2. Tags Backer - you will be listed on the credits page of the Tags Bundle repo.

For any amount you decide to donate, you get our eternal gratitude. :)

story:
The Basic Summary

The idea behind Walt's Box was born out of a constant need to send our friends and family the staple goodies from our visits to Walt Disney World. Anyone from around the Disney area of Florida knows how valuable it is having the parks from your doorsteps to find gifts for others (and well, let's be honest -- yourself!) We were constantly sending goodies through the mail to our loved ones around the country. We started to make "WDW care packages" for our families that had all types of WDW merchandise inside.

The problem came when we found out so many of our friends wanted those same goodies from the Parks and we had NO clue what some of them really wanted. So we came up with the idea of Walt's Box.

Walt's Box is a subscription box that contains hand-picked goodies from all four parks as well as the resorts of Walt Disney World. From the limited edition T-Shirts from the Magic Kingdom and the decadent and off-the-wall candies from the Japan Pavilion in Epcot to the hand-made soaps from the Grand Flordian and everything in between, we want to spread the happiness and joy of the Walt Disney World resort to all those around the country.

Risks & Challenges

We are currently fine tuning our website to make sure the experience for our guests is as user-friendly as possible. We are currently in the process of creating packaging and shipping logistics -- stay tuned to backer updates for more on that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share the campaign, the idea, the product to your friends, family and anyone who may be interested in the idea. You're helping us spread the magic of Disney all over the world!

story:
Short Summary

My sons have been asking if they could rake the neighbors leaves or mow lawns and start their own business, but were sad to learn, as they asked the neighbors around us, that lawn services had already been filled by other kids in the area.  However, when they saw me watching the promo video for Drone Command they immediately became interested, and wanted to know more, and if that was a business that kids could do.  Well I honestly wasn’t sure, so I emailed the Drone Command people and asked them if it was age appropriate for my sons to attend.  They assured me that it was a great business for young entrepreneurs, and even referred me to a couple of other young participants who had attended their events.  I quickly contacted one of them and they also confirmed that this was a business that could be really interesting and exciting for kids to be a part of and develop.  This led to several discussions --- if they were serious about wanting to try this --- and how dedicated they would be to the work it would take.  They all assured me that this was absolutely something they found interesting, exciting, and wanted to learn more about.  I certainly want to feed this industrious spirit but we are not able to outright fund such an adventure, thus the boys suggested that they wanted to try fundraising.  Again, I told them I would help, and that is what led to this video.  In the video I asked them a few basic questions: 

 

Why they wanted to start a business? 

Why they like Drones?

Why they thought it would be a good business? 

What would some of their business goals be? 

Why should people give them money to start this business?

 

I hope you will enjoy the video, please forgive my poor video skills.

 

The goals they came up with are $3000 to cover the expenses in attending a nearby Drone Command event, a Drone, and some startup business expenses.

The larger goal of $5000 that would help them get more flight training, marketing options, and a website.

story:
Short Summary

Founded and based out of Arkansas, Rock City Outfitters is a company known for producing high-quality, locally relevant garments that are sold via the Rock City Outfitters website, select retailers, festivals, and local events throughout Arkansas. We also do custom design and printing for businesses, schools, fraternities, and low budget brothels. 

With an eye toward the future, we are now planning on purchasing a van from which we will sell our wares. Of course, not just any van will do: we need to jack it up with mud tires and other decorations that will draw people’s attention in high-traffic venues. This way, we will be able to take our sales on the road and travel wherever our potential customers may be. This would represent a huge boost to our business and an opportunity for huge, long-term growth.

We are turning to you, Indigogo, for help raising $12,000.  

The majority of it will obviously go towards a van that is in good shape and won't break down on us in a busy intersection. 

Then we of course need a lift kit with some ridiculously over sized mud tires and an awesome Rock City Outfitters wrap. 

If there is any left over we would love to install an absolutely annoying horn on it that plays either "I saw the Sign" by Ace of Base or "The Arkansas Fight Song."

Perks include:

$25 will get you our exclusive "I supported the Cause" t shirt sporting the awesome van. Email me at ryan@rockcityoutfitters.com with the size or sizes you need, unisex XS-3XL. 

$50 will get you the shirt of course and a $25 gift certificate to www.rockcityoutfitters.com

$150 will get you 2 of the shirts, $50 in gift certificates and your name, or business name or kids name, etc typed out on the van. Depending on how many are purchased, text will be around 12" long.

$250 will get you 4 shirts, $75 in gift certificates and your Face on the Van! You have an ugly face? Ok, we will put your business logo on the van. Same here on size, depending on how many are purchased, logos and faces will be around 6" wide. 

Don't have any jingle in your pockets you can throw to our campaign. No biggie, just spread this campaign with every single person you know. Except past lovers. That never goes well. Share using the Indigogo Share tools as well as by word of mouth, your social media stuff, etc.

story:
We at Cibos totally believe that allowing neighbors to Share their Best Foods is like Going Back to the Basics of Human Life!  With the fast passed World of today, most people around the globe head off to work to end up at home tired and not even wanting to chat with the neighbor…and Cibos plans to change all that.  

This new Cibos App will be the market place that brings together,
Cooks and Guests to enjoy an exquisite home cooking experience.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 Cibos looks to hit a home-run by bringing Communities back together by allowing Food to be the centerpiece!  

As of today, we are well under way to Launch the Cibos App in early 2017 and support all the Cooks and Guests that want to share this amazing vision to Chang the World…

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you cook, you can be making money with Cibos. Create your own business, on your own schedule, and be your own boss with Cibos. You simply do what you love to do, and now earn a little extra money doing it. There is no limit to what you can do when using Cibos. Below are just a few samples, and examples of the potential that can be yours when you are a Cibos cook. 

 

 

 

Cooks at Cibos already love to Cook, and they are passionate about the foods that they likely have prepared hundreds of time in their life…and NOW they can share their best with you! 

Guests, or what you might call those who eat the cooks foods are craving something different….as Fast Foods, Restaurants, and even those Frozen Dinners are just not Nutritious or Tasty after many times… BUT Cibos has the better choice, a home cooked meal ready within 1-15 minutes of a specified time, prepared in a kitchen with love and a desire to absolute please one another, exciting! 

 

 

 

 

Moms and Dads, Brothers and Sisters...what better way to bond than Cooking Together and Enjoying Each Other!

If you have kiddos at home, what a great way to instill Financial, Budgeting, Serving, Creating, Value Shopping, Living, Sharing,
and of course Cooking Skills to last a Lifetime!

From every poll we have taken…it appears that everyone likes a little extra cash and …Cibos is simply the Best Business Globally for that extra cash!

 

No matter where you are, Cibos is there. The main goal of Cibos is to bring Life into Families thru Food and Neighbors closer together...so your Meal is likely just a few doors away.

Cibos Cooks likely bought the foods that day to Cook an amazing Dish, and all cooks look for the very Best ingredients to ensure the Best Dish possible!

Truly, Home Made with Love!  All Cooks prepare amazing foods in the same kitchen they use for their family or guests…truly amazing!

 

 

 

We have seen every kind of business you can image within our team…and to have a price-point of $85+ to $295+ and no need to go rent or buy a building, or hire anyone…just take a few Cibos "Cooks University" Classes, Commit to making the Best Foods for your neighbors to share…ALL while already cooking foods for yourself or family…its simply “A World Changer”

 

 

We are a small, but very passionate and talented team of people from all walks of life!  Our CEO has worked with thousands of businesses across America to help improve their revenues through technology via Merchant Processing and E-Mail marketing and our CMO has spent decades building and cultivating unique corporate brands for companies of all shapes and sizes with a flare for the cutting edge. We also have an amazing CTO that currently owns a nice sized Technology Firm as well as our Corporate Chef that has been the Sous Chef at a few amazing restaurants around the globe as well as Executive Chef for a NFL team owner.  Our legal team is headed by a very good friend and has been a pioneer in everything related to franchising for about the last 30 years.  And lastly, we have several others that help in this exciting adventure that are just as skilled as any mentioned already…we love Cibos and all it stands for!

story: Emergency trademark campaign
story_txt: Emergency trademark campaign

story:
Thank you to all who have contributed to our L-H on the move campaign. We are beyond grateful to announce that with all of your help, we have met our fundraising goal, and are looking forward to moving into our new office space on Marion street.

As you know, there are still many costs associated with producing a bi-monthly  publication, and we have many perks yet to be claimed. Please consider supporting L-H by collecting a perk from our online campaign.

 

 

Lögberg-Heimskringla is the oldest continuously published ethnic newspaper in North America. It fulfills an important function by creating community for those of Icelandic descent in Canada and the United States of America and providing a link between Iceland and North America. 

L-H is an independent, not-for-profit organization led by a group of dedicated community volunteers, committed to the continuance of the Icelandic culture in North America. Like newspapers everywhere, and particularly with ethnic publications, there is a continuing challenge to survive. L-H is no different. It has seen costs rise and subscribers diminish. 

In order to keep L-H in print, we need your help.

Today's Challenges 

  • The current subscriber and advertising base is not large enough to cover the basic costs the publication, let alone undertake actions which will increase the appeal of the newspaper, to increase circulation and attract more advertisers.
  • The cost of printing has gone up and the L-H subscription base has dropped
  • Cash flow is irregular and has caused "hiccups" through out the year
  • The newspaper, while it relies on volunteers to assist in the office, is wholly understaffed with a complement of only 2.5 full-time equivalent employees
  • Our primary expenses are:
  • Printing & shipping costs
  • Payroll (2.5 full-time equivalent employees)
  • Rent for a small office
  • Software and website fees

And so on from there

As a token of our appreciation please enjoy a special Icelandic themed gift compliments of L-H :) 

L-H Note card set ($20)

Leif Landed First License Plate Holder ($30)

lambamín Tote ($25) **SPECIAL EDITION***

Variety Bag Fun Pack ($25): Receive a combination of gifts from L-H including our special note card series of Icelandic landscapes.

L-H Icelandic Open Backpack ($35)

I Love AFI ($30) I Love AMMA ($30)

*** Shirts come in grey and yellow not pink as shown***

Icelandic Flag Shirt ($45)

Icelandic Soccer Ball shirt ($45)

L-H Foldable Chair ($50)

Icelandic River Roast Coffee ($75)

L-H Knife Set ($85)

2 Year L-H Subscription ($115)

Vinarterta from vinarterta.ca ($300)

Icelandic Coffee Party ($300)

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word about our campaign by posting on Facebook and Twitter
  • Follow us on social media
  • Recruit subscribers for both print and online editions
  • If you know someone who may be interested in advertising please get them in touch with our advertising representative at: jodi@lh-inc.ca

And that's all there is to it.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for L-H today, in order to provide hope for the future is to recruit younger readers. To do this we have developed a superlative presence on social media. As a result of this we have seen increased interest from our younger audience, but still struggle to get the younger people to pay for their news.

Circulation is the life-blood of any publication. That is no different with L-H. It needs a transfusion - not only of readers in general - but readers with less gray. It needs to appeal to those whose Icelandic heritage is one of several. 

*All donors will receive a charitable receipt*

Canadian Registered Charity #103373635 RR0001

United States Registered Charity #841688342
story_txt:
Thank you to all who have contributed to our L-H on the move campaign. We are beyond grateful to announce that with all of your help, we have met our fundraising goal, and are looking forward to moving into our new office space on Marion street.As you know, there are still many costs associated with producing a bi-monthly  publication, and we have many perks yet to be claimed. Please consider supporting L-H by collecting a perk from our online campaign.  Lögberg-Heimskringla is the oldest continuously published ethnic newspaper in North America. It fulfills an important function by creating community for those of Icelandic descent in Canada and the United States of America and providing a link between Iceland and North America. L-H is an independent, not-for-profit organization led by a group of dedicated community volunteers, committed to the continuance of the Icelandic culture in North America. Like newspapers everywhere, and particularly with ethnic publications, there is a continuing challenge to survive. L-H is no different. It has seen costs rise and subscribers diminish. In order to keep L-H in print, we need your help.Today's Challenges 
The current subscriber and advertising base is not large enough to cover the basic costs the publication, let alone undertake actions which will increase the appeal of the newspaper, to increase circulation and attract more advertisers.
The cost of printing has gone up and the L-H subscription base has dropped
Cash flow is irregular and has caused "hiccups" through out the year
The newspaper, while it relies on volunteers to assist in the office, is wholly understaffed with a complement of only 2.5 full-time equivalent employees
Our primary expenses are:
Printing & shipping costs
Payroll (2.5 full-time equivalent employees)
Rent for a small office
Software and website fees

story:
Who am I? And of all things, why coffee?

My name is Darrin. I love helping people. People ask all of the time, how did I get started in coffee. Honestly, I was at a time in my life when I wanted to be happy. I learned from a Buddhist Monk, like seriously a monk, that if even if I wasn't happy inside, I could find joy in bringing others joy, 

I thought to myself that even if people didn't drink coffee, the smell of coffee, always seemed to make people smile. There's not a person that I could think of, that didn't find a bit of joy around coffee. My first tagline for Darrin's Coffee was, "Best enjoyed among friends." 

 

My first "giver" moment.

 

On Thanksgiving 2012, I had maybe 35lbs of coffee to my name and I learned that the Mozel Sanders Foundation was short of their fundraising goal. I didn't have much, but I felt compelled to donate 30lbs to the Mozel Sanders Thanksgiving Meal. 

It's a huge event, where a lot of hungry people get fed. After that, we changed the tagline to, "Everyone deserves to drink great coffee."

I knew about Direct Trade and Fair Trade. There's a difference. So, when I decided to buy coffee, I reached out to a farm in Costa Rica. They used coffee to provide jobs opportunities to people in the area. Then, Haiti had an earthquake. In looking for a way to use coffee to help, I was able to establish a relationship with a nonprofit, probably the most transparent one in Haiti, and I began buying and roasting their coffee. I'm one of their channel partners now. Check me out.

Most don't know that at one time Haiti was the second largest coffee producing country in the world. Now, because of major calamities, about 4% of the entire country is forested. The nonprofit I purchase from not only has coffee that's the Haitian Cup of Excellence Winner, they plant a tree for every pound of unroasted coffee that I purchase. I want to buy as much coffee from them as possible. I also want to come full circle to the farm in Costa Rica, the first Direct Trade coffee purchase I made and buy coffee from them as well. 

I saw that there was a need for young black men to learn entrepreneurship, so I decided to start a program to teach entrepreneurship to these boys. In addition to that program, I began an additional program to teach a younger group about the fundamentals of group economics.

 

I know I am blessed. 

 

I am the only Black Owned Coffee Roaster in the State of Indiana. I plan on using that Diversity Status to sell some coffee and create some jobs. My plan includes leveraging coffee to help those with disabilities as well as those with felony backgrounds earn a living. I believe that if the coffee is good and the people around the coffee are the same, it is impossible for anything but good to be the result. I am only one guy on a mission. So here I am. The giver, becoming the asker. I need your help. 

 

What am I asking?

 

I know A LOT of people. I believe that if enough of the people that know me, they know my story and they know why I do what I do, when I ask for their help in accomplishing this goal, they won't hesitate in helping. I've lost a lot of friends just by asking them to buy coffee from me. (Crazy right?) That's why I've been hesitant to start this project. This is bigger than me. It always has been. So the giver is now the asker. 

 

I'm not asking for a lot. Am I?

 

Whenever I am asked for a donation from my business, space to hold a function and even when I'm not asked, my answer is not just yes, but, how can I help more. I want to be the community guy that happens to own a coffee shop. Not the other way around.

 

What scares me about asking you for help?

 

When I asked for donations to help start my entrepreneurship program, my post received A TON of "Likes". Sadly, the grand total of donations was $23. I suppose that was another reason that's kept me from asking again. Remember, I've lost friends by just asking them why have they never bought any coffee from me. But this is bigger than me. 

 

Just put "Five on it".

 

My ask is that my family, you guys help with at least $5, and if you give more, I've added perks. 

I'm also asking that you bring three people that you know love giving and understand the impact this will make. RIGHT HERE IN INDIANA! (Remember, this is not only going to help someone in another part of the world, a tangible economic benefit locally is the result. Give globally, benefit locally. Wow.)

Outside of that, I'm not asking for anything else. I actually spent more than $5 for lunch last week. If $5 is too much to consider, please get in touch with me, we will get you help. 

It's a new year. Let's start this off the right way, by doing a little to do a lot. 

Darrin

story:
WHO I AM

I am Henry Nnorom, a young entrepreneur. I developed my brand after seeking out an alternate solution to my father’s affliction for a simple ailment. Modern medicine wasn’t giving me the results I needed. I found that alternative medicine was more useful and my father responded better to unconventional healing.

The term "Juju" has been in existence since the dawn of humankind. It is derived from the pursuits of men looking for small inanimate objects to ward off evil both spiritual and physical. I also found that there are millions of people around the globe who look to juju as a form of healing, and who rely on the gifted crafts that men and women make, such as little trinkets and amulets, to ward off sickness and unhappiness through an energy which believers relate to.

I believe in what I do and I love my business as much as I love my family, Culture, American food, and helping people and that is A LOT.

Harthrup.com is the first startup that I HAVE CREATED. It helps people to sell or buy a business, meet new partners, post to find new workers for their start up and eventually build a successful start-up. Hathrup.com takes the technological advancements of today and mixes them with the philosophy and ideals of the American Dream of yesterday.  Our goal is to turn Hathrup.com into an app that will facilitate crowd funding, start-up, and political news. Our aim is to bring unedited and informational news in real time by you the users straight to your mobile device. We hope through your help to empower young start-ups reach potential donors and much more.

WHAT IS JUJU MARKETPLACE?

Juju Marketplace is an open platform for HANDMADE arts and crafts that connects buyers and sellers from around the globe. Our marketplace is unique because it allows sellers to list and sell items that they’ve made from home, including juju products. Since its launch, the website has seen over 4000 visitors and that rate is growing daily! People from all walks of life have taken an interest in this modern marketplace for handmade items. Although I coined the name “Juju Marketplace” out of my own love and respect for these ancient art forms, the website does not solely intent to promote Juju products. Rather, it is a place for HANDMADE and UNIQUE HANDCRAFTED GOODS- connecting artisans and collectors.

OUR COMPANY

Juju Market Place LLC is currently a Wyoming Registered company, a wholly owned subsidiary of Hathrup Capital Funding. Over the years, Juju Marketplace.com has grown to be more than an online store. We have launched the “free enterprise” Juju consulting portal seller app as the first of its kind. It is listed on Google Play Store for Android devices and facilitates leads for sellers and buyers in the juju niche market. The app has been downloaded thousands times to date, challenging Juju Market Place.com to introduce a more sophisticated marketing system.

It supports people in countries and cities where juju is practiced for good and not evil. It is also not only commendable, but entrepreneurial as a form of giving financial opportunities to people less fortunate and thereby allowing growth and success for many.

People ask us all the time: "What kind of start-up related to Juju is it possible to launch?" Generally, this market is not openly accessible to the community. However, though our website, the market place is growing exponentially around the world.  JMP is in the right place with the right information and application to put a good working plan into action and achieve financial results. I created this company out of the philanthropic desire to assist people in countries and cities where juju is practiced for the experience of positive energy. Therefore, this is not only commendable, but also entrepreneurial as a form of giving financial opportunities to people less fortunate and thereby allowing growth and success for many.

As Juju Market Place.com has grown over the past year, so has its fan base, including those who have hoped for the opening of branch outlets in different cities and countries. Since we can’t achieve this on our own, we’ve decided to seek your help to make that idea a reality.

 

WHY WE NEED YOU

With an appropriate funding, JMP will be able to open branch outlets in Texas, South Africa, and Ghana. The opportunity to build a business platform, expand, and nurture the relationship between makers and buyers is reliant on being able to upgrade continually, and source products and market.

 

HELP US REACH MILLIONS

While seeking out an alternative solution to my father’s disease, I interviewed the most successful, notable and innovators leaders of our time. Many of them have been deeply impacted by Juju’s energetic powers.

Today, you have the opportunity to put jujumarketplace.com to work worldwide. By supporting this project, you will be among the first ones to benefit from our handmade arts and crafts and you will be helping to spread good Juju beliefs and positive energy around the globe.

Now is the time to join and help us spread good vibes and forces around the Globe!

You are fully aware of the impact of "Juju" on our society and with even a modest donation you will be helping people to get through their bad days. We need to make everyone in need aware that even when we think we have lost everything, it is not over. We need to show them that there is still some hope and that they got something to hang on to while the world still spins on. A little piece of art craft that for you may be only that, for someone else might be the determination to never give up in the face of adversities.

Our goal is to raise $100,000, which will be used to bring this project to life. Here is a summary of the project budget:

Office in Bastorp, Texas- $15.000,00

Local sales people (x3) PART TIME- $20.000,00

Marketing material- $8.500,00

Trade Show Expenses- $6.000,00

Juju Buyer App Development- $3.500,00

Hathrup App Development- $5.000,00

Operating expenses (promotional items)- $10.000,00

OUT OF state Business fee (x3)- $3.000,00

SEO, Google Play, SME, etc.- $20.000,00

Advertising- $10.000,00

 

THE IMPACT

Juju is more than a belief system. It's about healing- the body, the mind, the soul. Take a step back and envision a world without stigmatization, without relying on radiation for cancer, or without the injection of one virus to fight another virus. Juju holds the key to an alternative medicine that has existed since the beginning of time but people still hold traditional medicine on a pedestal- despite its ineffectiveness!

It's time for the world to harness the power of natural medicine and holistic healing, and you can be a part of that!

story:
Choice Group Inc. 

Los Angeles public school children have limited access to after-school programs and oftentimes no options for structured summer programs. Many of these students, especially in South LA, haven't had formal music or arts education, don't have access to the latest technology, and don’t have the opportunity to participate in many educational field trips. Additionally, they aren’t exposed to what's behind-the-scenes of the music they hear, the TV they watch, nor the video games they play.

Choice Group Inc. (CGI) programs provide outlets for creative expressions, classroom instruction, and exposure to industry professionals, and experiential field trips, CGI participants learn foundational competencies that are transferable to any setting. Choice Group's mission is to provide at-risk and foster youth a safe and nurturing environment that promotes music and related arts programs as recreational, educational, and life enhancing opportunities.

Choice Group New Media Arts Programs provides youth access to the latest Apple computers, equipped with the latest software in music production and 3D Game Design, and instruction from industry professionals. Like all CGI programs, students will have outlets for creative expression and, through unique field trips, have exposure to the professional world behind-the-scenes of music and video game development. These after-school and summer programs in South LA. CGI serves as the New Media Arts curriculum to school districts throughout Los Angeles County.

How YOU can SUPPORT 

If you believe in the importance of music and New Media Arts Programs like we do, join our community of visionary partners as we serve the at-risk and foster youth community, through our unique New Media Arts Programs. Donate now on this website or arrange an in-kind donation (new musical equipment, instruments, and computers) by contacting deonna.j@choicegroupinc.org

The Choice Group Impact

South Los Angeles' at-risk and foster youth will have experienced a safe, structured, and educational oasis after-school hours and throughout the summer. Their participation in a music and arts program, emphasizing education, discipline, and structure, will prepare them to be well-rounded, responsible, and productive adults. Exposure to the inner workings of the entertainment industry will allow these students to explore career options therein.

YOUR impact 

Below is a Breakdown of how your donations are used:

Each individual instructor costs $120 per class.

Each course runs twice a week.

1 instructor x 4 classes = $480/week

_____

Each student’s participation is $15/week course. 

1 student x 2 classes = $15/week

a) 1 student x 2 classes x 16-weeks = $240

b) 1 instructor x 2 classes x 16 weeks = $3,840

1 student x 4 classes = $30/week

c) 1 student x 4 classes x 16-weeks = $480

d) 1 instructor x 4 classes x 16 weeks = $7,680

Choice Group is asking for $7,680 to fund ONE 16-week course, 2x a week, 16

Kids per class.  (ax16) + b = $7680

For a Follow on Instagram & Twitter

____________________________________________________________________

Your Instagram Selfie Shout-out & Special Thanks on all Social Media Platforms 

We will post your best selfie with a Special Thanks on our Facebook, Instagram & Twitter

     

____________________________________________________________________

$25

Show your support with style with a gift of a Choice Group T-Shirt  or Turn your support up with a download of Choice Group’s Youth created theme song “Dream Big” on iTunes (your choice).

  Checkout what CGI visionary partner, Rickey Minor, says about the program.

        

"I'm thrilled to be a part of Choice Group because they fill an important need for our youth by sustaining music education, and more broadly, arts education."  American Idol Musical Director, Rickey Minor.

____________________________________________________________________

Show your support with style with a thank you gift of a Choice Group T-shirt & Turn your support up with a download of Choice Group’s Youth created theme song “Dream Big” on iTunes

       AND      

____________________________________________________________________

You will receive all 3 popular thank you gifts of a CGI T-shirt, Dream Big download, & Instagram Selfie Shout-out

      Stellar Package - ALL OF THE ABOVE - $100 

____________________________________________________________________

Relationship Building 101 and Branding 101 Training Videos from
Executive Director, Dana Hammond
"Dana Hammond never stops and I believe in him so he has my vote.” Los Angeles City Council President Herb Wesson
"I was moved deeply by Choice Group’s effort to help youth from my hometown make better life choices, a true definition of empowerment,”  4x Olympic Goal Medalist Lisa Leslie.
____________________________________________________________________

                                                           

                                          $500 – “Angel Wings Package”

Can’t attend our gala, but want someone else to attend in your place? This gift package is for you! A friend of your choice can attend our 5 star Fundraiser Gala and YOU will receive a special thanks, personalized video from Choice Group’s Youth, a half page Ad in Choice Group’s Tribune Journal, and our Golden Package gift.  

____________________________________________________________________

                                                                   

$1000 “The Silver Wings Package”

You will be granted VIP Access to Choice Group’s 5th Annual Fundraiser Gala where you will Meet & Greet with World Renown Artist, Erica Campbell, from Grammy award winning group MARY MARY; in addition to the Angel Wings.

____________________________________________________________________

                                                           

                                      $2000 “The Gold Wings Package”

You AND a friend (of your choice) will be granted VIP Access to Choice Group’s 5th Annual Fundraiser Gala where you will Meet & Greet Erica Campbell, from Grammy award winning group MARY MARY; in addition to the Angel Wings & Golden Package.
story_txt:
Choice
Group Inc. 
Los Angeles public school children
have limited access to after-school programs and oftentimes no options for
structured summer programs. Many of these students, especially in South LA,
haven't had formal music or arts education, don't have access to the latest
technology, and don’t have the opportunity to participate in many educational
field trips. Additionally, they aren’t exposed to what's behind-the-scenes of
the music they hear, the TV they watch, nor the video games they play.
Choice Group Inc. (CGI) programs
provide outlets for creative expressions, classroom instruction, and exposure
to industry professionals, and experiential field trips, CGI participants learn
foundational competencies that are transferable to any setting. Choice
Group's mission is to provide at-risk and foster youth a safe and nurturing
environment that promotes music and related arts programs as recreational,
educational, and life enhancing opportunities.
Choice Group New Media Arts Programs
provides youth access to the latest Apple computers, equipped with the latest
software in music production and 3D Game Design, and instruction from industry
professionals. Like all CGI programs, students will have outlets for creative
expression and, through unique field trips, have exposure to the professional
world behind-the-scenes of music and video game development. These after-school
and summer programs in South LA. CGI serves as the New Media Arts curriculum to
school districts throughout Los Angeles County.
How
YOU can SUPPORT 
If you believe in the importance of
music and New Media Arts Programs like we do, join our community of visionary
partners as we serve the at-risk and foster youth community, through our
unique New Media Arts Programs. Donate now on this website or arrange an
in-kind donation (new musical equipment, instruments, and computers) by
contacting deonna.j@choicegroupinc.org
The
Choice Group Impact
South Los Angeles' at-risk and
foster youth will have experienced a safe, structured, and educational
oasis after-school hours and throughout the summer. Their participation in a
music and arts program, emphasizing education, discipline, and structure, will
prepare them to be well-rounded, responsible, and productive adults. Exposure
to the inner workings of the entertainment industry will allow these students
to explore career options therein.
YOUR
impact 
Below is a Breakdown of how your
donations are used:
Each individual instructor costs
$120 per class.
Each course runs twice a week.
1 instructor x 4 classes = $480/week

_____
Each student’s participation is
$15/week course. 
1 student x 2 classes = $15/week 
a) 1 student x 2 classes x 16-weeks =
$240
b) 1 instructor x 2 classes x 16
weeks = $3,840
1 student x 4 classes = $30/week 
c) 1 student x 4 classes x 16-weeks
= $480

d) 1 instructor x 4 classes x 16
weeks = $7,680
Choice Group is asking for $7,680
to fund ONE 16-week course, 2x a week, 16
Kids per class.  (ax16) + b
= $7680

____________________________________________________________________$5
For a Follow on Instagram & Twitter____________________________________________________________________
$10 
Your Instagram Selfie Shout-out & Special Thanks on all
Social Media Platforms  
We will post your best selfie with a Special Thanks on our
Facebook, Instagram & Twitter     ____________________________________________________________________$25 
Show your support with style with a gift of a Choice Group T-Shirt  or Turn
your support up with a download of Choice Group’s Youth created theme
song “Dream Big” on
iTunes (your choice).   Checkout what CGI visionary partner, Rickey Minor, says about the program.         "I'm thrilled to be a part of  Choice Group because they fill an important need for our youth by sustaining  music education, and more broadly, arts education."  American Idol  Musical Director, Rickey Minor. ____________________________________________________________________$50Show your support with style with a thank you gift of a Choice
Group T-shirt & Turn your support up with a download of Choice Group’s
Youth created theme song “Dream Big” on iTunes 
       AND      
____________________________________________________________________
$100 “The Stellar Package” 
You will
receive all 3 popular thank you
gifts of a CGI T-shirt, Dream Big download, & Instagram Selfie Shout-out
      Stellar Package - ALL OF THE ABOVE - $100 

 

 
 
 
 
____________________________________________________________________

Relationship Building 101 and Branding 101 Training Videos from 
Executive Director, Dana Hammond "Dana  Hammond never stops and I believe in him so he has my vote.” Los Angeles City Council President Herb  Wesson
