story:
A new brewery is coming to Phoenixville, PA - Crowded Castle Brewing Company! 

Crowded Castle Brewing Company is a dream turned reality for ten, beer-loving friends and family. Encouraged by their success in home brewing and the joy that quality beer brings to others, Crowded Castle was founded in 2013.  Click here to read more about our beginning.

The group launched its first commercial beer – the COPR IPA – in July 2015 in the Allentown and Bethlehem areas. After a year of success with the COPR, the group sought to set roots closer to their hometown in Chester County. 

Crowded Castle's mission is to craft deliciously unique beers for beer drinkers of all types - hop heads and wheat lovers alike.

The brewery has leased 242 Bridge Street, in the heart of the town's "restaurant row." The 4,200 sq. ft. space will feature a 7.5-barrel brew house and taproom. In addition to 12 beers on tap, the taproom will offer cheese and charcuterie boards to pair with brews.

Renovations to the facility began on August 1, 2016 with an anticipated opening date in April 2017. 

All are welcome at Crowded Castle where there is always room for one more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need: Our goal is to raise at least $30,000 to round-out the funds that the Castle needs to let down the drawbridge and welcome patrons.

What for: Every dollar we receive will go towards offsetting the cost of our taproom buildout.

Perks: Support Crowded Castle and invest in your beer drinking future! You will be rewarded with some awesome perks (listed on the right).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not in a position to contribute financially, but still want to help? Here are other ways you can help Crowded Castle:

  • Share our crowdfund page with anyone who you think would be interested
  • Spread the word by following us on social media and sharing our posts
  • Visit us when we officially open!

 

Follow Our Journey

For more information about Crowded Castle Brewing Company, updates on the renovations, and the announcement of the grand opening date, visit www.crowdedcastle.com.

You can also find us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram!

Have questions:  Email Michele Mazza at:  MicheleMazza@CrowdedCastle.com

story:
"Table to Farm", not farm to table 

What the heck is table to farm? The easiest way to describe it would be starting with food scraps that typical restaurants usually throw out and using it to feed worms and larvae which are then fed to fish in our aquaponics garden. Bacteria then process' the water the fish swim in to convert ammonia rich waste into nitrates. The solid waste fertilizes plants growing in our outdoor garden and the nutrient dense water is used in our hydroponics garden. 

I want to be one of the pioneers of the "new, table to farm movement" which would help reduce our carbon foot print and promote a healthy, sustainable environment.  

A little bit about me

I grew up eating delicious culturally rich foods cooked by two of my aunts and my adopted parents who were Puerto Rican. This inspired me to want to create my own delightful takes on what I enjoyed as a child. The International School of Culinary Arts at the Art Institute of San Francisco has taught me a lot about how to run a successful business. Working for Celebrity Chefs Michael Mina, Emeril Lagasse, and Wolfgang Puck has taught me the discipline of the kitchen. Having the freedom to travel and experience cooking in big cities like Las Vegas, San Francisco, Orlando, and Los Angeles has helped diversify my palate. All of this combined with my time with large companies like Kimpton Hotels, Walt Disney World, Universal Studios and several Las Vegas casinos has made me the person I am today. 

Risks & Challenges

After signing a ten year lease for this property that has set vacant for nearly a decade, the City of Emeryville informed us that there would be a $38,000 developmental impact fee. This fee was created after all the redevelopment funds were taken away. Now, small business owners like myself must absorb these cost to provide bus shelters, bike paths, and other city improvements. 

We need to raise enough money to finish construction, permitting, and pay the City's Environmental Impact fee. These costs will run into the hundreds of thousands of dollars and we are asking for your help with our second round of funding.  

 About The Food 

Our goal is to source 70-80% of our vegetables within a ten mile radius of the restaurant. We will be partnering with several community gardens in the neighborhood to promote local business' and farms. 

        We will have a quick service area serving Alchemy Collective Coffee that will open at 6am Monday thru Friday, a full service restaurant that will open at 5pm daily, and a private dining room offering live events and private parties. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If we are unable to reach our campaign goal, we will still open but in phases. We would start with the quick service cafe in phase one, full service dining room phase two, and the private dining room in phase three. We also have the option to phase out liquor license/beer and wine license or the outdoor patio. 

I know that this is a lot to ask for financially, but also I am asking for your trust. I believe my idea can bring our community closer, provide much needed employment to our community, and also create a place to learn and be educated about food. 

Sharing is a donation all in itself! 

Thanks

story:
Who We Are

CosmoMuse creates a beautiful and modern bled of lifestyle and astrology guidance through a seasonal approach to living - both cosmically and tangibly.

CosmoMuse's 2017 Seasonal Astrology Guide is an annual publication that celebrates how the cycles and seasons of the zodiac can help us create more intentional magic in our lives. We love creating an aesthetic connection that bridges the cosmic world with the tangible world, as well as give guidance and inspiration for enhancing our lifestyle with the help of our cosmos. 

In this inaugural volume, we are working around the clock to bring sophisticated design, ideas and inspiration for the year ahead, through a tangible high-quality print publication. After much in-depth research on the cosmic patterns in the coming 2017 year, we have distilled our findings down into very easy and digestible guidance. We think the seasoned astrologer, the dabblers and those who like astrology just for entertainment, will all enjoy what we have to offer in this guide.

We invite you to help CosmoMuse's 2017 yearly guide become a reality by supporting our Indiegogo campaign as we seek to get this printed and into your hands before the new year!


Inside Our Guide

Ours is a full color publication that is printed on un-coated, recycled paper with a 'bookazine' vibe. In our inaugural issue, we have five beautiful editorial features that create synergy with our theme for the year (A Year of Great expectations), as well as a guide for each of the twelve zodiac seasons. These seasonal sections are packed with horoscope-type information, full and new moon themes and rituals, wellness and mindfulness tips and poetic inspiration to help bring depth and intention to each of these 12, four week long, zodiac seasons.

Editorials:

  • Ash Bonelli, Seattle based astrologer (tapping into your sign's creative potential)
  • Ann Whittaker, Creative writer (restoking your inner flame)
  • John Kesler, Mindfulness expert (meditation for centering in courage)
  • Brooke Musat, Yoga instructor (yoga poses to inspire greatness)
  • Allie Couch, ComoMuse founder (how to host a full moon gathering)


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $15,000 to get a minimum print run made with a zero carbon printer.
  • We have lots of exciting pledge packages and perks!!
  • If we don't reach our goal, not to worry, we will still get a digital print made and to you. In the very least, a PDF of the publication will go to your inbox.


Risks & Challenges

We will do everything we can to get this publication printed and to you by the first week of December, but being a startup, there are always unforeseen obstacles with new vendors and processes. You will know as soon as we do, if there are any delays in our production or delivery process.

story:
About us

In may 2013, we started the project “Momento Dulce” in our house kitchen. The idea was to combine our family’s most traditional and delicious recipes with some, most modern ingredients in order to have a unique product with an incomparable taste and freshness.

We offered our products to different restaurants and little by little many others joined our client list as we increased production and variety along the way, always keeping our original recipes, freshness and homemade flavor.

"Momento Dulce" started trending locally thanks to satisfied clients, friends and family. We started offering our sweets for every occasion and are currently being offered all over the city.

Social media has been essential to our growth; we’ve been able to increase our exposure beyond the range of direct influence, as well as offering promotions, deliveries and other alliances with different companies. It’s our window to followers and costumers who greatly enjoy everything we offer.

Although our plan is to export our products worldwide, our current goal is to succeed in the national market. We know our own limitations due to the increasing demand in the local market.

Next Step

With your support we plan to reach further. First, by acquiring new equipment and workspace; this will allows us to increase our production and guarantee adequate storage and preservation. Second, we want to increase our range of action through paid advertisement which will helps us expand even more our reach.

Local products are key in the development of our project. The quality of our products is guaranteed by the high quality of the products made locally. Also, we want “Momento Dulce” to be known by its high appreciation for local producers and their products.

At Momento Dulce we care about the environment and that’s why we want to develop environmental-friendly packages and wrappers using recycled materials, which not only are high quality but also helps to reduce the carbon print.

We want to go beyond and follow new healthy trends like creating a line of deli, gluten and lactose-free products with natural ingredients with guaranteed flavor and quality.

Our Costs

  • Multi Deck Oven : US$ 8,100. Will help reduce daily cooking time in about 30% which will help us increase production.

  • 20 Quart Commercial Planetary Mixer: US$ 1,350. This will allows us have larger orders by improving preparation time by 35%.

  •  2 storage freezers: US$ 6,750. This equipment will allow preserve our final product and improve delivery time.

  • Aluminiun Top Table: US$ 500. When working in the kitchen, order is essential. That’s why this this item is key in our inventory, by having a large workspace to better handle our ingredients.

  • Pastry Display Fridge: US$4,250. To expose the final products in the shop for all the costumers to see.

  • Refrigerated Truck: US$ 15,550. This is important to guarantee the freshness of our products when making deliveries. 

Where do the funds go if goal is not achieved?

The funds raised will help us take the first steps in our expansion process. Initially, these funds will contribute to the improvement of equipment and production line. In addition, they will serve to carry out a training process that allows us to have the necessary tools to innovate in the areas where we want to grow. To the extent that we achieve the expected development, we will advance to the stage of the incorporation of new packaging for the premium line, which will allow us to continue to develop as a friendly environment business. Subsequently, we will work on the "Deli" line with which we intend to incorporate 100% natural products that expand our market.

WHY BELIEVE IN US?

This campaign aims to achieve 7 different competitive and high-impact strategies to consolidate our project.

  • We are a growing business looking to increase capacity and marketing

  • Reaching the goal of introducing our product to

  • Offering a delivery service will bring our fine products to the client

  • Our premium line will come in recycled, environmental-friendly packaged. Benefits of recycling will be available to clients on our website, as well as a do-it-yourself guide for recycling

  • Local producers will benefit from our growth as they are essential in the making of our final products

  • With your support we will develop our premium deli line which will include gluten and lactose-free products with no refined sugars. 100% natural ingredient aimed for those who want to be healthy and have their "Momento Dulce".

  • Carrying out this plan will let us bring a new entrepreneurs in a country with little resources for them. Through our “Success Case”, will could help those who day by day are joining these initiatives but soon give up due to the lack of preparation and support needed.

At Momento Dulce, we’ve always developed plans to preserve the environment, client’s well-being and the growth of our community; that’s why we want to keep growing. We want many to know our philosophy and to benefit from our contribution to society, as we are young entrepreneurs committed to our work and our social responsibility. 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

Thanks to the experience gained over these two years of work, during which we develop our project "Sweet Moment", we have identified two key issues that require our attention and constant vigilance:

 - Competition: The world of pastry is highly competitive, we have managed to earn a space thanks to the quality of our products, artisanal preparation and a culture of customer service that always puts him at number one of our priorities for this reason we have to keep these guidelines to ensure the success of our campaign.

- New technologies: The foundation of our growth has been the use of social networks, and we know that they are constantly changing, so we must have the ability and preparation to adapt to these changes and remain in constant communication with our customers through channels they might use.

Our Team

- Irene: Marketing Degree as my profession but a true lover of cooking and creating marvelous sweets especially, for almost three years I have been developing this project and I'm in love with it, with my team inside and outside of the kitchen,  where we want to reach more customers to gift them a Sweet Moment.

- Alfredo: He has directed the project with me from the beginning, he has been responsible for sales, marketing and finances, and always brings new recipes that keep my collaborators motivated in the kitchen.

- Sara: She has helped us in many ways within the company, from packaging designs to translations for this campaign. Her specialty is fashion so she is always looking to add something special and different to everything we do.

- Gabo: He’s our industrial designer and has become a fundamental part in this new stage, he is in charge of designing the new packaging line, and always focused on friendly practices with the environment, he has known how to find the ideal combination between excellent design and great materials.

- Miky: He has been our graphic designer from the beginning, labels, logo, business cards and all that represents us is thanks to his creativity, the video we will present for our campaign is just another great work by him.

- Karelys: Thanks to her experience she has guided us throughout the journey, she is responsible for all communications of the company and always wants to help in the kitchen with traditional recipes that our confectioners combine perfectly with today ingredients.

- Jose Manuel: He is working with us in the first steps to position our brand abroad, he also collaborated on the translations for our campaign.

- Larry Salazar: He is working with us in the first steps to position our brand abroad. He has experience in production, export and logistics . It has been a very good additon to our team to develop our expansion plans .

- Amarilys: His creativity is reflected in our packaging designs and collaborate in the development of the new line deli

- Luis, Carolina, Paola, Manuel, Pedro, Rene, Dorys, Doriana, Andrés, Alicia, Daniel, Jessica, Mafer, Andrea, Ediverto, Pastora, Gastón, Claudia, Mariana, Larry, Diana, Exilde, Franklin: Each of them helps us daily in the preparation of our desserts , delivery , sales, marketing and any activity we have to do , they are a fundamental part of our great team

Refrigerated Truck: US$ 15,550. This is important to guarantee the freshness of our products when making deliveries. 

Where do the funds go if goal is not achieved?The funds raised will help us take the first steps in our expansion process. Initially, these funds will contribute to the improvement of equipment and production line. In addition, they will serve to carry out a training process that allows us to have the necessary tools to innovate in the areas where we want to grow. To the extent that we achieve the expected development, we will advance to the stage of the incorporation of new packaging for the premium line, which will allow us to continue to develop as a friendly environment business. Subsequently, we will work on the "Deli" line with which we intend to incorporate 100% natural products that expand our market.
WHY BELIEVE IN US?
This campaign aims to achieve 7 different competitive and high-impact strategies to consolidate our project.

We are a growing business looking to increase capacity and marketing
Reaching the goal of introducing our product to
Offering a delivery service will bring our fine products to the client
Our premium line will come in recycled, environmental-friendly packaged. Benefits of recycling will be available to clients on our website, as well as a do-it-yourself guide for recycling
Local producers will benefit from our growth as they are essential in the making of our final products
With your support we will develop our premium deli line which will include gluten and lactose-free products with no refined sugars. 100% natural ingredient aimed for those who want to be healthy and have their "Momento Dulce".
Carrying out this plan will let us bring a new entrepreneurs in a country with little resources for them. Through our “Success Case”, will could help those who day by day are joining these initiatives but soon give up due to the lack of preparation and support needed.

At Momento Dulce, we’ve always developed plans to preserve the environment, client’s well-being and the growth of our community; that’s why we want to keep growing. We want many to know our philosophy and to benefit from our contribution to society, as we are young entrepreneurs committed to our work and our social responsibility. 

RISK AND CHALLENGES
Thanks to the experience gained over these two years of work, during which we develop our project "Sweet Moment", we have identified two key issues that require our attention and constant vigilance:
 - Competition: The world of pastry is highly competitive, we have managed to earn a space thanks to the quality of our products, artisanal preparation and a culture of customer service that always puts him at number one of our priorities for this reason we have to keep these guidelines to ensure the success of our campaign.
- New technologies: The foundation of our growth has been the use of social networks, and we know that they are constantly changing, so we must have the ability and preparation to adapt to these changes and remain in constant communication with our customers through channels they might use.

Our Team
- Irene: Marketing Degree as my profession but a true lover of cooking and creating marvelous sweets especially, for almost three years I have been developing this project and I'm in love with it, with my team inside and outside of the kitchen,  where we want to reach more customers to gift them a Sweet Moment.
- Alfredo: He has directed the project with me from the beginning, he has been responsible for sales, marketing and finances, and always brings new recipes that keep my collaborators motivated in the kitchen.
- Sara: She has helped us in many ways within the company, from packaging designs to translations for this campaign. Her specialty is fashion so she is always looking to add something special and different to everything we do.
- Gabo: He’s our industrial designer and has become a fundamental part in this new stage, he is in charge of designing the new packaging line, and always focused on friendly practices with the environment, he has known how to find the ideal combination between excellent design and great materials.
- Miky: He has been our graphic designer from the beginning, labels, logo, business cards and all that represents us is thanks to his creativity, the video we will present for our campaign is just another great work by him.
- Karelys: Thanks to her experience she has guided us throughout the journey, she is responsible for all communications of the company and always wants to help in the kitchen with traditional recipes that our confectioners combine perfectly with today ingredients.
- Jose Manuel: He is working with us in the first steps to position our brand abroad, he also collaborated on the translations for our campaign.
- Larry Salazar: He is working with us in the first steps to position our brand abroad. He has experience in production, export and logistics . It has been a very good additon to our team to develop our expansion plans .
- Amarilys: His creativity is reflected in our packaging designs and collaborate in the development of the new line deli
- Luis, Carolina, Paola, Manuel, Pedro, Rene, Dorys, Doriana, Andrés, Alicia, Daniel, Jessica, Mafer, Andrea, Ediverto, Pastora, Gastón, Claudia, Mariana, Larry, Diana, Exilde, Franklin: Each of them helps us daily in the preparation of our desserts , delivery , sales, marketing and any activity we have to do , they are a fundamental part of our great team

story:
The Herbalized Podcast is a new initiative being launched for the Australian and world wide cannabis community. We aim to deliver up to date information of the laws and reforms across Australia and the rest of the world. Talking with growers, patients, dealers, artists,  dispensary owners, politicians, law enforcement and all the stakeholders invested in the cannabis culture. 

We will look at how legalization and decriminalization has affected various states and countries around the world. And the different models being used. We aim to keep the local and global cannabis community informed and educated!

 

We are currently looking for contributors from all over the globe. If your interested please email us at Herbalized420@gmail.com if you would be interested in joining The Herbalized Crew #THC. 

 

Currently trying to build our following so looking to partner with like minded cannabis people and businesses to work together. To share brands and cross promote for give always and competitions. As well as products to test and review on our YouTube page.  

 

Check us out on FB 

https://www.facebook.com/herbalized420/

 

Episode one - https://soundcloud.com/user-186840333/herbalize...

Episode two - https://soundcloud.com/user-186840333/the-herba...

story:
What is VivaFlow?

VivaFlow is a company dedicated to solving the fresh water scarcity problem in developing countries by purifying water from bodies of contaminated salt water.  Only 1% of Earth’s water is drinkable and the remaining 99% is stored in glaciers and the ocean, with over 1.2 billion people unable to access clean drinking water, In addition, more than 80 percent of disease in developing countries is linked to poor sanitation in water sources. We want to offer these 1.2 billion people a product that can provide them with freshwater despite the condition of the original water source. Developing coastal regions have convenient access to the ocean, but don’t have the means to filter the salts to make it drinkable, leaving them to resort to dirty and dangerous water from contaminated and disease infested sources. VivaFlow's first mission is to target coastal communities in Haiti, a country prone to natural disasters and water scarcity. We hope our technology can provide relief day to day and during the aftermath of natural disasters, when obtaining water can be a primary difficulty.

Our business creates a simple technology to desalinate and eliminate impurities in brackish and sea water. Our goal is to make such a system small, portable, and convenient to use, without relying on external energy sources or expensive materials.

We aim to reach out to individuals, co-operatives and charitable organizations created to help us raise money and achieve our goal of improving lives of underprivileged communities, specifically in Haiti. 

How Our Product Works

VivaFlow is founded at MIT. Our team is working with chemical engineers, MIT professors, phd students, and companies such as FEDCO and UNEEC. With weeks of research, consulting, and building, VivaFlow has made its first prototype.
 Our prototype system will consist of a hand pump the size of a traditional bicycle pump, which generates 120 psi with a small plunger moving up and down. The pump is attached to a metal hose which carries and sustains the pressure to the reverse osmosis membrane and custom made housing. Our first prototype will be able to filter brackish water with 4,000 ppm or less, and produce one gallon of fresh water in 20 minutes. 

What We Need and Where it's Going 

We need approximately $10,000.00 in order to help us get our company up and running. It will be distributed in these ways:

$2,000--> (Research & Development) Making our product more awesome!

$8,000 --> (Manufacturing and Distribution) This will let us build a large quantity of systems to be sold in developing communities. 

The first $500 raised will fund and reimburse the building of our first prototype. 

If we do not reach our goal, there are many important goals that will be accomplished using the money we raise. Primarily, the money will be targeted towards developing and improving our product design further with the help of chemical companies. Additionally, if we don't raise enough money for our previous goal, then we will donate the money to water purification charity that shares our same passion and commitment, generosity.org, which brings water to  developing countries that help underprivileged communities to obtain fresh water.

Why Fund Us?

Water filtration systems are not rare, but water scarcity and dirty water consumption is still an unsolved predicament across the globe. Currently, there are no water filters capable of filtering salt, a goal VivaFlow vows to bring to the world. To do this, we need your support and donations to distribute our products globally. 

These buyers, and you faithful supporters, will also help fund the manufacturing for the products being donated across the nation. The users in underdeveloped regions will use our product for natural disaster relief kits and to get clean drinking water from a near by salt water source everyday.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help at all. There are many other ways you can help make VivaFlow's mission a reality.

Spread the word - The more people you contact, the greater our difference. You can help make a change by talking to friends and family about our goals and campaign. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to inspire others to help solve the chronic problem of water accessibility that faces our world today .

story:
What is Panga?

To start with, the word 'panga' in Panama means a small, artisanal fishing boat traditionally used by fishermen on both the Caribbean and Pacific coasts. This boat is the modest backbone of the country's fish supply. Due to our restaurant's location, it became super obvious how dependent we are, as well as this country is, on the labor of pangas + pangeros (he who fishes in a panga).  'Panga' then became a metaphor for the methods of our grandparents, methods that fed generations of people -- and methods that are unfortunately disappearing because of this world's need for convenience. 

  • Chef Andrés Morataya started his academic career in comercial engineering but never saw a passionate future in it. He soon found himself in the sweaty doors of a kitchen for work and knew that he this was where the root of his passion would grow. He started a humble restaurant in the quaint town of Pedasí, Panamá where eventually, he was introduced to the Prince of Liechtenstein and worked for him for 5 years as a chef. Working with the Prince inspired Andres' thirst for knowledge -- as the Prince encouraged him travel to different countries to learn various techniques and forms of cooking. Andrés eventually found love (shout-out to Tuira) and relocated to Panama City, Panamá where marriage and a family soon followed. He was introduced to the mythical Manolo Caracol - a Spanish chef with many years in Panama, who really pioneered the idea of value in local products. Andrés worked as head chef for 2 years at Manolo Caracol -- which is where he found himself as a cook, taking his global knowledge of techniques and making them personal to his cuisine, using local ingredients and genuinely embracing a philosophy connected to the farm. 
  • Our campaign is about raising the funds needed to make our restaurant into something bigger than itself; the funds will allow us to reach the full potential of our project. Right now, PANGA is a farm-to-table restaurant that needs help in acquiring the materials and equipment necessary to make it as self-sustaining as possible. We want to be able to turn 1 product into 20 and for that, we need special tools. These tools will in turn allow us to form a larger connection to the community and its local producers. Today, we make cheese for ourselves but in the near future, we want a local producer to have the incentive to make cheese for us. The classic restaurant model typically creates X amount of jobs but if we help empower people from the local community, we not only create jobs but we also weave long-lasting impact into the fabric of their livelihoods. 
  • We collaborated with our friends from Fox Den Productions to make a short film that truly expresses our mission in its multilayered form. We wanted to bring people not only to PANGA but also to Panamá, a beautiful country with so much culinary potential. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $41,915 to truly get PANGA on its feet and mission-worthy. The costs of equipment and their shipment to Panama will heavily rely on all of your donations!
    • Meat Grinder: $700
    • Refrigerated Cold Work Station: $1,990 - It's a hot climate and we want to keep all of our seafood fresh -- it's imperative to create a reliable station that does just so.
    • More Refrigeration: $2,500 - An entire cow or hog are not small things to store. We will need all of the refrigeration devices and space we can afford. We will also be able to dry-age and cure meats with such a set-up.
    • Back-Up Generator: $3,300 - Electricity is not reliable when you live in the middle of nowhere so we need a good generator that will keep our inventory and business nice and safe.
    • Sausage Maker: $240
    • Whole Hog Smoker: $3,400 - This piece of gear also requires wheels and a trailer; we want to be able to bring PANGA to other destinations.
    • Water Filtration and Carbonation System: $4,000 - We want to make sure we can offer the best possible water to you as well as reduce plastic bottle usage. We also want to make our own sodas with seasonal fruits and avoid the use of commercial sodas.
    • Tools and Equipment: $2,500 - Out here in the Azuero Peninsula, we are a long way from home and a tool store -- and thus, require other types of equipment for construction. We don't only make food ourselves but sometimes we have to make tables, paint walls, re-wire lights, etc, so our toolbox has to be on steroids.
    • Bread Oven: $3,000 - A good, reliable oven is needed in every kitchen.
    • Used Pick-Up Truck: $15,000 - Many of our local providers do not own cars and only travel by horse -- so we have to go to the product and bring it back to PANGA. There have already been times where we couldn't purchase something because we couldn't arrange the transportation. This will allow us to bring whatever we find interesting back to PANGA and create something special for our clients in larger quantities (wink, wink Ricardo Perez, S.A.)
    • Raised Beds and Chicken Coop: $3,285 - We buy worm humus from a local farmer while we wait for our compost to be ready! Our raised beds are huge and we need a lot of soil to fill them up. The chicken coop and the rest of the raised beds will be made with different types of local wood and assembled by us but the materials aren't cheap -- between the wood, milling of it, and other structures needed to maintain the garden.
    • The Round Table: $2,000 - This table is something we're really looking forward to seeing finished. It will be built onsite due to the weight and size. This table will need to have personality as it will be the heart of PANGA. Here we will serve our tasting menu and it will act as PANGA's vessel, pushing the boundaries on locally-sourced ingredients. Fixed price, no menu, just sit down and enjoy the 7-10 course meal!

 

The Perks

  • A   $1-$20     A 'thank you,' 'gracias' or shout-out our Facebook wall 
  • B   + $25        A goodies bag with PANGA products (cheese, cured meats, venao sea salt) —  ***Ships only within Panama
  • C   + $75        Dinner for two at PANGA (booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules not ours)
  • D   + $125      The first three rewards all together — Options A + B+ C
  • E   + $175       A gift card for the PANGA tasting menu. What does that mean? Well as of now, we do not offer a tasting menu but once the crowdfunding campaign is finished, if you donate within this amount range and contact us within 75 hours ahead of time (yes we know 3 days is 72 hours, we just want to make sure you’re still paying attention), we will create a tasting menu just for you and one lucky son of a panguero! (booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules not ours) — And Options A + B
  • F   + $350      If you’ve watched our campaign film, you know that our most symbolic reward will be the machete exchange. Donate within this range and we will trade an old machete from a local machetero for a new one and put the old one on our wall of machetes in PANGA with your name on it! You will also receive a photo of the machetero with his new machete!                     — And Option A
  • G  + $550      A Farm-to-Table cooking class followed by a dinner for 2 at PANGA (booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules not ours) — And Option A + B —  ***Only applies to Panama or people willing to travel to Panama
  • H  + $750      A private dinner at your house (max 6 people + booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules, not ours) — And Options A+B —  ***Only applies to Panama
  • I    + $1,000   A seat with your name branded on it at our glorious tasting menu’s “Round Table” at PANGA — And Options A + B + C  —  ***Limit to one “name” per seat 
  • J    + $1,350   A day/adventure with Chef Andrés Morataya. Spend an entire day catered to an explorative activity: sourcing local products, fishing, kayaking through an estuary, horseback riding  in the valleys of the Azuero Peninsula, etc — And Options A + B + C —  ***Only applies to Panama or people willing to travel to Panama 
  • K   + $1,850   A private dinner party at PANGA (max 15 people + booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules, not ours) — Limited supply, only available to 15 Pledgers                            — And Options A+B —  ***Applies to Panama
  • L  + $7,000   We will go wherever you are and cook for you as long as you promise to take us to the closest farmer’s market in your proximity — (max 4 people + booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules, not ours) — And Options A + F + I —  ***Applies only to USA and Latin American countries

--- --- ---

  • If we don't reach our monetary goal by the end of this campaign, we will purchase what we can with the funds we raise on a priority basis. And of course, we will continue to work hard to save for the rest so we can actualize our full dream for PANGA. 

 

The Impact

As you can see in our film, we are making a serious effort to work with and also, inspire, the local producers in the Azuero region to symbiotically grow with us!

 

Risks & Challenges

"Ecologically speaking, the Azuero peninsula would seem to be a poor location for developing a restaurant at first glance. It has been impacted by waves of slash and burn clearing for cattle grazing that has destroyed all but a few patches of the original dry forests. Populations of many native species are low, either from hunting or habitat destruction. Yet, there was more here than it might appear." - Nicholas Gill from the New Worlder 

  • Chef Andrés Morataya has lived in 9 countries throughout his life. And for the first time, he has been able to call a place home -- that place being the Azuero Peninsula. With over 5 years of living out in this area, he not only comes with a profound knowledge of the cultural landscape but also, a desire to impact this community which he has grown to love. He and his wife did not wait for this campaign to start to begin their dream of PANGA. They used all of their savings to jumpstart the project and get to this point -- even a making a short film, presented here -- to truly bring people, strangers, everyone to Panama and of course, PANGA.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We know not everyone can afford to donate monetarily but if you take the time to watch our short film (really, it's a film) and feel inspired or the slightest bit of happiness, we ask that you share our IndieGogo campaign through any social media outlets -- but especially those that allow you to link back to this page! 
  • You can find us on social media here:
    • Instagram: @EnPanga
    • Facebook.com/RestaurantePanga

Muchas Gracias and so many thank you's to all who have helped us and will help us make PANGA's  dream an unbelievable reality!

The chicken coop and the rest of the raised beds will be made with different types of local wood and assembled by us but the materials aren't cheap -- between the wood, milling of it, and other structures needed to maintain the garden.

The Round Table: $2,000 - This table is something we're really looking forward to seeing finished. It will be built onsite due to the weight and size. This table will need to have personality as it will be the heart of PANGA. Here we will serve our tasting menu and it will act as PANGA's vessel, pushing the boundaries on locally-sourced ingredients. Fixed price, no menu, just sit down and enjoy the 7-10 course meal!


 
The Perks


A   $1-$20     A 'thank you,' 'gracias' or shout-out our Facebook wall 

B   + $25        A goodies bag with PANGA products (cheese, cured meats, venao sea salt) —  ***Ships only within Panama

C   + $75        Dinner for two at PANGA (booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules not ours)

D   + $125      The first three rewards all together — Options A + B+ C


E   + $175       A gift card for the PANGA tasting menu. What does that mean? Well as of now, we do not offer a tasting menu but once the crowdfunding campaign is finished, if you donate within this amount range and contact us within 75 hours ahead of time (yes we know 3 days is 72 hours, we just want to make sure you’re still paying attention), we will create a tasting menu just for you and one lucky son of a panguero! (booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules not ours) — And Options A + B


F   + $350      If you’ve watched our campaign film, you know that our most symbolic reward will be the machete exchange. Donate within this range and we will trade an old machete from a local machetero for a new one and put the old one on our wall of machetes in PANGA with your name on it! You will also receive a photo of the machetero with his new machete!                     — And Option A


G  + $550      A Farm-to-Table cooking class followed by a dinner for 2 at PANGA (booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules not ours) — And Option A + B —  ***Only applies to Panama or people willing to travel to Panama


H  + $750      A private dinner at your house (max 6 people + booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules, not ours) — And Options A+B —  ***Only applies to Panama


I    + $1,000   A seat with your name branded on it at our glorious tasting menu’s “Round Table” at PANGA — And Options A + B + C  —  ***Limit to one “name” per seat 


J    + $1,350   A day/adventure with Chef Andrés Morataya. Spend an entire day catered to an explorative activity: sourcing local products, fishing, kayaking through an estuary, horseback riding  in the valleys of the Azuero Peninsula, etc — And Options A + B + C —  ***Only applies to Panama or people willing to travel to Panama 


K   + $1,850   A private dinner party at PANGA (max 15 people + booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules, not ours) — Limited supply, only available to 15 Pledgers                            — And Options A+B —  ***Applies to Panama


L  + $7,000   We will go wherever you are and cook for you as long as you promise to take us to the closest farmer’s market in your proximity — (max 4 people + booze not included, IndieGogo’s rules, not ours) — And Options A + F + I —  ***Applies only to USA and Latin American countries


--- --- ---
If we don't reach our monetary goal by the end of this campaign, we will purchase what we can with the funds we raise on a priority basis. And of course, we will continue to work hard to save for the rest so we can actualize our full dream for PANGA. 
 

The Impact
As you can see in our film, we are making a serious effort to work with and also, inspire, the local producers in the Azuero region to symbiotically grow with us!
 

Risks & Challenges
"Ecologically speaking, the Azuero peninsula would seem to be a poor location for developing a restaurant at first glance. It has been impacted by waves of slash and burn clearing for cattle grazing that has destroyed all but a few patches of the original dry forests. Populations of many native species are low, either from hunting or habitat destruction. Yet, there was more here than it might appear." - Nicholas Gill from the New Worlder 
Chef Andrés Morataya has lived in 9 countries throughout his life. And for the first time, he has been able to call a place home -- that place being the Azuero Peninsula. With over 5 years of living out in this area, he not only comes with a profound knowledge of the cultural landscape but also, a desire to impact this community which he has grown to love. He and his wife did not wait for this campaign to start to begin their dream of PANGA. They used all of their savings to jumpstart the project and get to this point -- even a making a short film, presented here -- to truly bring people, strangers, everyone to Panama and of course, PANGA.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can afford to donate monetarily but if you take the time to watch our short film (really, it's a film) and feel inspired or the slightest bit of happiness, we ask that you share our IndieGogo campaign through any social media outlets -- but especially those that allow you to link back to this page! 
You can find us on social media here:
Instagram: @EnPanga
Facebook.com/RestaurantePanga



Muchas Gracias and so many thank you's to all who have helped us and will help us make PANGA's  dream an unbelievable reality!

story:
Who The Hell Are We?

We're just two crazy kids trying to find some nuts. We love food, family, fun and experiencing it all in our home of Olympia, Wa. We have two dogs and like us, they LOVE TREATS.

 

What We Believe In

We believe in creating a product we can stand behind 100%. We also believe in creating a sustainable business. Here are the ways we are going to make this happen: 

  • We will pasteurize our product. Meaning, every part of the gelato you eat will be made by hand and from scratch. 
  • We will use Tunawerth Dairy's milk, a local family dairy that uses organic practices. 
  • We will have 100% compostable or washable containers and utensils.
  • Our product will be made fresh daily in small batches. This will cut down on waste and allows us to maintain quality.  

 

Part Of Something Bigger

Sofie's Scoops will be one of nine businesses that will make up the 222 Market. The 222 Market is built on the ideas that surround good food, good people, opportunity, trust, support and awareness of it's community, and what it means to eat mindfully while sharing lasting experiences with one another.

 

 

 

Where We Are To Date

While we HAVE the vital funding for preliminary expenses, have purchased our equipment, began construction and completed our applications to the Health Department and Department of Agriculture, we are seeking some financial support that would help us with: 

  • Small-wares
  • Beginning inventory 
  • Signage 
  • Icicle Tricycle Freezer Bike 
  • Installation fees for equipment

 

We are at the precipice of our dream becoming a reality, but we are seeking your help to ensure the strong successful start we need!  

 

Our Goal: $10,000

 

 

Our Way Of Saying Thank You

In addition to the incentives for your support listed on the right, you will receive a special invitation to our opening, and your name on our “Cones Of Thanks” framed wall hanging that will be displayed in our shop! 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Even if you can’t contribute today, please spread the word! Use Indiegogo’s share tools located in the top right corner. #makethisshitviral #sofiesscoops #treats #loveyou

 

 

Thank You And See You For A Scoop!

story:
Nuwrk was founded on the principle that creativity and entrepreneurship happen in symbiosis


Nuwrk is asking for your help funding and developing our community and youth program streams. Engaging lessons and lectures on:

- Web app design and development

- Creative computation and computer art

- VR-related material with Oculus Rift and Unity engine

- New and emerging user interfaces: Microsoft Kinect, Brain-Computer Interfaces, Leap motion

- Physical computing and creative electronics with Arduino and Raspberry Pi

These lessons will be free for everyone, but we need your help to fund their creation.


PERKS! 






So... Who Are We?



We’re a coworking space and think-tank for individuals who don’t concern themselves with maintaining the status quo. Above all, we’re a community of diverse people who love to connect, collaborate, create, explore and evolve.



From the initial concept of simply creating a coworking space, to the final call to go deeper and build a collaborative learning environment, Nuwrk’s mission has expanded into something greater and more exciting than we could have anticipated. We’re pumped to share our goals with you and hope that you’ll feel as invested in our vision as we do.




Located in the heart of the busy Plateau Mont-Royal, Montreal’s most iconic neighborhood, Nuwrk is poised to become a hub for creativity and innovation in an area where collaborative spaces are surprisingly absent.

Our approach to building community is as unique as the vision of Nuwrk itself. We select individuals and small teams who bring a diverse array of experience and skills to our collaborative environment.


More Than Just a Coworking Space


As we mentioned, Nuwrk is more than just a place to open your moleskin and charge your laptop. We have three big initiatives planned for the space, which is where our $5000 goal comes in. Funding will support Weekend Youth and Technology Programs, our ongoing Lecture Series, and other Community Projects. Even if we don’t reach our entire goal, any funds donated will be put towards getting these initiatives off the ground.

1.  Weekend Youth + Technology Programs

Working with local schools and youth programs, our space will be used to run coding bootcamps and hackathons on weekends. These initiatives will be a partnership between pre-existing local programs in Montreal and Nuwrk. The space will be provided free of charge.

2.  Lecture Series

The best part about having a diverse community of workers is the inherent value of knowing tons of awesomely insightful people. On evenings and weekends, Nuwrk will host small, engaging lectures led by folks who are innovating in tech, social entrepreneurship, the arts and music. Our aim is to bring alternative perspectives to fields that are interesting for our community.

3.  Community Projects

What’s the point of having such a large space on St. Laurent if we aren’t going to share it? Whether it’s a startup wanting to hold a weekend offsite or a small group of community organizers looking for a space to meet, Nuwrk will rent our 1500 sq feet office space at cost to community groups with either a tech or social mandate


How Will Your Donation Help Us?

Your Donation Will Go Towards:

>>Nonprofit programs

>>Event budgets

>>Multimedia equipment

>>Development tools (ie: VR Goggles)

>>Subsidized rental rates for community groups


When you support at any level, you’re investing in the ideas and talent of people in our beautiful city. Any donation, large or small, is appreciated.

Let’s work together to ensure the future of Montreal is teeming with brilliant ideas and innovative thinking.


Thank you!



FAQ


What t-shirt sizes will you offer?

We will have sizes from S-XL for adults. Once the campaign ends, we’ll contact you to get information like your size and shipping address.

I have a question that wasn’t listed here. Who can I contact?

If you have any additional questions, please email us at info@nuwrk.com.

story:
redo

verb

:to do something again, especially in order to do it better

As the paths of life have led me to this moment, the more I have come to embrace the beauty of a redo. A room, a piece of furniture, a pattern of thoughts, a negative attitude, or the path that my life is currently on. I believe all are deserving of our time and attention to do it better.  Life is a daily redo, and we all have the privilege to walk this earth, to make better our world, our selves, our spaces we call home.

At redo, we long to bring healing to souls and  furniture alike. We are creating a space for scratched and worn furniture, for scratched and worn  souls to find restoration. Healing through time, creativity, imagination, encouragement and grace.  

By supporting our shop, you are supporting the journey of many. You are joining us in creating a space for weary travelers to find acceptance, validation and an opportunity to embrace their unique creativity. 

Our retail showroom will display the masterpieces of fellow travelers, while our workroom will provide the materials, tools, knowledge, support and encouragement for the masterpieces to unfold. 

Redo will be a space to connect, to come alongside fellow travelers, and to be fellow trail angels. To give, receive, encourage, validate, restore, value and embrace life, creativity and each other. 

We are so much more than a store, we are hope, we are laughter, acceptance, grace, encouragement, creativity, opportunity, to ourselves and to each other. 

Thank you so much, 

Peace, creativity and gratitudes

story:
My name is Rodney Williams I am the owner and founder of Imago Dei Cuts&Styles located at 174 Walnut street in Lockport NY. I have a background in youth empowerment and mentoring. I started 2 youth groups in the city of Lockport that are still going strong. I have a passion to see change in our youth. Which is part of the reason I am doing this campaign

The vision with this Mini resource center in our shop is so that teens can have a place to get internet access for school and life purposes. For example

Homework

Research Papers

Job applications

Tutoring (Hands on)

and for students who have to opportunity and choice to do virtual classes they have access 90 mins per day to complete their studies

 

 

With your help and contrubutions you are providing the following

3-5 web access computer systems

All in one printer

Table and Chairs for Studies

Snacks for Kids to have while doing research and Homework

Overall Safe and steady environment for kids (teens) to come and properly advance their study and work ethic

 

 

If you aren't able to contribute at this time please take a moment and share this campaign with someone would you think would be interested.

 

Thankyou  in advance

 

ImagoDei Cuts&Styles

story:
My Story

When my son was born, I made the choice to breastfeed him. Breastfeeding is not easy and not always convenient. It is not something that every woman is able to do or wants to do. 

But I did want to.

And it was my right to make that choice.

When I returned to work after maternity leave, I was confronted with the fact that my employer did not have a dedicated space for me to pump. Instead, I was obliged to use the employee bathroom, three times a day, to pump breastmilk that I later used to feed my son.

After a coworker had used the bathroom for its intended use, leaving it in less than sanitary condition, I found myself sitting in the bathroom in tears wanting to quit breastfeeding. Rather than quit, I decided to find a solution for a problem that myself and 50% of other working moms face every day. 

Federal law mandates that employers with 50 employees or more are required to provide a space, specifically other than a bathroom. However, only 35% actually provide a space.

If you're not sure why this is a problem, ask yourself, "Would I eat food prepared in a bathroom?" If this answer is "no," then you get it. 


Our Mission

WIN Workplace Solutions is a mother/daughter team working to produce a dedicated private and portable room for employers to provide to moms that need to pump breastmilk at work. 

Our product will make an impact by giving millions of moms who pump breastmilk at work equality of access to the resources that they need to continue breastfeeding after returning to work. This is a necessary effort because 49% of working women who breastfeed report that their work situation directly impacted their decision to quit. That 49% bears a strong resemblance to the 50% of women that pump in a bathroom. WIN is determined to change this. A woman should only quit breastfeeding if she wants to. 

We're calling our product The Corner Office because we believe that every woman is the executive of her life.

WIN also plans to make an impact by hiring single parents and paying them a thriving wage. Children of single parent families are four times as likely to experience poverty. Our commitment to paying a thriving wage will empower single parents to support their families.

We know that it will take time and determination to get our product to the point where we are able to manufacture it ourselves, but creating jobs is a top priority for WIN. 

We need your help!

WIN Workplace Solutions needs $7,000 to accomplish our goal of refining our design and creating a 3D model. The model  will allow WIN and its engineer to determine that the design is ready to move concept development into the prototype phase. We know that we can do this with your help!

Monetary contributions are not the only way to help! If you like our idea, share it with everyone you know! Click the social media buttons to share with all your friends!


About Us

Michelle Long is a mother of three and a grandmother of three. She has a Masters in tax and is currently working in the financial services field.

Heather Long is one of Michelle's children and a new mother herself. She currently works as a sales consultant in the mobile communications industry. 

We are WIN Workplace Solutions and we want to be makers of all the difference! We know we can do it with your help.


A special thanks to our team Joe Stauffer of Spark Innovations and Josh Stuckey of Think Stuckey and Triode Media Group, LTD. for a great video! A shout out to Nolt Companies for the use of their meeting space.

This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities.  Social enterprises focus on a trip bottom line:  people, planet, and profit.  Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2015, winners received over $50,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes.

Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information.  To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here: https://www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterprisePitch.

story:
Let's start!

40% of the world’s population has no access to the banking system that Western society takes for granted and could not function without.

3/4 Women in Developing World has no access to any finance system. 

Have you ever thought that money which you spend for coffee in Starbucks or any other Coffee shop could help someone to start running their business and earn money for living? No? We did! That's why we have joined Micro-Tyco challenge - a month long competition that enables us to practice and learn fundamental business principles in a safe, 'micro' environment. You think we only want to learn how to run the business or collect money? Not really! Keeping in mind that all money created by the Micro-Tycos is invested by WildHearts in micro-loans for poor entrepreneurs in the developing world we are stepping small steps to make meaningful changes in at least few people lives. 

Women are the most vulnerable part of society in developing countries, they work more and they earn less than men. 

Let us introduce Edwige from Benin. She left primary school and started working. To help look after her family and make sure her own children can stay in school, she opened a small shop which she ran from home. Business without investment is the same as plants without water. It just cannot survive. Edwige was lucky enough to get the loan of few hundreds of pounds from Wildhearts to develop her business (read more stories on Micro-Tyco page). 

We are group of 9 people who believe in stories which ends with 'Happily ever after' line and we want to be part of stories of successful business in developing world. Don't you want to join us? We bet you do! 

We may make a living by what we get but we make a life by what we give. 

Our goal is to collect 10000 euros which would be stored in the WildHearts fund to be available for new entrepreneurs in developing world. People have simple ideas on how to earn money, they only need a little help to do it. 

If you are still not convinced to click on 'Contribute' button, just take a look to our attractive PERKS on the right side. Yes! You are right! There is a unique possibility to buy extraordinary postcards that were drawn by our colleague. OR, you can get the magnificent wallpapers designed for you. OR, a surprise box! Who doesn't love surprises!? Can you imagine yourself skipping this opportunity of getting these WOW things? 

Artistic Postcards


Wallpapers


Surprise Box




Sharing is caring, isn't it?

WildHearts is a charity that has that resolve and is committed to launching companies that serve humanity. By combining philanthropy with entrepreneurial efficiency, they create sustainable, vigorously commercial vehicles that enable businesses to take a stand against economic injustice in an efficient and credible way.

They do not pity the poor, they empower them. They possess an unquenchable belief in the creativity and resilience of the human spirit and so they give the poor in the developing world a hand up and NOT a hand out, by funding microloans and business training. WildHearts is a means of fighting poverty that business people can relate to. 

Micro-Tyco is designed to liberate entrepreneurial thinking across our whole society. The money created from Micro-Tyco will be invested by WildHearts in micro-loans to help the world’s poorest people work their own way out of poverty with dignity and self respect. As a result participants are going from becoming dynamic wealth creators to global ethical investors. 

Micro-Tyco’s gift to everyone involved will be the knowledge that once you release your talents or money the whole world benefits.

Other Ways You Can Help

Anyone and everyone can make an impact.

  • Make some noise about our project: like us on Facebook and spread the idea around!

  • Please also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you, to each and everyone of you for taking the time to read about our project!

story:
Happy Pooch Canada


Short Summary

Happy Pooch Canada will be the first company in Canada to manufacture and sell hydroponically real grown grass to consumers that own pets. Our main focus is pet owners residing in Condos/Apartments. 

      

            

Think about this, dogs are naturally attracted to grass to urinate/defecate on. We will manufacture grass hydroponically (without the use of soil) to consumers for their pets. Its great for consumers that; work long hours, go out for several hours a day, have bad winters, senior's who own dogs, are training their dog, own or work with doggie day care centres, and more! Every year we have a plan in place to expand our marketing strategy with different advertisement implementations, we have ambitious plans to improve our product and to distribute our product more!       

Product/Service Summary

Hydroponically grown grass means that our grass is grown without the use of soil, its main ingredient is "Water". We use a sponge infused with Coco Liner as our medium for the grass growth, this helps as a natural feel for dogs as well as provide a protective absorbent layer. We will offer two models for consumers to choose from; Basic Model (18" by 24") $28.95 or XL Model (2.4 ' by 4' feet) $39.77. These are typically chosen by the size of the dog. If consumers own a small breed of dog, they will choose our Basic Model. If consumers own a medium-large breed of dog, they will choose our XL Model. Our models are 12-22% bigger than any other competitors in the U.S.A. 


       

        Small Dog Owners (Basic Model)
  • $99 CAD - Receive Our Basic Model Bi-Weekly for 2 Months ($143 Value)
  • $226 CAD - Receive Our Basic Model Bi-Weekly for 6 Months ($347 Value)
  • $515 CAD - Receive Our Basic Model Bi-Weekly for 1 Year ($858 Value)

 

        Medium-Large Dog Owners (XL Model)
  • $142 CAD - Receive Our XL Model Bi-Weekly for 2 Months ($204 Value)
  • $405 CAD - Receive Our XL Model Bi-Weekly for 6 Months ($623 Value)
  • $739 CAD - Receive Our XL Model Bi-Weekly for 1 Year ($1,230 Value)
    Canadian Residences will receive free shipping, as we are a Canadian Based  Company. United States contributors will have to pay a $7-$11 Delivery fee

    We will update on Indiegogo when our product becomes available and ready to be shipped.


There are no companies in Canada that offer hydroponically grown grass for doggies!

The beauty of our business is we will offer a continuous delivery plan in which consumers can choose a bi-weekly or monthly subscription. We will automatically charge their credit card/paypal account and ship out their chosen model. This will help busy dog owners with the convenience of a new "Happy Pooch" real grass patch without having to keep re-ordering. 

                                                 


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $320,000 for the start of our business. The funding will go into purchasing equipment, supplies, early-staffing and marketing. If we don't reach our goal of $320,000, we need a minimum of $280,000 to grow into our fullest potential. We will make this product huge all over Canada and we have plans to grow into China and the U.K. in the future. 

    We need contributors like you to help us start our future success!

Our Charity (Perks)

  • $5 Perk - Will get you mentioned in our "Special Thanks" weekly post on our Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr page! We will mention your First and Last name.  
  • $10 Perk - We will donate one Basic Model to a senior. Many seniors that own a dog face the problem of taking their dog out or having no one to take their dog out for them. So help us, help them! We will be working together with Retire-At-Home Services for this project. Your name will also be mentioned in our Special Thanks post in our social media pages.
  • $15 Perk - There are so many homeless people out there with dogs. And their beloved companion needs to eat too. One of our top priorities is helping dogs who need assistance. For this $15 contribution, we will donate a bag of dry dog food to the Peoples Animal Welfare Society. Your name will also be mentioned in our Special Thanks post in our social media pages.
We care a lot about people who require a service dog, that's why we will donate 5% of our raised funding to Canadian Service Dog Foundation! With each contribution, you are helping us make people and doggies happy everywhere! And we love that :). So, whatever you contribute, we thank you in advance for believing in us.

                                    The Impact

In Canada, there is no product like what we're going to manufacture. There is no Real Grass for pets that is hydroponically grown. The only options in Canada for pets is Synthetic Grass, Pee Pads (Wee Wee Pads), and Soil-Based Grass (Only in Vancouver, BC). So my question to you is, will you as a human being urinate or defecate anywhere but the toilet? The answer is NO, so why should our dogs do their "business" on anything else but, what their naturally attracted to? Our product is the best there is out there. Dog's are naturally attracted to "Real Grass" so, why not give it to them? We grow our grass with our hydroponic method and instead of soil we use a sponge infused with coco liner. This gives dogs a "dirt" feel, but in fact is just a sponge medium. Not only that, but it gives our product a secondary absorbent protection from urine. 

     

Looks like dirt? Well, its not, that is a sponge infused with coco liner (Coconut "Hair").

I have a Yorkshire Terrier and I always leave her home for several hours a day. So, my problem was I always worried about my dog being at home without anywhere to go pee. She doesn't use synthetic grass and she rips up pee pads. So, I thought, well how about I grow some real grass and put it in a box for her. I started doing some research and found out about the hydroponic growing method. So, I started my own experiment and grew a patch and "WOW" she used it. I was so happy and pleased and feel so assured when I'm at work. So, I thought, why isn't there a product like this out there in Canada? That's when I started working on a company and voila, behold Happy Pooch Canada. Fresh Hydroponically Grown Grass for Your Pet!

               



How We're Different

In Canada, our competitors are; synthetic grass (Fake Grass), Pee Pads (Absorbent Paper Pads), and Soiled-Grass Patch (Only in Vancouver, BC).

Our product is better and this is why:

  • Soil-Less (Hydroponically Grown: All we use is our sponge/coco liner medium, grass seeds, water, and vitamins)

         

  • 10 x More Absorbent (Natural grass absorbs more than synthetic or pee pads, our hydroponic method also enriches the grasses absorbing effect. In the grasses entire growing life it is in water, and because of this it is even more super absorbent to any liquid, including urine. Our medium is also another extremely absorbent layer. Not enough? How about a water-resistant box as another precaution. That means you won't have any urine on the floor or on the balcony.)

         

  • 95% Less Odour than any competitor (Because of the high absorbency from our hydroponic growing method, our natural living grass also eliminates almost all odors that comes from urine. Synthetic/Pee Pads generally have only 0-15% absorbency but, there is no odour eliminator, thus having high levels of odour from urine.)

         

  • Best for Puppy Training (Dog's are naturally attracted to "Real Grass". So, they should be trained on "Real Grass". This helps them get ready to be walked outside by their owner and not urinate on bed sheets, carpets, and hardwood floors. Research  has shown that Pee Pads often mislead puppies into thinking bed sheets or hardwood floors are the same.)

  • No Mess, No worms (No Soil = No Mess and No Worms! Our hydroponic method eliminates mess and worms that arise from soil-grown grass.)
  • Bio-Degradable (Our product is 100% Bio-Degradable. That means owners simply throw the entire unit down the garbage shoot. Yup, it's that simple!)
  • Easy, Easy, Easy! (Our product is designed to be very user-friendly and easy. Consumers simply choose a plan, receive the package and place on the floor. When the new unit arrives, they simply discard the old unit and replace with the new!)        

Strategy & Implementations

Our plan is to establish our manufacturing facility as soon as possible. Facility set up will require 30 days to complete and another 12 days to have inventory prepared and ready to ship. When the inventory is established and ready to ship, we will then implement our full marketing and advertising strategy to get our product out, as well as create awareness to generate orders. We will update on Indiegogo for contributors who ordered perks.

During our facility set up we will also organize our manufacturing team, distribution team, and customer service team. We will conduct training to our staff, educating them on the product and our manufacturing and distribution process.


Challenges

Our only challenge is we can't sell our product in-store. So, you can't walk into a Pet-Smart or Pet-Valu and see our product. Our sale platform is only online but, don't worry, that's not a problem because we already have a plan in place. 6 months after we launch, we will be launching our In-Store Marketing/Sales Operation. Our plan is not to sell our product to stores but, instead, sell our Gift Cards to stores. 

Customers, while waiting to cash out in line, will see our gift cards on the rack. They can buy the gift card and order from our website, we then will ship them our product. With that guess what, we won't have to pay any Shelf Space Premiums! This encourages in-store costumers to also sign up and choose a subscription plan for future orders. 


                     

                             



Other Ways You Can Help
It's okay if you don't contribute but, help us by sharing our campaign to your friends and family. Use Indiegogo sharing tools and help us get the word out. Canada needs a company like us!

                               Have A Question?

Comment on our Indiegogo campaign or post a question on our Facebook page @ happy pooch and we will respond! All feedback is appreciated!
