story:
About Malindi Kenya

With an Italian-sounding name, some of the best pizza in all of Africa and, well, plenty of Italian tourists, it would be easy to dismiss Malindi as just another European holiday resort. Until, that is, you wander through the alleys of the atmospheric old town, stop for fresh oysters beside the Indian Ocean and pause for Swahili cakes on Jamhuri Street Malindi, it turns out, is quite the charmer.

Malindi is an amazing place among other destinations in East Africa. As residents of Malindi Kenya, we have enjoyed many years of favorable tourism. however, trouble in the horn of Africa especially Somalia and the frequent attacks of the Somali militia group Al Shabab, the number of tourists have dwindled. Foreign media companies have also painted Kenya as a terror hotbed  a thing that keeps on affecting negatively the major revenue earner of the small coastal town.
Even before then, tourism in Malindi relied on word of mouth of a few individual tourist that spread the word to Italy. This made Malindi "Little Italy", a haven visited mostly by Italian businessmen and pensioners, politicians and celebrities.
Tourism has had its effects on malindi  especially the youth. As important as it is, we need diversity. There is need to grow past tourism and make more for ourselves.
OUR GOAL
  1. We would like to increase the awareness people have on malindi town. This applies both locally and internationally. We need to spark and that urge that will make people want to come and visit, explore and enjoy life in Malindi.
  2. Provide adequate information to visitors/tourists of the various attraction sites, hotels/lodges/resorts, restaurants & places to eat, activities that can be done etc
  3. Create avenues/platforms that will provide job opportunities that are not directly related to tourism
What we have done so far
For the past one year, we have locally been running a campaign to promote different sectors within the town. This has been made possible through creation of a website and a different social media accounts targeting people of Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.


We have been showcasing attractions, hotels and talent in individuals and groups through video documentaries on YouTube. This has enabled create increase exposure on individuals in arts and Music scenes within Malindi.
What we plan to do with the money

$20,500 is a lot of money! Why do you need so much money? We are glad you asked! Capacity development involves building proper framework that is going to work today and many days to come. Coming from a third world country, our town lacks most of the normal facilities that are found in many other cities in developed countries. For facilities that can be found within, they are overpriced making them not affordable. 

We have planned to establish an office that will act as the center of operation as well as a place where people can obtain information about Malindi town. The office will require to be furnished and equipped with basic computer systems to allow operations.

A photography and a video team will also be created to allow continuity to "The Malindians" video series as well as taking photographs of attractions within the town. This team will be accompanying reviewers when visiting different hotels, villas & resorts.

Finally, we will create a business wing that will be in charge of generating revenue for the Center. Among other things, they will be in charge of coming up with ideas of things the center will be engaged into to ensure sustainability. These will include creating souvenir to tourists. 

Checkout our breakdown below:

1. Premises Lease - $2,000

2. Five (5) Computers / Laptops - $3,500

3. Cameras & Equipment - $2,500 

4. Stationery - $350

6. Website development Services - $400*

7. Travel cost - $750

8. Marketing -$500

9. Income Generating Activities (Sustainability) -$9,100

10. Miscellaneous**  - $1,600


TOTAL: $20,500

* Website development services includes file uploading, custom css design, cost and price tables, project timeline organizer, shop quote, CRM and checkout are just a few of the service features that will allow me to focus more on the business and less on what would otherwise be the non-critical, time-consuming tasks

** Miscellaneous or operations money is an amount that will keep us afloat before we start making a profit


SUSTAINABILITY


Primarily, I am targeting  learning institutions such as Kindergartens, Primary schools, secondary schools, universities and Colleges. These institutions have an ever increasing demand to furnish their students custom printed clothing in form of uniforms.I am also targeting event organizers, hotels & resorts, tour & safari companies, tech start-ups,  online media and maker community. This is where I want to associate and connect, providing services to a community of fellow innovators. My goals for the future are to grow the shop into a full-fledged print shop housed in a building owned by myself with a dedicated staff in Malindi. The Print shop will be designing, creating and selling Malindi branded apparel to tourists as souvenir. 
Samples of T-shirt  Designs
#MyTown


Run Malindi

My focus is promoting tourism in Malindi Kenya as a well as putting it on the digital map as a tourist destination, establishing something for myself, getting better connected with my community and to help the youth in my community follow suit so we can bring up a better foundation. This is a stepping-stone to my goal of building wealth and financial independence, by introducing Malindi (Community) to such resources.

  1.  Heat press machine with a quality-backed warranty and service support.    
    Cost: $2,500.00
  2. Professional grade inkjet printer
    Cost: $500
  3. Vinyl cutter 
    Cost: $400
  4. Printing supplies 
    Cost: $350
  5. Initial sample stock and minimal marketing material 
    Cost: $1,000
  6. Business incorporation (proper permits, licenses, and trademark)
    Cost: $2,750
  7. Screen Printing Machine Cost: $1600

TOTAL: $ 9,100

* Items 1-5 are crucial to completing projects with much less dependence on outside services, thus keeping my margins higher and risk lower.


The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

A true challenge is that Malindi Kenya is not a popular tourism destination in Kenya let alone the whole world.However, we as the people of Malindi, boast of having attracted the likes of F1 Billionaire Flavio Briatore, Super Model Naomi Campbell, world class actor Denzel washington, Music sensation Avicii and many other people. Therefore, we still believe in the viability of this project.

What if we don’t make enough?

We will push forward with our project as if have been doing for the last one year. We are going to use every penny contributed to make it happen.  If we can’t get the funding through these donations entirely, we’ll seek out other financial resources and finish the project.

What if we make too much?

If we have a surplus of money, we plan to buy flight tickets for our donors to come experience Malindi Kenya, a destination that they have contributed to put it on the digital map.  We will use up all the extra funds giving this opportunity to our donors until it’s finished.


How you can help if you can’t contribute

We know not everybody has the funds to help us monetarily, and that’s okay!  You can still help us out be using the Indiegogo share tools from this page and spread the word of our project.  Email your friends, share it on social media, and we’ll be in business.
story_txt:
About Malindi Kenya
With an Italian-sounding name, some of the best pizza in all of Africa and, well, plenty of Italian tourists, it would be easy to dismiss Malindi as just another European holiday resort. Until, that is, you wander through the alleys of the atmospheric old town, stop for fresh oysters beside the Indian Ocean and pause for Swahili cakes on Jamhuri Street Malindi, it turns out, is quite the charmer.
Malindi is an amazing place among other destinations in East Africa. As residents of Malindi Kenya, we have enjoyed many years of favorable tourism. however, trouble in the horn of Africa especially Somalia and the frequent attacks of the Somali militia group Al Shabab, the number of tourists have dwindled. Foreign media companies have also painted Kenya as a terror hotbed  a thing that keeps on affecting negatively the major revenue earner of the small coastal town.
Even before then, tourism in Malindi relied on word of mouth of a few individual tourist that spread the word to Italy. This made Malindi "Little Italy", a haven visited mostly by Italian businessmen and pensioners, politicians and celebrities.
Tourism has had its effects on malindi  especially the youth. As important as it is, we need diversity. There is need to grow past tourism and make more for ourselves.
OUR GOAL



We would like to increase the awareness people have on malindi town. This applies both locally and internationally. We need to spark and that urge that will make people want to come and visit, explore and enjoy life in Malindi.

Provide adequate information to visitors/tourists of the various attraction sites, hotels/lodges/resorts, restaurants & places to eat, activities that can be done etc
Create avenues/platforms that will provide job opportunities that are not directly related to tourism

What we have done so far
For the past one year, we have locally been running a campaign to promote different sectors within the town. This has been made possible through creation of a website and a different social media accounts targeting people of Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.




We have been showcasing attractions, hotels and talent in individuals and groups through video documentaries on YouTube. This has enabled create increase exposure on individuals in arts and Music scenes within Malindi.



What we plan to do with the money

 $20,500 is a lot of money! Why do you need so much money? We are glad you asked! Capacity development involves building proper framework that is going to work today and many days to come. Coming from a third world country, our town lacks most of the normal facilities that are found in many other cities in developed countries. For facilities that can be found within, they are overpriced making them not affordable. 
We have planned to establish an office that will act as the center of operation as well as a place where people can obtain information about Malindi town. The office will require to be furnished and equipped with basic computer systems to allow operations.
A photography and a video team will also be created to allow continuity to "The Malindians" video series as well as taking photographs of attractions within the town. This team will be accompanying reviewers when visiting different hotels, villas & resorts.
Finally, we will create a business wing that will be in charge of generating revenue for the Center. Among other things, they will be in charge of coming up with ideas of things the center will be engaged into to ensure sustainability. These will include creating souvenir to tourists. 
Checkout our breakdown below:
1. Premises Lease - $2,000
2. Five (5) Computers / Laptops - $3,500
3. Cameras & Equipment - $2,500 
4. Stationery - $350
6. Website development Services - $400*

7. Travel cost - $750
8. Marketing -$500
9. Income Generating Activities (Sustainability) -$9,100
10. Miscellaneous**  - $1,600

TOTAL: $20,500
* Website development services includes file uploading, custom css design, cost and price tables, project timeline organizer, shop quote, CRM and checkout are just a few of the service features that will allow me to focus more on the business and less on what would otherwise be the non-critical, time-consuming tasks
** Miscellaneous or operations money is an amount that will keep us afloat before we start making a profit



SUSTAINABILITY

Primarily, I am targeting  learning institutions such as Kindergartens, Primary schools, secondary schools, universities and Colleges. These institutions have an ever increasing demand to furnish their students custom printed clothing in form of uniforms.I am also targeting event organizers, hotels & resorts, tour & safari companies, tech start-ups,  online media and maker community. This is where I want to associate and connect, providing services to a community of fellow innovators. My goals for the future are to grow the shop into a full-fledged print shop housed in a building owned by myself with a dedicated staff in Malindi. The Print shop will be designing, creating and selling Malindi branded apparel to tourists as souvenir. 

Samples of T-shirt  Designs
#MyTown



Run Malindi




My focus is promoting tourism in Malindi Kenya as a well as putting it on the digital map as a tourist destination, establishing something for myself, getting better connected with my community and to help the youth in my community follow suit so we can bring up a better foundation. This is a stepping-stone to my goal of building wealth and financial independence, by introducing Malindi (Community) to such resources.

story:
Aloha!

Mana pule services is based in maui Hi
I am very grateful and inspired to live in such a beutiful place
maui and all of polynesia has continued to inspire me .
I have been practicing theraputic massage in hawaii since 2007
I have created a line of natural body care products using our islands live and nutrient rich fruits ,herbs and oils as the base to all of my products to accompany my massage therapy sessions
I have been studying polynesion and and chinese medicinal herbs and application methods for approximatly 7 years 
I also do private catering here utilizing local in season producer and indigenous eating habits ,sharing the tradition and values of ancient polynesion culture to residents and guests here on maui.
Mana pule natural herbal products include:
 A line  of 11 medicinal single herb organic liquid herbal extracts
-live herbs and fruits soaked and cured in organic grain alcohol,
All natural body care products -
Natural seasalt exfoilating body scubs and raw canesugar body polish,herb and fruit infused soaps and lotions to enrich the skin with nutrients and aid in mild detoxification of subtle impuritys in the body
Culinary infusion options-
Mana pule culinary infusions include medicinal blend natural seasalt
All natural fruit and herb infused gourmet simple syrups and a line of cocktail rimmers to decorate and enhance the flavor of your beverage
Great for gatherings and get togethers!

What We Need & What You Get

For those of you who know me personally you know this is my passion!
I am dedicated to my practice of herbal care and knowledge of traditional wisdom and practice .

Ok so now that you know what I do, I would like to tell you where my funds will be going!

Personal private insurance!

Commercial kitchen fees!

Upgrading and maintaining labels and website!

Packageing material- we are sourcing as natural and eco sensitive as possible!

Marketing and advertising!

  • I truly believe that crowd sourcing is an excellent way to create funds and have the opportunity to give back to multiple people just like myself creating there own independent source of revenue and fueling there dream!

  • All funds will go to enhancing manapule product -keeping ingredients pure and leaveing a light eco foot print.
  • If you cannot contribute financially please SHARE ME !!!
  • WHERE?ANYWHERE AND EVERYWHERE _FACEBOOK<TWITTER<INSTAGRAM!!!!MAHALO

The Impact

Mana pule community give back project!-

15% of manapules services annual income will go to local community programs that share native polynesion olelo or language and cultural heritage teaching programs as well as team up with other local buisnesses to create easy access grants for emergency house repairs and tax payment help for hawaiina homes.

Risks & Challenges

My focus is to utilize and share the incredible medicines here in hawaii as well as share my passion for purity healthy product.

After all its not just our bodys we are caring for, but future generation as well.

story:
We are purchasing a historic property in Louisiana. I am looking for our music entertainers or actors and actresses of Louisiana to help sponsor our project to get it off the ground preserving a little piece of Louisiana history. This property is in the heart of Cajun music and we want to bring it back to life. Reopening the bar and the 50's diner and the cute little hotel rooms. Any donation would help but we have some really creative ideas to bring this back. Please Share our tweets to everyone to bring this beautiful piece of history back to life.

Cajun music started in Louisiana and still thrives today. Researching in our area there are so many people who got their start in Louisiana I moved here a couple of years ago and completely fell in love. It is important to maintain the area for tourist as well as the people who live within the area.

We want to challenge everyone to push this an make it a success for the community. Once we are open we will hire some great bands from the area and push some great diner food with a nice place to stay after a day and evening on the town.. Join us and make this a success!

Please retweet!

story:
(sigue en Español)

Tania's Mother became victim of fraud when she tried to fix her immigration status, through a fraudulent notario. She was not only robbed of 7,000 but was also placed in removal proceedings. With over 4 years of being under trail, she has spent an additional 10,000 on lawyers and legal fees while appealing her deportation.
Her last immigration hearing is set for October 05, 2015, when a judge will decide if Imelda's case will be closed or if she will be forced out of the country.  Imelda has always been a hardworking family provider and has never asked anyone for money. However, lets show her support by helping her raise back the money she has invested in pursuing the American Dream.


Who is Tania? Tania has been working for the community for many years, advocating for human rights. In fact, she was a significant participant of the initiate Driver's Licenses for all in Colorado. Many undocumented residents of Colorado can now drive legally and unafraid thanks to this initiative in which Tania worked so hard for. The inspiring true story of these beautiful strong ladies has been captured in the form of a documentary film, produced with the intention of helping this family find some community support.

=

La Mama de Tania fue victima de fraude cuando intento arreglar su estatus migratorio por medio de un notario defraudador. No solo le robaron 7,000, sino tambien la pusieron en proceso de deportacion. Con mas de 4 años bajo juicio, ya a gastado adicionalmente mas de 10,000 en abogados y honorarios legales apelando su deportacion.
Su ultima audiencia de inmigracion esta fijada para Octubre 05, 2015, donde un juez decidira si se cierra su caso o si Imelda sera forzada a salir del pais.

Imelda, siempre ha sido muy trabajadora y proveedora de familia, y nunca le ha pedido dinero a nadie. No obstante, vamos a apoyarla ayudandole a recuperar el dinero que ha invertido en su busqueda por el Sueño Americano.

Quien es Tania? Tania ha trabajado en la comunidad por varios años, abogando por los derechos humanos. De hecho tuvo una gran participacion en la iniciativa de Licensias Para Todos de Colorado. Muchos residentes indocumentados de Colorado ahora pueden manejar sin miedo grasias a esta iniciativa en la que Tania trabajo arduamente. La inspiradora y real historia de estas bellas y fuertes mujeres ha sido brevemente capturada en una pelicula documental, la cual fue producida con el proposito de ayudar a esta familia a encontrar apoyo comunitario.

story:
The Children Of Africa Center Business Start-up Campaign 


The Children of Africa Center Started Out As A Childhood Dream.  

Now We Are Being That Dream. 

Now We Are Creating Brighter Days For Children. 

Now We Are Being The Change!


Kristofa Kala was an orphan to a single parent and at a young age he knew one day he would help kids who were just like him. When he became older he started his own non-profit orphanage and he now helps orphan children and widows. Kris is a very dedicated and driven individual. Kris spends all his time and energy ensuring the children are fed, have housing, and ongoing education. Kris is also active in creating local small businesses and inspiring community involvement. 

The Children of Africa Center supports 63 Orphans and Widows with food and water. Housing assistance is provided for all, while many kids are hosted at the center the center is only so large, that means building homes is an essential part of the work. Kris is the founder and on the ground director and organizer of The Children of Africa Center. Kris is only 28 but he started working with Community Based Organization in 2003. In 2008 he built the center and has been actively maintaining it since then. 

 

Your Support and Donations go Along Way! 

Just like every other successful business The Children Of Africa Center need a website to bring in steady and reoccurring donations. To run and maintain that website the ground crew in Tanzania need computer equipment and internet set up and installed, as well as long term domain and hosting plans for their new site.

The children need their education payed for in 2016. This is important!! If Kris can not provide the children with education then they do not get the chance to learn and have to stay home instead.

Currently Kris is working a job in another part of Africa to provide some food for the children. It is not nearly enough food for them all. We need food support for at least a year until the website can start bringing in steady donations. This money will be used to feed the 28 children three meals a day, instead of the normal one to two meals they receive now. This money will be used to feed the 35 widows three meals a day. This money also provides clean water for all of them for a whole year. 

A Little Is A Lot! 

A Break Down Of The Expenses 


Website Project: 

Funding for this goes to starting, constructing and maintaining a full time website. The domain and hosting will be paid for 10 years in advance so the Center does not need to worry about maintaining their site. 

Business Marketing Start-up: Funding for this will go to marketing the new business via marketing strategies by a paid professional. Goal is to increase The Children of Africa Centers donations and lively hood of the Children and Widows in Tanzania. 

Children's Education For 2016: This is to ensure the children get to continue their education for the 2016 school year. 

Business Equipment: Funding for this goes to providing Kris one computer and the children with one computer. This is also to provide them with a camera. These things will help further their online presence and growth and will give them the ability to help more children! 

Internet Setup: This is to set up an internet connection at their center. This is also to provide for the monthly internet fees for 2 years!! Enough time to have a website running that is bringing in steady donations. 

Food & Water For One Year: Funding for this goes to ensure that all 63 children and widows get three meals a day including water, for one year!! Any extra funding will go to finish building the center to be able to host more children!


Thank you for taking the time to read about our cause! 

We are actively creating brighter days for our children! 

You can be the change!! 


Ways you can help!!

You can help by donating, every 

dollar goes along way! 

You can also help by sharing this

with your friends and family!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi I'm Devotis Lee, the proud owner of D Cafe and Catering. We would like to raise 10,000 dollars for renovations and new equipment. The renovation include an improvement on lighting and lobby expansion for customers. We would also like to buy additional equipment to be able to cater to the growth of customers and employ more teenagers and college students.
What We Need & What You Get

From the ten thousand dollars, 3500 dollars would be invested in commercial equipment (like waffle irons, an addition double fryer, upgraded cash registers and etc.), 3200 dollars to redesign the kitchen partitions, improve lobby lighting and build a new countertop for additional customer seating along with additional tables and chairs, and 3300 dollars to accommodate the salaries for positions created for teenagers and college students in our community, which in return helps keep our kids and community safe.

For each individual that donates 

-$100 or less, we will send a personal thank you card signed by Ms.Devotis herself. 

-$100-$500, a D Cafe T-shirt

-$500 or more, the personal quote submitted by you will be written on the wall of quotes , with the author and your name or just your name.  (Submitted quotes must be in character , decent language for display to customers of all ages, genders,religions, cultures and nationalities. 

If we do not reach our entire goal , we will make a priority list, commercial equipment, lighting etc for continued uphill growth.

The Impact

This project is valuable, we are community oriented and the community that we serve is important to us, we want to create employment opportunities for young people from the community which creates safer environment.

I received several awards including the Secretary of State award, and YWCA of greater atlanta award for working with the communities youth programs like SCLC, Adopted Student, and Junior achievement. I feel hiring more young individuals gives us the chance to mentor young adults.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge with this expansion project is the time the renovations have to get done. Here at D Cafe ,our doors open at 8:30 am and stay open till 3:30 pm during the week days. We understand that fitting contruction time into our business hours is going to be tough but we believe working on our renovations during our closed days would provide the right balance of productivity and customer comfort.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate financially, please like and share our Facebook page and Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family! You can help us reach our goal! 

Thank you 

Sincerely, Devotis Lee

COME SEE US!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi I'm Devotis Lee, the proud owner of D Cafe and Catering. We would like to raise 10,000 dollars for renovations and new equipment. The renovation include an improvement on lighting and lobby expansion for customers. We would also like to buy additional equipment to be able to cater to the growth of customers and employ more teenagers and college students.
What We Need & What You Get
 From the ten thousand dollars, 3500 dollars would be invested in commercial equipment (like waffle irons, an addition double fryer, upgraded cash registers and etc.), 3200 dollars to redesign the kitchen partitions, improve lobby lighting and build a new countertop for additional customer seating along with additional tables and chairs, and 3300 dollars to accommodate the salaries for positions created for teenagers and college students in our community, which in return helps keep our kids and community safe.
For each individual that donates 
-$100 or less, we will send a personal thank you card signed by Ms.Devotis herself. 
-$100-$500, a D Cafe T-shirt
-$500 or more, the personal quote submitted by you will be written on the wall of quotes , with the author and your name or just your name.  (Submitted quotes must be in character , decent language for display to customers of all ages, genders,religions, cultures and nationalities. 
If we do not reach our entire goal , we will make a priority list, commercial equipment, lighting etc for continued uphill growth.   The Impact This project is valuable, we are community oriented and the community that we serve is important to us, we want to create employment opportunities for young people from the community which creates safer environment.
I received several awards including the Secretary of State award, and YWCA of greater atlanta award for working with the communities youth programs like SCLC, Adopted Student, and Junior achievement. I feel hiring more young individuals gives us the chance to mentor young adults.   Risks & Challenges
The challenge with this expansion project is the time the renovations have to get done. Here at D Cafe ,our doors open at 8:30 am and stay open till 3:30 pm during the week days. We understand that fitting contruction time into our business hours is going to be tough but we believe working on our renovations during our closed days would provide the right balance of productivity and customer comfort.   Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to donate financially, please like and share our Facebook page and Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family! You can help us reach our goal! 
Thank you 
Sincerely, Devotis Lee
COME SEE US!

story:
We heard how so many of you wished there was a place for a dog like yours to safely play, learn and socialize. That’s why we’ve specially designed this nearby 
10-acre facility in Romulus to give dogs and their owners a much-needed new option. The property is purchased, the plans are drawn, and the first phase of development is ready to begin--now we need you to help us make it happen.

Because there are no ordinary dogs. 

PRO K-9 is an innovative dog training and behavior modification company devoted to maximizing the human-canine relationship through individualized, affordable, results-focused in-home and social training programs. Our mission is to keep dogs in their homes by educating owners and equipping them with the skills and continued support needed to create balanced companions. 

Since 2001, we've helped thousands of dogs throughout Southeast Michigan achieve their training goals. We work with dogs of all breeds, temperaments and backgrounds, with a primary focus on rehabilitating dogs with behavior issues. As the dogs we work with strive for their training goals, many may have limited options for safe spaces to exercise, extra-curricular activities, and overnight boarding. Dog parks can be dangerous, day cares require temperament testing, and many boarding facilities can be a stressful environment for dogs who lack confidence.

Our goal is to bridge that gap with a home-based facility offering a safe haven and productive space for owners and rescues to continue improving their dogs' social confidence at an appropriate pace.


    • Acres of fun for every dog. Like a gym membership for your dog! 
      Each space is specially designed for maximum safety while you enjoy exercising and building your dog’s confidence through a variety of activities in
      a natural setting. Available for hourly rental by members, our fully secured activity yards ranging from 1-5 acres feature agility equipment, pond and dock, play structures, hiking trails and everything you need. Our training room is also available for rental, and our online booking calendar makes it easy to come play on your schedule. A Behavior Consultant will always be on site to advise and assist members with their dogs. 
    • What every breed needs. In addition to the private-use activity yards, our facility will provide the space and equipment necessary for additional training, socialization and activities to expand and round out our canine curriculum. Members will receive discounted tuition rates on training classes, private sessions and activity clinics. 

    It takes a village.

    This isn't your typical fundraising campaign. At PRO K-9, we value our community and rescue roots, and truly admire the rescue "boots on the ground". We're eager to support their efforts by sharing our time, resources and expertise. 

    Your dog will help rescue dogs in Southeast Michigan prepare for their forever homes just by being a member. Through our proven rescue program, we will automatically donate a percentage of our time on campus to local rescues. Our Rescue Program will also provide discounted rates, scholarships, seminars and much more. 

    Contributions at our "Guardian Angel" levels support the first year of our Rescue Program which provides Sponsored Rescues free access to activity yards and training classes.* 

    Show our supporters some love.

    These Southeast Michigan businesses have stepped up to help us make this campaign a success – thanks for your support! Get more information on our sponsors and complete reward details at www.ProK9acres.com/progress.html 

    We guarantee your rewards.

    You heard that right. We're serious about opening next summer. If we are unable to reach this goal, you may opt to apply the value of your pre-purchased services at PRO K-9 Acres towards our in-home services including training sessions, dog walking or pet sitting.* 

    Share our campaign, earn even more.

    1) After you contribute, share our campaign on Facebook and with friends. 

    2) Ask them to comment on our campaign after they make their contribution.
    They can say something like, "Can't wait to bring Spot here to play, Jane Doe!"

    3) Each comment with YOUR NAME earns you one hour of activity yard rental!* 

    The Grand Opening.

    You won't want to miss this. Stay updated: 

    • Watch our progress at www.ProK9acres.com
    • Like us at www.facebook.com/ProK9 
    • Join our eNews list: http://bit.ly/1iMl8ro

    Dog-gone-it, construction is expensive!

    We've spent years researching and planning to establish the perfect location for our mission. PRO K-9 Acres construction will be approached in phases. Phase 1, the activity and training center, is targeted to open summer 2016. This phase will help to fund Phase 2, our state-of-the-art boarding facility conveniently located next to Detroit Metro Airport. 

    PRO K-9 is a community-focused business—it just makes sense to involve our community from the start, and we are structuring Phase 1 fundraising efforts to reflect this. 

    Become a corporate sponsor. Reserve your spot with this unique opportunity to enrich our community while reaching a loyal customer base for years to come. www.ProK9acres.com/sponsors.html

    Invest with us. Through our initial fundraising efforts, we aim to identify enthusiastic community-based investors to help us cross the finish line. Investment opportunities will also be available in the future for Phase 2. www.ProK9acres.com/investors.html 

    Contact owner Jen Guthrie at info@prok9training.com for more information. 

    *Please visit www.ProK9acres.com/progress.html for all campaign reward details and rules. Visit www.ProK9training.com for more info on our in-home services.

story:
The Conservative Record is a project that tracks the record of the Conservative Party of Canada in categories such as Economy, Justice, Family, and Military. Our findings were pretty damning; see for yourself: www.conservativerecord.ca

What we did: 

1) We researched and collected credible, mainstream news articles on the record of the Conservative Party of Canada on subjects they claimed strength in. After vetting each article, we added them to our website. 

2) Using  social media, our professional marketers created targeted ads aimed at specific swing ridings all across Canada. 

3) Once we saw which of our ads were reaching their intended target audience, we poured our finances into those ads for higher reach. 

Take a look at our success at reaching people in swing ridings across Canada: 

Week 1 reach: 7,000 people

Week 2 reach: 20,000 people

Week 3 reach: 18,000 people

Week 4 reach: 40,00 people

Election day reach: 40,000 people

Campaign total: 125,000 people

 The Fundraiser

We are fundraising to cover a fraction of the costs of our project that spanned from June 2015 - October 2015. 

Post election, the bills are a bit heavy right now. We are asking those who see a benefit to the work we completed  to help us shoulder the cost of the project with a contribution. 

A breakdown of the total project costs (including in-kind and cash expenses)

In kind (volunteered, bartered, etc): 

Website, 200+ pages:                                $2,500 

Articles: vetting, sorting, publishing    $3,000

Thwarted hacking attempt#1                   $250

Thwarted hacking attempt#2                  $250

Logo design:                                                   $200

Total In-kind costs: $6,200

In Cash (paid out of pocket):

Facebook advertising                                $1,700 

Domain costs:                                               $100 

Hosting costs:                                                $50

Total cost out-of-pocket: $1,750

Total project cost: $7,950 **

**does not include missed paid work time for any project members

Fundraising goal: $2,500 - just under 1/3 of our total costs. 


Perks: What do I get for contributing? 

Our partner Authentic Lab has contributed a number of business services & marketing perks  as a bonus for those who contribute. They range from project consultations to discuss viability to Marketing & SEO. 

What happens if we raise over our goal?

1) We will pay our staff back for their in-kind and volunteer contributions

2) We will tip the external contractors who provided free services

3) We will pay our remaining campaign-related debts

4)  Anything over and above that will be donated to a non-party affiliated democracy non profit organization of our choosing, such as the BC Civil Liberties Association.

story:
Altıkırk Buluşmaları nedir? Hangi amaçla düzenlenir?

Altıkırk Buluşmaları, Bilkent mezunlarının birbirleriyle etkileşimini artırmaya yönelik organize edilen ve kar amaçlamayan networking etkinliğidir. Aylık devam eden etkinlik serilerinde Bilkent mezunları birbirini tanıma fırsatı buluyor, her ay farklı konuda bir sunum dinliyor ve düşüncelerini paylaşıyor.

2014 Mayıs ayında bir grup Bilkent mezunu arkadaş olarak CM serilerinden etkilenerek buluşmaları düzenlemeye başladık.

Amaç: Bilkent mezunlarının birbirini tanımasını ve birbirine destek olmasını sağlayacak oluşum eksikliklerinin giderilmesi, herhangi bir organizasyon, dernek veya benzeri bir yapıya gerek duymadan kendi insiyatifleriyle maddi beklenti gütmeden gerçekleştirilebilmesi.

Bugüne kadar: Yaklaşık 2 yıl süresince İstanbul'da yaşayan Bilkentlilere ulaşmayı amaçladık ve buluşmaları aylık düzenledik. Her ay farklı bir konuda Bilkentli konuşmacılar ağırladık.

  • 20 Buluşma
  • 500+ Katılım
  • 2.000 Takipçi
  • İstanbul'da yaşayan yaklaşık 4.000 Bilkent mezununa ulaştık. (LinkedIn ve Facebook reklamları, İşletme Fakültesi mezun database)

Peki neden kampanya başlattık?

Tüm gereksinimleri sponsorluklar üzerinden sağlamaya çalışıyoruz. İlk gününden itibaren mekan sponsoru olarak Workinton (Urban Station) 'ın büyük desteği var, onlara çok teşekkür ediyoruz. Daha çok Bilkentlinin etkinliklerden haberdar olması ve bu sayede daha fazla mezunun tanışabilmesi için sosyal medya reklamları yapıyoruz. Bu ve benzeri harcamaları cebimizden karşılamaya çalıştık. Bundan sonrası için de aynı şekilde sponsorlukların artarak devam etmesi için çabalıyoruz. Kampanyanın amacı buluşmalardaki konuşmaların, sunumların online ortamda video olarak tutulabilmesi ve daha çok kişiye ulaşması. Bu sayede hem gelemeyenler, hem de farklı şehirlerdeki mezunlar her ayın sunumuna ulaşabilecek. Bu sebeple ihtiyaçlarımızı listeledik:

  • Mikrofon
  • Kamera
  • Sosyal medya reklamları

Önemli:

  • Eğer kampanya hedefine ulaşamazsak kalan miktarı kendimiz sağlamaya çalışacağız
  • Eğer kampanya hedefinin üzerine çıkarsak;
    1500$ - v3: Farklı şehirlerde de buluşmaların başlaması (ilk aşamada Ankara, San Fransisco, Londra)
    2500$ - v4: Mobil uygulama (Etkinliğe katılanları görmek, iletişime geçebilmek, Bilkentliler arası iş ilanı, duyuru vb, ücretsiz online hızlı etkileşim)

Nasıl destek olabilirim?


Sonunda ne olacak?

Belki de hepimizin okurken ve sonrasında arkadaş sohbetlerinde sıkça şikayet ettiğimiz Bilkent aidiyetinin organik olarak artmasına katkı sağlayacağız.

  • Daha fazla Bilkentli birbirini tanıyacak
  • İş birlikleri kurup, birbirine sahip çıkacak
  • Fikirler geliştirecek
  • Farklı konularda uzman isimler tanıyacak
  • Düşüncelerin global olarak yayılmasını sağlayacak

Olası Riskler ve Sorunlar

Tüm bu hedeflere engel olabilecek veya risk taşıyan faktörleri incelediğimizde büyük engel görünmüyor ancak olabilecek engelleri ve mezunlar derneği, okul yönetimi olmadan neden böyle bir çalışma yapıyoruz sorusuna açıklık getirelim:

  • Buluşmaların gerçekleşebilmesi için takım olarak kişisel zamanlarımızı ayırıp efor harcıyoruz. Buna engel oluşturacak faktörler ortaya çıkar (hastalık vb.) ve buluşmalar gerçekleştirilemez ise bu kampanyadan elde edilen gelirle aldığımız tüm ekipmanı Bilkent Üniversitesi Mezunlar Merkezi'ne bağışlayacağız. Eğer ekipmanlara ihtiyaç duyulmazsa satıp İşletme Fakültesine veya üniversiteye maddi bağış yapacağız.
  • İşletme Fakültesi başta olmak üzere Tiyatro Bölüm yönetimi tanıtım faaliyetleri için çok önemli destek sağladılar. Mezunlar derneği de çalışmalarımızı yakından takip etti ve benzer etkinlik serilerini bünyelerinde yapmaya çalıştılar. Bağımsız başlattığımız ve Bilkent mezunları aidiyetinin organik olarak artmasını amaçladığımız networking modelinin daha etkili olduğunu kısa sürede ulaştığımız hedef kitlesi ile katılım sağlayan tüm katılımcı ve konuşmacıların pozitif geri bildirimleriyle anladık. Samimiyetle belirtmek isteriz ki bu çalışmalarımızla rakip dernek olmak gibi bencil ve oligarşi temelli hedeflerimiz yok. Bunun yerine kolektif ilerleyen bir proje olarak devam edeceğiz. Bunu sağlamak için elimizden geleni yapacağımıza söz veriyoruz.

Destek olmak isterseniz...

Maddi yardımın ötesinde destek olmanız mümkün! Bu kampanyayı ve buluşmaları Bilkent'li arkadaşlarınızla paylaşabilir, linkleri sosyal medya hesaplarınızdan duyurabilirsiniz. Umarız hep birlikte güzel çalışmalar yapmaya devam edeceğiz.

Altıkırk Buluşmaları’ndan haberdar olmak isterseniz:
Facebook sayfası: https://www.facebook.com/bilkentnetwork/
LinkedIn sayfası: https://www.linkedin.com/company/bilkent-istanbul
Bilkentistanbul.com

                                                                                                                                           

Teşekkürler

Buluşmaların gerçekleşmesi için yol açıcı tavsiyeleri ve tüm tanıtım destekleri için İşletme Fakültesi adına:
Sn. Levent Akdeniz, Sn. Zeliha Baran, Sn. Örsan Örge, Sn. Erdal Erel,

İlk buluşmadan itibaren her koşulda ve şartta sağladıkları mekan sponsorluğu ile etkinliklerin devam etmesini sağlayan Workinton adına:
Sn. Gökhan Beydoğan, Sn. Candan Sezen, Sn. Aslı Karabacak,

Tasarım, websitesi gibi materyallerin ve gereksinimlerin sağlanmasında destek sağlayan:
Sn. Semih Genç, Sn. Murat Menevşe, Sn. Emre Tuna, Sn. İpek Yavuz ve ismini atladığımız tüm arkadaşlara,

Organizasyon ekibinden Mustafa, Can ve Numan olarak sonsuz teşekkür ederiz :)

Buluşmalara katılan konuşmacı listesi: (tarih sırasıyla)

Efe R. Mocan, Head of Digital @ Mediacom
Akan Abdula, Stratejist - Futurebright Kurucusu
Sertaç Taşdelen, Binnazabla.com Kurucusu
Murat Erdör, Country Manager @ emarsys
Cem Erol, Yönetici Şef @ Mutfak Sanatları Akademisi
Gönenç Gürkaynak, Managing Partner @ ELIG
Bahar Kerimoğlu, Aktör ve Oyuncu Eğitmeni
Seçkin Tokgöz, Industry Manager @ Google
Alper Üner, CEO @ Grey Istanbul
Emre Kenci, Cofounder and CTO @ BTCTrader
Yalçın Pembecioğlu, Cofounder and Executive Editor @ Bigumigu
Onur Saylak, Tiyatro Sanatçısı ve Oyuncu
Yiğit Konur ve Mehmet Aktuğ, SEOzeo Kurucu Ortakları
Sadık Çulcuoğlu, Head of Capital Markets Advisory at Yapı Kredi Yatırım
Ali Yılmaz ve Yiğit Gürocak, oBilet.com Kurucu Ortakları
Furkan Bakır, Kurucu @ 3Dörtgen
Fatih Emiral, Partner @ BTRisk
Cem Sertoğlu, Partner @ Earlybird Venture Capital
Rauf Orkun Gücük, Genel Müdür Yardımcısı @ AKSigorta
Çağlar Göğüş, CEO @ Hürriyet Gazetesi

Örnek Tasarımlar
(Eğer mug bardak veya tişört alarak destek olduysanız kampanya sonunda size iletilecek olan seçenekler arasından istediğiniz tasarımı seçeceksiniz)

İstanbul'da yaşayan yaklaşık 4.000 Bilkent mezununa ulaştık. (LinkedIn ve Facebook reklamları, İşletme Fakültesi mezun database)

Peki neden kampanya başlattık? Tüm gereksinimleri sponsorluklar üzerinden sağlamaya çalışıyoruz. İlk gününden itibaren mekan sponsoru olarak Workinton (Urban Station) 'ın büyük desteği var, onlara çok teşekkür ediyoruz. Daha çok Bilkentlinin etkinliklerden haberdar olması ve bu sayede daha fazla mezunun tanışabilmesi için sosyal medya reklamları yapıyoruz. Bu ve benzeri harcamaları cebimizden karşılamaya çalıştık. Bundan sonrası için de aynı şekilde sponsorlukların artarak devam etmesi için çabalıyoruz. Kampanyanın amacı buluşmalardaki konuşmaların, sunumların online ortamda video olarak tutulabilmesi ve daha çok kişiye ulaşması. Bu sayede hem gelemeyenler, hem de farklı şehirlerdeki mezunlar her ayın sunumuna ulaşabilecek. Bu sebeple ihtiyaçlarımızı listeledik:


  Mikrofon Kamera
Sosyal medya reklamları

Önemli:



Eğer kampanya hedefine ulaşamazsak kalan miktarı kendimiz sağlamaya çalışacağız

Eğer kampanya hedefinin üzerine çıkarsak;1500$ - v3: Farklı şehirlerde de buluşmaların başlaması (ilk aşamada Ankara, San Fransisco, Londra)2500$ - v4: Mobil uygulama (Etkinliğe katılanları görmek, iletişime geçebilmek,
Bilkentliler arası iş ilanı, duyuru vb, ücretsiz online hızlı etkileşim)


Nasıl destek olabilirim?
   

Sonunda ne olacak? Belki de hepimizin okurken ve sonrasında arkadaş sohbetlerinde sıkça şikayet ettiğimiz Bilkent aidiyetinin organik olarak artmasına katkı sağlayacağız.  Daha fazla Bilkentli birbirini tanıyacak
İş birlikleri kurup, birbirine sahip çıkacak
Fikirler geliştirecek
Farklı konularda uzman isimler tanıyacak
Düşüncelerin global olarak yayılmasını sağlayacak


Olası Riskler ve Sorunlar
Tüm bu hedeflere engel olabilecek veya risk taşıyan faktörleri incelediğimizde büyük engel görünmüyor ancak olabilecek engelleri ve mezunlar derneği, okul yönetimi olmadan neden böyle bir çalışma yapıyoruz sorusuna açıklık getirelim:

Buluşmaların gerçekleşebilmesi için takım olarak kişisel zamanlarımızı ayırıp efor harcıyoruz. Buna engel oluşturacak faktörler ortaya çıkar (hastalık vb.) ve buluşmalar gerçekleştirilemez ise bu kampanyadan elde edilen gelirle aldığımız tüm ekipmanı Bilkent Üniversitesi Mezunlar Merkezi'ne bağışlayacağız. Eğer ekipmanlara ihtiyaç duyulmazsa satıp İşletme Fakültesine veya üniversiteye maddi bağış yapacağız.
İşletme Fakültesi başta olmak üzere Tiyatro Bölüm yönetimi tanıtım faaliyetleri için çok önemli destek sağladılar. Mezunlar derneği de çalışmalarımızı yakından takip etti ve benzer etkinlik serilerini bünyelerinde yapmaya çalıştılar. Bağımsız başlattığımız ve Bilkent mezunları aidiyetinin organik olarak artmasını amaçladığımız networking modelinin daha etkili olduğunu kısa sürede ulaştığımız hedef kitlesi ile katılım sağlayan tüm katılımcı ve konuşmacıların pozitif geri bildirimleriyle anladık. Samimiyetle belirtmek isteriz ki bu çalışmalarımızla rakip dernek olmak gibi bencil ve oligarşi temelli hedeflerimiz yok. Bunun yerine kolektif ilerleyen bir proje olarak devam edeceğiz. Bunu sağlamak için elimizden geleni yapacağımıza söz veriyoruz.



    Destek olmak isterseniz... Maddi yardımın ötesinde destek olmanız mümkün! Bu kampanyayı ve buluşmaları Bilkent'li arkadaşlarınızla paylaşabilir, linkleri sosyal medya hesaplarınızdan duyurabilirsiniz. Umarız hep birlikte güzel çalışmalar yapmaya devam edeceğiz.
Altıkırk Buluşmaları’ndan haberdar olmak isterseniz:Facebook sayfası: https://www.facebook.com/bilkentnetwork/LinkedIn sayfası: https://www.linkedin.com/company/bilkent-istanbulBilkentistanbul.com
                                                                                                                                           
Teşekkürler
Buluşmaların gerçekleşmesi için yol açıcı tavsiyeleri ve tüm tanıtım destekleri için İşletme Fakültesi adına:Sn. Levent Akdeniz, Sn. Zeliha Baran, Sn. Örsan Örge, Sn. Erdal Erel,
İlk buluşmadan itibaren her koşulda ve şartta sağladıkları mekan sponsorluğu ile etkinliklerin devam etmesini sağlayan Workinton adına:Sn. Gökhan Beydoğan, Sn. Candan Sezen, Sn. Aslı Karabacak,
Tasarım, websitesi gibi materyallerin ve gereksinimlerin sağlanmasında destek sağlayan:Sn. Semih Genç, Sn. Murat Menevşe, Sn. Emre Tuna, Sn. İpek Yavuz ve ismini atladığımız tüm arkadaşlara,
Organizasyon ekibinden Mustafa, Can ve Numan olarak sonsuz teşekkür ederiz :)

story: Our goal is to buy our building and relocate our tasting room and create a full size tap room featuring our local made beers. We also hope to restore the theater for musical functions, stage plays and beer functions such as beer festivals and Oktoberfest.  We hope to utilize the 150'x60' theater space for community and  private functions. Our plans include a full size kitchen for the tap room and the theater space. Improvements also include an outside sitting area by the canal.

story:
Let's Build A Food Hub!


Food hubs help local farmers get their products into the hands of buyers in a simple, efficient manner, make farms more profitable, and help keep jobs and cash in the local community. In 2016, Braise RSA will spin off from the Braise umbrella to form a co-op along with farmers, food producers and other interested persons or groups in the area.  However...

We need to be out of our current warehouse space in Milwaukee in February 2016, as the space we rent currently has been sold and will be developed into residential living. That's less than a month away!!! Our top priority is to procure and outfit a building that will serve our current needs and allow for expansion to create a centralized food hub in Milwaukee to serve the local food community. 

The co-op will set up and manage the central and regional food hubs and necessary infrastructure to:

  • allow food producers to drop off product close to their farms, which will be brought to the central hub in Milwaukee for distribution or cross-docking for a third party buyer
  • allow buyers to purchase and receive product from multiple growers under a streamlined, simple system
  • share tools and resources, such as refrigeration, trucks and marketing tools to help local food producers connect with customers and move their products

Where Does The $$$ Go?

To keep the business afloat and move into a new space, we're going to need some serious cash. Funding will go toward the following items:

  • Down payment on a warehouse space in Milwaukee
  • Relocation and installation of walk-in coolers, freezers and dry storage areas in new warehouse
  • Additional coolers for food hub operations
  • Packing tables, shelving units, pallet jack
  • Transportation expenses (additional truck, fuel, insurance, maintenance)
In addition to feeling good about supporting the local food community and investing in the future of good, clean food, you also get neat swag, participation in exclusive events or other sweet perks based on your contribution.  Win-win!

Why Contribute?

If you've gotten this far, you likely believe food is an important part of our society. You may be wondering why a food hub deserves your consideration. Fair enough. In order to continue to fuel the growth of our local food economy, farmers’ capacity to efficiently move large quantities of food to urban markets must improve. The hubs will serve as drop-off sites for farmers, providing shared cold storage and the option for pickup by buyers, cross-docking for a third party buyer or distribution services. 

Farmer Benefits

  • Streamlined sales and distribution of product leading to increased efficiency, profit and quality of life.
  • Shared storage and distribution lowers overall transportation costs and man-hours for individual farmers.
  • Farmers have increased ability to focus on core occupation, the production of food, reducing time and resources spent on distributing product.
  • Farm identity kept intact throughout entire sales process
Buyer Benefits
  • Online ordering platform with ability to purchase from multiple producers in one order
  • Consolidated delivery services
  • Pooled resources for bulk purchases, cold storage, processing for extended product availability
  • Each buyer knows the exact origin of every ingredient purchased
  • Direct access to producers
  • Single-point local product buying platform
Community Benefits
  • Increased access to healthy, delicious food to a wide audience
  • Increases in efficiency in getting local food to market creates lower costs for buyers and encourages fair compensation for farmers
  • Buying local keeps money in the local community, helps create jobs and strengthens the economy
  • Positive environmental impact by reducing the number of trucks on the road and lower C02 emissions

Why Hasn't This Been Done Here Before?

It takes an initial investment in infrastructure, the right people in place to manage and run it and the courage to collaborate with others and change aspects of established business models. To do this properly, you need:

  • Physical infrastructure (warehouse, coolers, trucks, tables, shelving, etc). These things are expensive.
  • Someone to coordinate the moving parts. This takes someone with experience in the field who has the time and expertise to do it. We should probably pay this person.
  • People to run the business. This takes people with a great work ethic and attitude. These people should be paid too.
  • The courage to change. Change is hard. People are reluctant to try something new. Lots of farmers, chefs and others who may benefit from a food hub have spent a long time making due on their own, so it will require re-thinking certain things and taking a chance.
Braise RSA and Home Delivery has been supporting local farmers and producers since it's inception in 2008 by creating a sales network of local food businesses and retail customers through a home delivery subscription program.  In addition, we provide direct distribution to customers outside the Braise RSA network and logistics support for local food producers.
All of the pieces to run a successful food hub are right here in front of us. The Braise RSA staff have the experience and systems in place to manage the day to day operations, and under the new co-op model, both the farmers and buyers will have an equal voice in ensuring everyone's needs are met in a sustainable manner.

How To Help

There's plenty you can do in addition to direct funding:

  • Tell others about this campaign! Share this link with your email list, your coworkers, you book club, and anyone else who may be interested. 
  • Would you would enjoy cleaning out a warehouse? Or are you a great writer? Maybe you have an extra walk-in cooler just hanging around. Donate your time, skills and any other resources you may have.

And that's all there is to it. Seriously, anything you can do will help.

story:
Background

The bridge over the river Calder at Copley stood from 1831 to Boxing Day 2015 when it was washed away by flooding. It's been an important river crossing for generations. The bridge was originally part of a turnpike route used to move livestock. From the mid-19th century it was crossed by factory workers to get from Akroyd's model village at Copley to St Stephen's Church. There's no alternative crossing up or downstream for a long way. Until Boxing Day 2015, hundreds of people crossed the bridge every day - on foot and by bike - to visit the church, explore the woods and exercise children and dogs. The bridge was also the only way one person, Graham Wilson, got to his home.

The purpose of this campaign is to fund a temporary footbridge to maintain 200 years of access across the river Calder at Copley for anyone who wishes to cross.

Who are we?

Our dad, Graham Wilson, lives in the old Toll House which collected tolls for the bridge in the 19th century. Graham restored the Toll House and has lived there since 1999. He is now in his mid-60s and has Parkinson's disease. The Toll House is on the far side of the bridge from Copley and without a temporary bridge, Graham cannot get to his home.

What do we want to achieve?

We want a temporary footbridge over the Calder at Copley within three weeks. It's an immediate, locally organised solution to the problem of the current bridge being washed away. A temporary bridge will allow Graham to live in his home and allow people to cross the Calder at Copley as they have done for 200 years.

How are we going to achieve it?

We are working with a number of British manufacturers and suppliers of temporary bridges to find the quickest and most cost effective solution. 

Why do we need your help?

Large areas of the Calder Valley and further downstream have been devastated by the floods. Calderdale Council has a growing list of urgent infrastructure replacements. A new bridge is on the list, but Copley and Graham need a temporary footbridge right now.

Graham can make a significant contribution to the cost of installing a temporary bridge, but he needs financial and practical support to ensure a temporary bridge is installed quickly. He needs your support to make an unanswerable case to the Council for giving permission for and helping to fund a temporary bridge.

Why is the target £10,000?

It will take at least a week to establish the exact cost of a temporary bridge, but we need to start  fundraising and sharing this story now. We have set a £10K target  because, together with Graham's own contribution, we think it will be sufficient to cover the installation of a temporary bridge.

What if we don't hit the target?

We'll negotiate with the Council and campaign for it to contribute what is necessary to get the temporary bridge installed.

What if raise more than the target?

Once the temporary bridge is in place, the focus will shift to a new permanent bridge. Any extra funds raised will be used to ensure Copley gets a new bridge as good as the old one. Every penny raised will only ever be spent on a bridge at Copley.

Why can't the Council pay?

It's a good question. The Council might be able to pay, but Copley and Graham need a temporary bridge now and we don't want the project to get bogged down with funding issues. If the Council do come through, we'll reallocate all funds raised as above.

Risks and challenges?

The companies we are working with have installed hundreds of bridges previously, across the UK and beyond. It will then fall to the Council to give the necessary consents and offer financial support. We hope this fundraising campaign will be the foundation for that,  we hope it will send a clear message that the temporary footbridge is an immediate necessity for Graham, Copley and the wider community. 

Legal Information:

  • indiegogo page, paypal and bank account registered as 'Copley Footbridge - Help Build It', a non-profit community action 
  • Signatory: Graham Wilson, Toll Bar House, North Dean Road, HX4 8QA
  • Email address: copleybridge@gmail.com
  • Phone: Stanley Wilson (son of Graham) 07986 828 868
  • Drone video © Mark Bull

Other ways you can help:

No money, no problem - by sharing this story on social media you'll also be helping Graham and Copley reinstate a vital link.

story:
Summary

We are The Vegan Grindhouse - a passionate husband and wife team who run a vegan food truck and now we want to open the first all vegan diner in the West Midlands, UK. We have been trading for almost two years serving Americana organic homemade vegan food on the streets, markets and festivals of Britain. We now want to open a retro diner style restaurant to offer more food, more days of the week to more people and we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Our main goal is to get at least £25,000 to open an all vegan diner in the West Midlands. 

We also want to help a local animal sanctuary - Rogue's Place in Aldridge, West Midlands, which was given notice at the end of January 2016 that they have to close down and relocate all of the animals as they don't own the land. They have done some amazing work rescuing and housing injured, abandoned and rescued animals and we have been proud supporters of them over the last 12 months. We hope that a donation from the funds raised can help them to find new premises or homes for their residents during this time of crisis for them.

If we do not reach our goal we have interim goals which means your money will still go to improve The Vegan Grindhouse experience for customers.

Goals:

Stretch Goal £30,000 The Vegan Grindhouse Diner and Bar 

Main Goal £25,000 The Vegan Grindhouse Diner

Interim Goal 1 £20,000 The Vegan Grindhouse Take Away Shop

Interim Goal 2 £15,000 A new street food van and trailer upgrade so we can attend more events across the country

Interim Goal 3 £10,000 A street food van to add to our brand and be able to travel further to events and add to the TVG experience

Interim Goal 4 £5,000 A new trailer - ours has seen better days and a new trailer with a better kitchen will mean faster, fresher food for you

Interim Goal 5 £2000 With this amount, we can repair our existing trailer and car and be able to continue trading at existing events

You get to support a family vegan small business, help be part of the first all vegan diner in the West Midlands, support a wonderful animal sanctuary and grab some tasty perks as well.


The Impact

Spreading the vegan message in a positive way through great food and challenging the vegan stereotype is what we do and having a premises as well as the streetfood side of our business will spread this positive message further. Saving the animals and our planet one fabulous meal at a time. Our diner and street food truck will employ local vegans and we buy ingredients from local ethical businesses.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge is that it could take us a while to find the right premises and get all of the licenses to operate as a restaurant, in the meantime we have created perks that people can claim from us as an existing business without having to wait for the diner to open. We plan to open within 6 months of the campaign finishing.

There is a risk we won't make the goal amount, however we have created interim goals with a clear indication of how the money will be used to improve the existing customer experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially support this campaign, please share the link, tell everyone you know about our project, and please try and support Rogue's Place Animal Sanctuary in any way you can. 

If you are not already, the best thing you could do, for free, right now for the animals, the planet and your health is to go vegan!

Video Credits:

Video by: Essential Marketer (www.essentialmarketer.com)

TVG
story_txt:
Summary We are The Vegan Grindhouse - a passionate husband and wife team who run a vegan food truck and now we want to open the first all vegan diner in the West Midlands, UK. We have been trading for almost two years serving Americana organic homemade vegan food on the streets, markets and festivals of Britain. We now want to open a retro diner style restaurant to offer more food, more days of the week to more people and we need your help!
What We Need & What You Get
 Our main goal is to get at least £25,000 to open an all vegan diner in the West Midlands. 
We also want to help a local animal sanctuary - Rogue's Place in Aldridge, West Midlands, which was given notice at the end of January 2016 that they have to close down and relocate all of the animals as they don't own the land. They have done some amazing work rescuing and housing injured, abandoned and rescued animals and we have been proud supporters of them over the last 12 months. We hope that a donation from the funds raised can help them to find new premises or homes for their residents during this time of crisis for them.
If we do not reach our goal we have interim goals which means your money will still go to improve The Vegan Grindhouse experience for customers.
Goals:
Stretch Goal £30,000 The Vegan Grindhouse Diner and Bar 
Main Goal £25,000 The Vegan Grindhouse Diner
Interim Goal 1 £20,000 The Vegan Grindhouse Take Away Shop
Interim Goal 2 £15,000 A new street food van and trailer upgrade so we can attend more events across the country
Interim Goal 3 £10,000 A street food van to add to our brand and be able to travel further to events and add to the TVG experience
Interim Goal 4 £5,000 A new trailer - ours has seen better days and a new trailer with a better kitchen will mean faster, fresher food for you
Interim Goal 5 £2000 With this amount, we can repair our existing trailer and car and be able to continue trading at existing events
You get to support a family vegan small business, help be part of the first all vegan diner in the West Midlands, support a wonderful animal sanctuary and grab some tasty perks as well.

The Impact
 Spreading the vegan message in a positive way through great food and challenging the vegan stereotype is what we do and having a premises as well as the streetfood side of our business will spread this positive message further. Saving the animals and our planet one fabulous meal at a time. Our diner and street food truck will employ local vegans and we buy ingredients from local ethical businesses.
    Risks & Challenges The challenge is that it could take us a while to find the right premises and get all of the licenses to operate as a restaurant, in the meantime we have created perks that people can claim from us as an existing business without having to wait for the diner to open. We plan to open within 6 months of the campaign finishing.
There is a risk we won't make the goal amount, however we have created interim goals with a clear indication of how the money will be used to improve the existing customer experience.
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you can't financially support this campaign, please share the link, tell everyone you know about our project, and please try and support Rogue's Place Animal Sanctuary in any way you can. 
If you are not already, the best thing you could do, for free, right now for the animals, the planet and your health is to go vegan!
Video Credits:

Video by: Essential Marketer (www.essentialmarketer.com)
Directed & Edited by: Luke Matthews (https://twitter.com/lukewillmatt)Huge thanks to Luke for all his ongoing support.TVG

story:
<Please note: distributors are already online, so perks will pay out regardless of amount raised.  Fundraising expands some possibilities, such as the brands of bikes we will be able to offer.  If there is something particular you were looking for, contact me and I can determine if I'm able to supply it.>

The Start of something new!

Sunnybrae Cycles is a family-based and run bicycle shop.  Combining a background in track and field competition with the coaching of runners, triathletes and cyclists, the founder of Sunnybrae Cycles is passionate to offer a wide range of services to enhance the customer's complete cycling experience.  Besides standard sales and service, one can expect coaching advice, honest product reviews and suggestions, and specialized bike fittings to maximize the cycling experience for riders of all ages and experience levels.  


A Family Experience

Sunnybrae Cycles is a family business, and a few introductions are in order.

Left to right:

Katherine: likes to ride, but far more excited to be a bike mechanic.  She is in process of earning her Shimano certification.

Jorin: likes to ride, primarily road.  Shimano certified, with sales and service experience in addition to coaching and competition.

Dorothy: Office manager, book keeping, and shipping department.  Just like her old job of being a librarian.  Or at least sort of.

Michael: ride tester, human fork lift, and sales assistant.  He will also be learning the secret art of accounting.

 

A Special Focus

While Sunnybrae Cycles welcomes riders of all style, experience, and age, we are particularly excited about:

  • Road cycling 
  • Charity rides
  • Outfitting families
  • Specialized bike fittings for people with injuries and other physical challenges


Sharing in the Startup

As a family owned and run business, we have the passion, experience, and means to launch.  But to launch well, partnering with others allows us to buy a diverse range of stock and establish a proper store front immediately.  Special orders are great, but people also like to be able to see, touch, and try on what they are interested in.  Partnering with others allows us to stock a range of parts, accessories and bikes when the shop opens.  Backing will also enable us to establish a working relationship with several major bike brands, giving us a full range of bicycles for riders of all ages, experience, and style.

Have questions, or need more information?  Drop a note to info@sunnybraecycles.com!

story:
Edmonton loves TEA!

I’m Sarah Proudlock, owner of The Tea Girl. I love tea!! 5 years ago, I took the opportunity to bring my vision for bringing people together with tea to Edmonton by reviving the decade old Steeps location off of 124th Street. It needed many things to keep it from closing, but mostly we needed to shift focus back to the customers and community. With eager new staff, and customer support we restored the bustling shop. 2 years ago, we rebranded from Steeps to The Tea Girl, to reflect our local focus and accountability to our community.

Our tea community continues to grow, and as such changes again are coming to The Tea Girl! Recently the space next to our shop became available and we have the opportunity to expand into a bigger little tea shop, while still offering the same amazing service and quality and maintaining the cozy environment our customers love. 

We need your help! We have already begun renovations and we hope to have everything finished by March, just in time for spring teas. We are looking to our community here in Edmonton, and those that visit from a far, to help support our dream of growing a local meeting place into something even better.  Please help us to reach our goal and we will continue to bring more Edmontonians together over a cup of tea.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to the community to help raise $10,000, which is about one quarter of the renovation costs. We will use the funds to purchase kitchen equipment, like a new oven and prep tables, and new counters for us to work on. We are hoping to purchase a bar fridge and new seating for our customers to use in the expanded space.

We are offering backers tea incentives like free tea or ways to take home your favourite tea cup. If you contribute before March 15, you are invited to our Grand Re-opening party on Wedneday, March 16th!

Every dollar helps to keep us moving forward with this expansion, regardless of how much we raise.

Changes are coming!

The main attraction to expanding is additional space, for you, our loyal customers, to ponder over a pot of your favourite tea. If you have ever tried to visit on a Sunday afternoon, you know the tea house can get quite full and can be hard to find a table. With more prime front window space, we are hoping more tea lovers can meet up even at our busiest times. We even get to add more miss matched furniture to our collection.

We are also looking forward to the addition of a kitchen where we can now bake all our cakes and cookies in store increasing our selection of fresh baked items. We took our first steps towards offering our own product in August when our friends at Whimsical Cake Studio offered a space in their kitchen to bake of our some desserts. We look forward to more tasty creations.

We also are adding a 2nd bathroom, which gives our tea drinkers much relief. We know you love our current bathroom so it stays as is. More seats and amenities also let us look forward to the future where other beverage pairings may be added to our menu.

We are increasing our staff work area. Not too big though, just enough that we don’t trip on each other every other moment. After all, we have grown quite close and may get lost with too much elbowroom.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, you can still help! Share our campaign on social media and tell your friends! We are still open during renos and we would love to see you visit us for tea and see our progress! Mind the noise and make sure you keep checking back to see when the big reveal day is!

Check us out on the internet!

www.theteagirl.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheTeaGirl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/theteagirlyeg

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theteagirl/

story:
Bonjour!

We're L'atypique Craft Cidre, the UK's hottest hand made, craft drink brought direct to you from France's oldest producers.

One day, whilst managing my pub, leisurely sipping London micro brew beer, I gots a thinking, "why has cider not been invited to the party?" So then I gots a looking and, sure as, some of London's hottest venues were serving the most fantastic small batch artisanal beers, next to mass produced commercial cider. So finally I gots a doing and realised the answer was there all along....The answer to cider is CIDRE!

So I popped over to Normandy and was blown away by what I found. There I spotted over 30 small orchards containing their own craft artisans,  producing some of the most delicious ciders (or cidre, as we should say!), taking painstaking care of every stage, from growing the apples to bottling the finished product. This isn't a fad to them, they've been doing this for many hundreds of years, and it's organic to boot! 


So this is it, we're Latypique Craft Cidre and not only are we bringing you the best cidre produced by the most skilled artisans  we want you to come on the journey with us.......quite literally.

We're raising money to do a number of things.........

1. We want to develop a range of fruit craft cidres that will go through the same natural and painstaking processes that our current collection does and they will  be awesome. It will be a new level of quality in the flavoured cider market, a total  game changer. That's pretty cool, eh?

2. In the meantime, we'll launch our webshop, so people can enjoy L'Atypique Craft Cidre at home, or in the park or wherever.. Pretty cool also?

3. We also want to improve our distribution methods and reach . We want to be efficient in our logistics and storage facilities to keep all our current clients satisfied and to be able to serve our new ones. A bit dull, but it's still cool to us!

As I said, we want to change the game. We want to raise the expectations of how cider should be made, how it should taste, how it should be presented and it starts here, it is a big deal!

We're asking YOU to be part of this big deal. 

In return for your pledge we can offer you these amazing perks!

- CIDRE! We've got loads of it! 
- The amazing people at www.thecounterpress.co.uk have created a beautiful L'Atypique inspired artwork for your home. These guys are HOT right now!


- Most amazingly, however, we can take you on a once in a lifetime trip to the orchards to come and help these guys make this year's cidre! We'll obviously take in all of the food and drink delights of Normandy while we're there. 


During our three operational years, the impact of L'Atypique on our producers has been immeasurable. All of our cidres come from specially selected small local producers, who run small scale farming operations. The dairy trade and fruit production industries are all in decline in this remote area, so we want to keep them doing what they do best!

How can you help? choose your perk, pledge your money, pull up a chair, sit yourself down, sip one of our wonderful products, then SHOUT ABOUT THEM!
