story:
Update:

All backers who gave before Nov. 6th check your email for your invitation to our event this Friday November 13th!


DUO58 Community Coffee Bar & Cafe City Impact Fees Campaign

...lighten the burden of those who work for you...give your food to those who are hungry...
Three years ago, DUO58 was founded to help meet the needs of children in Haiti and those here in Central Florida struggling to find work.  
Thus far, DUO58 has provided over 16,000 meals and days of education for children in Haiti in partnership with Mission of Hope.  We have achieved this through profits from catering weddings and events throughout Central Florida. 
Ultimately, our goal is to feed and educate a 100 children per day and expand our Job and Lifeskills program.  With this goal in mind, we have spent the past 10 months preparing to open our Community Coffee Bar in the city of Oviedo.  
Right now, through our catering services, we often employ people like Crystal (from the video) who have special circumstances preventing them from consistent/long-term employment. Our goal, through the cafe, is to provide this opportunity for at least  10 employees on a more consistent basis. 

The Need

Up to this point in our construction, we have been conservative with our expenses and have been almost debt free in its construction. During the final stages of our permitting process, we were unexpectedly informed that in order to open the cafe doors we will have to pay city and county impact fees totaling $9,000. The space is ready to open and we have staff trained and ready to work. Raising the funds for these impact fees is the final step in opening the cafe.
Many people have given to our Crowdrise and PayPal campaigns and your gifts will be reincorporated into Indiegogo. With current donations, we are almost half way there!   Whether your gift is small or large it means and accomplishes more than you can imagine.
We believe with your help that we will be able to raise $9,000 in 20 days!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to contribute $5 or $500, please use the Indiegogo share tool to post to your Facebook, Instagram, etc. and share with your friends and family what we are doing and our current need to expand the dream.  

If you would like to help with the cafe after we open, you can volunteer behind the bar.  Please email us for information about volunteering or about applying to the Job and Lifeskills Program.  

DUO58 Community Coffee Bar & Cafe
112 W Mitchell Hammock Rd Ste 1112
Oviedo, FL 32765
duo58cafe@gmail.com

Perk Rewards

Perks can be claimed in the cafe after our open date (TBD).

story:
Lots of people all over the world would like a free communication with family and friends, but mobile providers continue to charge huge prices for it. We dicided to improve it. We present FreeTelecom. FreeTelecom is the first free mobile provider.


Our company allow users to communicate with each other free of charge. We provide free calls, free SMS and free internet to all our users.By purchasing a FreeTelecom SIM-card you will never have to pay for any type of the services afterwards.



The key idea behind the free service is that the we have contracts with different type of clients who are interested in advertising of their products. Our customer will recieve sensible amount of informational messages. The sort of advertisement could be chosen by the customer individually at FreeTelecom application.



We have Contracts with mobile providers for supply of mobile services. At the moment the coverage area is 70% worldwide.




By purchasing a FreeTelecom SIM card our user will never have to pay for any type of the services afterwards.

Your support is very important  for us. Just imagine your money can change an status quo of mobile services we are using now and future of communtications.


FAQ

I have an iPhone. Will you have a FreeTelecom?

Yes, we will have the FreeTelecom app available for iPhones and Android phones.

When will I receive my FreeTelecom SIM-card?

We plan to ship FreeTelecom around May 2016.

Which countries do you ship FreeTelecom to?

We provide worldwide shipping. 

How much does shipping cost?

We charge standard shipping rates of your country.

How do I choose more than one perk?

The Indiegogo system is not set up to choose multiple perks. If you would like to choose more than one perk, you will need to initiate a separate process for each pre-order. If you encounter difficulties, please email freetelecomcompany@gmail.com and use "NEED HELP WITH ORDERING" as the subject line.

I preordered a FreeTelecom, but I didn’t get a confirmation email. How can I check the status?

Please refer to this article on How to Check if Your Contribution is Successful. If there is still an issue, you may contact us at freetelecomcompany@gmail.com with the subject line: PREORDER CONFIRMATION.

There was an error with my contribution. What happened?

Please refer to this article on common contribution errors and steps to resolve: Common Contribution Errors.

If I have other questions, who should I contact?

We are receiving a lot of inquiries and are responding as fast as possible. Please contact freetelecomcompany@gmail.com with any other questions you may have.

How do I get support for FreeTelecom?

You can login to our online customer support system. We would be happy to help with your questions.


Thank you!

www.freetelecom.net
twitter.com/freetelecomnet
https://www.facebook.com/groups/930808816996984

story:
Introduction


“Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

 (Dalai Lama)

We all have dreams and we want to make decisions that can bring us towards our dreams.

We all know how difficult decision-making can be. Some decision can lead to unforeseen results. There are techniques that can help us to make better decisions. We want to help everyone reach their goals and dreams.


Don’t be afraid to dream big


Our dream

Our dream is that we can bring more happiness and freedom into life.

Our passion is to help people raise the right questions and find the best answers possible. We want to help everyone to progress in their own ways.

We want to develop an innovative software that has the potential to change the life of billions of people.

Background

During our work we see that big companies are using extremely expensive software for strategy building and decision making. We realized that small businesses and individuals cannot afford such software. So we thought it would be a great idea to create a software that is available to everyone.

Most of the small businesses and individuals have no “officially” planned strategy, and they don’t really know how to develop a personal strategy.

So we have two main mission types to accomplish:

·  Develop a software where users can create their own strategy

·  We have to teach users how to use the different methods to get the most of that strategy

A good strategy for our life is inevitable. It can highlight what we want in our life.

Using different methods of the software, you will see more and more ways you can find it possible to implement it in your life.

By translating your strategy into well-defined goals and actions, and validating those goal definitions things will become clear.

Our application also aims to support you when you receive some bad feedback or lack of success. We help you to analyse the situation and find the cause and the solution as well.

We believe that by using the application you can discover more and more opportunities in your life and you will feel freer than ever before.


People should passionately think 
about their own life


Team

The MyWay team consists of persons who are working in different fields. The inventor of this application is an IT consultant who is a university guest professor teaching Company Strategies. There are friends, university students and teachers from various fields who made serious contributions to this concept.


What We Need & What You Get

We need about $200,000 to pay for the cost of everything that's needed to finance the development and the operation of the application. 

The donations you give us will be used to fund the design, programming, testing and operation of the software.
In return, you will get a unique software that will help you in several ways in your life. Best life management methods collected and integrated in your hand. With your generous help, we'll be able to make this software as high quality as possible.

We are a few professionals and students and without you, we cannot make it. Every donation matters to us, as this campaign determines whether or not we can come this unique software true.

Without your contributions, we cannot afford to pay the developers, testers software designers, running costs and operational costs that are needed for a complex development like this.


Other ways you can help

You can help us by letting your friends know about this project. If you also believe that this software is for a good cause please use the sharing buttons on the left side of the page.

If you have any comment or question about our project please let us know. Your feedback is a great help for us. This way we know what additional information we should give for backers on our site.


Application versions

There are 3 different packages will be available for the users:

·  Personal Essentials

·  Personal Advanced

·  Small Business

Personal Essentials

It consists of the most important parts that are necessary to develop and manage your own strategy.


Small Business

This version enables small entrepreneurs to complete a classic analyses that is necessary for them to identify their opportunities, long term goals and to build up their own action plans that brings them towards those goals.

Beyond the classic analyses this version has other methods that are helpful for these companies in different situations.

This version also contains all modules of the Personal Essentials package with some modification.


Personal Advanced

It contains all modules of the Personal Essentials package and some other modules that are adopted form the Small Business version. With these additional features you can analyse your own personal environment and yourself from more perspective. It helps you to find the way that really works for you.


Turn your dreams into goals

Turn your goals into actions


Main characteristics of the application

Modular

The application consists of modules. These modules are capable to work without any other modules. It makes them more independent and allows you use only those parts of the application you really need.

Integrated

The modules can work together, they share their data and the results. This way modules can use or reuse the data you entered. Integration makes modules more powerful as you can see the same things from varying perspectives.

The wizard of the application and some modules like the Daily sum-up makes the integration invisible for you.

Flexible

There are many ways you can use the application, there are no strict rules. You create your own personal universe that you find the most useful. You can record, access, and utilize this information easily and efficiently.

Customizable

You can customize the app in several ways.

·  You can change parameters and the look of the analyses

·  You can also add your own views and analyses to the app

·  You can make changes in menu fit your use.

Expandable

The architecture of the software lets the developers integrate more and more methods into the application.

User friendly

We all know that analysing things are never an easy task. This app is simplified in a way to enable everybody to access it without any previous experience. The ultimate aim is that you only focus on the content and the app will do the rest. The built in consultant helps you to see the conclusions.

Continuous improvement

We will analyse the feedback from users and their usage patterns. We will build into the app the results of these evaluations. With this continuous process users will always find new improvements.


Favourite function

The most exciting part of the application is the Daily sum up.

This is the center where you can enter many things about what happened to you. For example if you met someone, if you had a good idea, someone told you something, if you had a new task, or a new project to do, or you discovered a new opportunity. This function helps you to remember and record everything. What you record automatically appears and modifies other analyses as all modules are integrated.

We believe that by using Daily sum up for only 15 minutes each day you can make it work.


We should dedicate more time to think about our own way.


How to start

We recommend that you should start using it step by step. Just take e.g. the Who am I function and please take your time completing this section.

Each day write down what you find about yourself. Then take the second step and so on.

You don’t need to rush. Just take your time to discover everything in your life.

Once you have built up the base you can start to think about your way.

Never stop managing your data. Everyday is a new adventure. New ideas, new opportunities, new challenges, new achievements. Just keep your eyes open and put them into your thinking.


As you change, 

the world changes as well.


Custom analyses

MyWay helps you to design you own custom analyses.

When you find a need to keep track, group and analyse things in a new way, it is easy to set up and integrate it with the existing analysing methods.

Platforms

Since MyWay can be useful for everybody we plan to make it available for three major platforms:

·  Android

·  IOS

·  Windows Mobile


Community thinking

We believe in the inherent creativity of people. Anytime a question was open to the public brilliant answers turned up.

We plan to publish important questions from time to time. These questions aim to make our world a peaceful and happy place. We want to ask our users to share their answers with everybody. We will summarize the received answers and publish the best ones .


Project Roadmap



The price of the application

We believe that the advantages that this software can give you cannot be compared to its price.

If you make just one better decision in your life that would bring a much bigger benefit for you than the cost of the software for many years.

Choosing the right job, handling a conflict wiser, or managing better your tasks are only examples of what advantages you may get.

Planned yearly subscription prices:

Personal Essentials version: 48 USD (means only 4 USD/month)

Personal Advanced version 72 USD (means only 6 USD/month)

Small Business version 120 USD (means only 10 USD/month)


Make a good decision today and back this project.


Thank you.
story_txt:
Introduction
“Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions. (Dalai Lama)We
all have dreams and we want to make decisions that can bring us towards our
dreams.
We
all know how difficult decision-making can be. Some decision can lead to unforeseen
results. There are techniques that can help us to make better decisions. We
want to help everyone reach their goals and dreams.
Don’t be afraid to dream big
Our dream
Our
dream is that we can bring more happiness and freedom into life.
Our
passion is to help people raise the right questions and find the best answers
possible. We want to help everyone to progress in their own ways.
We
want to develop an innovative software that has the potential to change the
life of billions of people.
Background
During
our work we see that big companies are using extremely expensive software for strategy building and
decision making. We realized that small businesses and individuals cannot
afford such software. So we thought it would be a great idea to create a software that is available to
everyone.
Most
of the small businesses and individuals have no “officially” planned strategy,
and they don’t really know how to develop a personal strategy.
So
we have two main mission types to accomplish:
· 
Develop a software
where users can create their own strategy 
· 
We have to teach
users how to use the different methods to get the most of that strategy
A
good strategy for our life is inevitable. It can highlight what we want in our
life.
Using
different methods of the software, you will see more and more ways you can find
it possible to implement it in your life.
By
translating your strategy into well-defined goals and actions, and validating those
goal definitions things will become clear.
Our
application also aims to support you when you receive some bad feedback or lack
of success. We help you to analyse the situation and find the cause and the
solution as well.
We
believe that by using the application you can discover more and more
opportunities in your life and you will feel freer than ever before.

People should passionately think about their own life


Team
The MyWay team consists of persons who are working in different fields. The inventor of this application is an IT consultant who is a university guest professor teaching Company Strategies. There are friends, university students and teachers from various fields who made serious contributions to this concept.


What We Need & What You Get

We need about $200,000 to pay for the cost of everything that's needed to finance the development and the operation of the application. 
The donations you give us will be used to fund the design, programming, testing and operation of the software.In return, you will get a unique software that will help you in several ways in your life. Best life management methods collected and integrated in your hand. With your generous help, we'll be able to make this software as high quality as possible.
We are a few professionals and students and without you, we cannot make it. Every donation matters to us, as this campaign determines whether or not we can come this unique software true.
Without your contributions, we cannot afford to pay the developers, testers software designers, running costs and operational costs that are needed for a complex development like this.



Other ways you can help

You can help us by letting your friends know about this project. If you also believe that this software is for a good cause please use the sharing buttons on the left side of the page.
If you have any comment or question about our project please let us know. Your feedback is a great help for us. This way we know what additional information we should give for backers on our site.

are 3 different packages will be available for the users:
·

· 
Personal Advanced
· 
Small Business

consists of the most important parts that are necessary to develop and manage

story:
Hope is neither a mistake nor an imagination, it is a sense and it makes reality.

Despite the increase in unemployment, the stop of employing workers in different fields, the disruption in public jobs, the suffocating siege and the continuous devastation on the Gaza strip, the idea emerged, to help the people and to reduce the suffering and pain of the Palestinians in Gaza and to create job opportunities to the unemployed, especially when I recognised the increase demand of the infrastructure building materials and the building stones for the destroyed houses.

Therefore I decided to setup a small factory at my home, by personal and individual effort, but I saw that the idea became popular and was widely accepted in the community, which promoted me to increase the production power of the plant, and this requires the transition to a larger area other than my home to receive a good number of unemployed young people to be trained in making stones, and also it requires bringing an appropriate number of advanced modern machinery that helps in the production speed and in the implementation accuracy.

However I can’t provide enough money for the expansion of the project, and that is because I have a family and I live in a rented house which needs money, therefore I deeply wish that you can help me in expanding and upgrading my project.


And my needs are summarized as follows:

· Rent a piece of land with an area of not less than 1,000 square meters -  2000 $ .

·  Purchase of infrastructure equipments and materials for establishing the project: 5000 $ .

I am looking for your generous contributions to help me and my family for life as others.

Please !

#share & #donate

story:
Summary

Given the state of the world today and our mutual frustration with how things are going, it is time for each of us to “claim our place at the fire” and create understanding across cultural divides that leads to forgiveness, friendship and a better future. We each must strive to become the greatest versions of ourselves, working together, to build the better world of which we each dream, for ourselves and our children. We can create this better world together, through small actions and interactions with other people each and every day. As Howard Rheingold says, “What it is → Is up to you”.

This is why we are inviting you to participate next year in a Global Day of Giving Thanks on the last Sunday in November. Sunday November 27, 2016. Our goal is for people from different cultures coming together, to share a meal, in celebration of the better world we want to build together. We invite you, your families and your friends to connect with people from other cultures to share a meal and a conversation about the better world we envision.

This is the first major project of the Rysing Tyde, an organization, a movement and a series of projects intended to bring the world together, lifting all people to their greatest potential. The organization that is producing this Global Day of Giving Thanks is based on the original intentions of the non-profit Social Media Club and the early BrainJam events from 10 years ago.  
Today, we are asking you to invest in and join us in connecting people with different cultures and communities so that we may create a #BetterWorld. In that spirit we will work to foster more cross cultural dialog, improve economic opportunities and increase community based collaboration. The funding is focused broadly on the development of the Rysing Tyde organization, with the Global Day of Giving Thanks being a project to serve our broader mission.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your financial support to share our story widely, to build the organization, and to coordinate the Global Day of Giving Thanks with partners and participants.

Funds will be used to:

  • Launch the Rysing Tyde as a new non-profit organization bringing people together to envision and build a better world.

  • Hire a team to coordinate all of the activities necessary to produce the Global Day of Giving Thanks.

  • Develop an online infrastructure to enable connections between people from different backgrounds and cultures to discover and connect with each other.

Supporters will receive:

  • An invitation to join the Rysing Tyde community, access to events and an opportunity for you to get support from other members in support of your projects and causes.

  • A digital kit of conversation starters to facilitate cross cultural dialog on the Global Day of Giving Thanks and throughout the year.

  • Additionally, some supporters will receive different perks, programs and opportunities based on their contribution level.

The Impact

We believe that the only way we can build a better future is to come together around our common purpose and common values. Around our desire to create a better world for our children. Around our desire to create a safer world where we are able to pursue our chosen interests, professions and occupations. To see each other as a sister or brother and not “the other”. Where equality, liberty and fraternity are the shared values that bind us together as one global society, living in peace and with shared prosperity.

This doesn’t require us to literally change the world, it requires us to change how we conduct ourselves within it. It requires us to stand up for what we believe to be true and just instead of standing silently on the sidelines. We must each get on the field and play our part. We must lift up others after we are standing, and help those who follow in our footsteps through mentorship, teaching and sharing. We must be peaceful warriors. We also must work to help friends and family to transcend their desire for revenge, to find a way to forgive those who have injured us and our loved ones. We each must contribute meaningfully to the #BetterFuture we want to experience if we are to ever have a chance of seeing it in our lifetime. We must start doing this right now.

By simply sharing a meal next November 27, 2016 with someone from another culture, religion or even political party, we believe you will see that just because someone seems different, doesn’t mean we are not the same. We are all one people and it’s time for us to start acting like it and put a stop to the endless cycle of blaming the other and inspiring more hatred and violence. In this way we see a Global Day of Giving Thanks as series of small stones being cast into the pool of humanity, creating everlasting ripples that will ultimately reshape the nature of the world itself.

Risks & Challenges

Given our experience leveraging social media to engage with people around the world, the risks we face are simply organizational ones which we can overcome easily. Can we hire the right people? Can we overcome the doubt of others? Can we connect with local partners to make it more meaningful? Thankfully we already have many of the right people, we are experienced storytellers and we already have a global network of nonprofit, government and business leaders.

We will solve any organizational challenge we face by constantly improving our systems and people. We will do this by by being honest about the challenges we are facing and our approach to solving them. We will improve what we do by listening to you.

We believe wholeheartedly the success of this movement starts with one person connecting with another. Therefore, the project is already successful because you are here. Our continuing success comes from improving how we communicate this story and how we enable more people to connect with others to work towards creating a #BetterWorld and a #BetterFuture.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Launch the Rysing Tyde as a new non-profit organization bringing people together to envision and build a better world.

  • Share a meal this holiday season with people from another culture.

  • Share photos of your multi-cultural holiday meals with hashtag #GDoGT

  • Share this IndieGogo Campaign with your friends, family, coworkers, and communities.

  • Submit a recipe to our Global Day of Giving Thanks Cookbook series representing multicultural meals of celebration.

  • Participate in our ThunderClap to amplify our vision of a #BetterWorld, sharing the same message at the same time.

  • Join our Rysing Tyde community, participate in the conversation, seek help with your noble pursuit, help others in your community, and from around the world.

story: juuh eliks

story:
Tailorbird Tattoo

Tailorbird Tattoo’s Mission is to cultivate a vibrant, welcoming space for skilled artists and our clients to create custom designed tattoos.

The Vision of Tailorbird Tattoo is to break the mold of most tattoo shops by being centered around thriving artists and clients, being worker-owned and collectively-run, being LGBTQ positive, and providing a space that honors and explores history, nature and art. 

The tailorbird (Orthotomus sutorius) is a songbird found across tropical Asia. Popular for its nest made of leaves "sewn" together, it is a common resident in urban gardens.

 Tailorbird Tattoo is a custom tattoo shop opening in the summer of 2015 in Minneapolis’s Seward neighborhood, started by queer and genderqueer women artists Ariel Cafarelli and apprentice Alli Shelly.  We offer a welcoming, inclusive shop and are committed to working with clients to cultivate positive tattoo experiences. Tailorbird Tattoo actively opposes racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, and all other forms of bigotry.

 Ariel Cafarelli has tattooed professionally in the Twin Cities since 2000 and specializes in nature-inspired design, particularly bird imagery and botanical illustration. Her influences include Art Nouveau, Japanese printmaking and tattooing, the Arts and Crafts movement, folk art, and other types of illustration.  Ariel is consistently and completely booked out 2-4 months at a time, and has been booked out like this for the past 9 years, with a solid clientele.  You can see her work on her website, www.arielcafarelli.com.

For the past 4 years Ariel has worked at Twilight Tattoo in the Powderhorn neighborhood of Minneapolis.  Ariel will miss working alongside the other artists there, especially the highly skilled and exceptionally talented tattoo artist and owner Shane Wallin.  She is leaving Twilight on good terms to open Tailorbird Tattoo, and is looking forward to continued mutual support between the two shops.

Apprentice Alli Shelly is an accomplished visual artist with a background in painting, welding and other metal work, and arts education. Tailorbird will invite guest artists, especially other women, trans, queer and genderqueer artists, both local and from out of town, to tattoo in this affirming environment.

 We take our name from the industrious, powerful, and handsome tailorbird, also known as Orthotumus sutorius.  These small tropical warblers have strong legs, like the strong hands of a tattoo artist.  They have long, curved, sharply pointed bills, which they use to make their clever nests.  They make holes, like rivets, in large leaves, which they curve and sew together with plant fiber or spider’s webs, to create a cradle in which they build a grass nest.  Like the home constructed by the tailorbird, our shop is a carefully crafted space, with repurposed sewing machine tables and other reminders of our trade, tailoring custom-made tattoos. 

 Tailorbird Tattoo will host rotating art and natural history exhibits, as well as displays of nautical and tattoo-related art, paying homage to the history of tattooing, especially in celebration of women artists.  We are steadfast in our commitment to community vibrancy, and we will work wholeheartedly with clients to design beautiful, lasting art.

We are trying to raise $25,000 to supplement money that we have already set aside for this project.  This amount will allow us to meet our budget to complete this big project. We will use this additional money for build-out, specifically for plumbing, electrical work and lighting, seamless linoleum flooring, painting, framing and drywall construction.  The money raised will also go toward purchasing equipment, furniture and supplies, such as a medical autoclave and ultrasonic cleaner to sanitize and sterilize tattoo equipment, massage tables and client chairs, and a thermofax copier to make stencils.  If we can raise enough money we would also like to hire a counterperson for two days a week for the first year, with Alli working the counter on the other days during her apprenticeship.  We would then hope to continue providing this employment opportunity as the shop builds and grows. 

 If we don't reach our goal the funds raised will still go toward these efforts.  In this case, we will continue with the project and look for other forms of funding to finish the project.

We are already well along in our negotiations for a space, working with the building owners and the city to confirm that the city zoning will work for us to open a tattoo shop, and to help with the plans for an ADA bathroom.  We've begun the process of getting the business established and will soon finalize floor plans and get to work on the build-out.


Please, HELP US BREAK THE MOLD and support Tailorbird Tattoo!  And if it's just not the right time for you to donate, please help us to spread the word about our fundraising efforts by using the Indiegogo share tools and telling your friends.

Thank you for taking the time to read this, and for considering supporting us in this exciting endeavor.  We are working hard to make this new tattoo shop a reality, and we are excited to welcome you all into Tailorbird Tattoo, a unique community-centered artistic space, whether or not you want to get tattooed!
story_txt:
Tailorbird Tattoo
Tailorbird Tattoo’s Mission is to cultivate a vibrant, welcoming space for skilled artists and our clients to create custom designed tattoos.The Vision of Tailorbird Tattoo is to break the mold of most tattoo shops by being centered around thriving artists and clients, being worker-owned and collectively-run, being LGBTQ positive, and providing a space that honors and explores history, nature and art. The tailorbird (Orthotomus sutorius) is a songbird found across tropical Asia. Popular for its nest made of leaves "sewn" together, it is a common resident in urban gardens. Tailorbird Tattoo is a custom tattoo shop opening in the summer of 2015 in Minneapolis’s Seward neighborhood, started by queer and genderqueer women artists Ariel Cafarelli and apprentice Alli Shelly.  We offer a welcoming, inclusive shop and are committed to working with clients to cultivate positive tattoo experiences. Tailorbird Tattoo actively opposes racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, and all other forms of bigotry. Ariel Cafarelli has tattooed professionally in the Twin Cities since 2000 and specializes in nature-inspired design, particularly bird imagery and botanical illustration. Her influences include Art Nouveau, Japanese printmaking and tattooing, the Arts and Crafts movement, folk art, and other types of illustration.  Ariel is consistently and completely booked out 2-4 months at a time, and has been booked out like this for the past 9 years, with a solid clientele.  You can see her work on her website, www.arielcafarelli.com.For the past 4 years Ariel has worked at Twilight Tattoo in the Powderhorn neighborhood of Minneapolis.  Ariel will miss working alongside the other artists there, especially the highly skilled and exceptionally talented tattoo artist and owner Shane Wallin.  She is leaving Twilight on good terms to open Tailorbird Tattoo, and is looking forward to continued mutual support between the two shops.Apprentice Alli Shelly is an accomplished visual artist with a background in painting, welding and other metal work, and arts education. Tailorbird will invite guest artists, especially other women, trans, queer and genderqueer artists, both local and from out of town, to tattoo in this affirming environment. We take our name from the industrious, powerful, and handsome tailorbird, also known as Orthotumus sutorius.  These small tropical warblers have strong legs, like the strong hands of a tattoo artist.  They have long, curved, sharply pointed bills, which they use to make their clever nests.  They make holes, like rivets, in large leaves, which they curve and sew together with plant fiber or spider’s webs, to create a cradle in which they build a grass nest.  Like the home constructed by the tailorbird, our shop is a carefully crafted space, with repurposed sewing machine tables and other reminders of our trade, tailoring custom-made tattoos.  Tailorbird Tattoo will host rotating art and natural history exhibits, as well as displays of nautical and tattoo-related art, paying homage to the history of tattooing, especially in celebration of women artists.  We are steadfast in our commitment to community vibrancy, and we will work wholeheartedly with clients to design beautiful, lasting art.We are trying to raise $25,000 to supplement money that we have already set aside for this project.  This amount will allow us to meet our budget to complete this big project. We will use this additional money for build-out, specifically for plumbing, electrical work and lighting, seamless linoleum flooring, painting, framing and drywall construction.  The money raised will also go toward purchasing equipment, furniture and supplies, such as a medical autoclave and ultrasonic cleaner to sanitize and sterilize tattoo equipment, massage tables and client chairs, and a thermofax copier to make stencils.  If we can raise enough money we would also like to hire a counterperson for two days a week for the first year, with Alli working the counter on the other days during her apprenticeship.  We would then hope to continue providing this employment opportunity as the shop builds and grows.  If we don't reach our goal the funds raised will still go toward these efforts.  In this case, we will continue with the project and look for other forms of funding to finish the project.We are already well along in our negotiations for a space, working with the building owners and the city to confirm that the city zoning will work for us to open a tattoo shop, and to help with the plans for an ADA bathroom.  We've begun the process of getting the business established and will soon finalize floor plans and get to work on the build-out.Please, HELP US BREAK THE MOLD and support Tailorbird Tattoo!  And if it's just not the right time for you to donate, please help us to spread the word about our fundraising efforts by using the Indiegogo share tools and telling your friends.Thank you for taking the time to read this, and for considering supporting us in this exciting endeavor.  We are working hard to make this new tattoo shop a reality, and we are excited to welcome you all into Tailorbird Tattoo, a unique community-centered artistic space, whether or not you want to get tattooed!

story:
The Clic Nik was created by a select group of friends from West Philadelphia. It's origin is rooted in deep friendship and family values. It was founded when these friends graduated high school in 1990. The cook out was a way for these friends to celebrate friendships that were built with other kids throughout the city. This was their last big get together before they went off.

In 1991, after many of the original group returned from their freshman years of school and invited their new friends from school to The cook out was formerly named the Clic - Nic in 1991, when these friends realized the cookout was a mix of friends from different cliques throughout the city. The "Clic Nic" was born. From then on, it would be known as the Super Bowl of Cookouts!

The Clic Nik has always been a non violent family friendly affair. In it's 25th year, the cook out is looking to expand and a celebrate a quarter century of providing family fun, food and memories with your help.

This year we honor Nikesha Jones-West who was dedicate to the Clic Nik lets make this year truly  memorable for Big Nik

story:
Short Summary

We are WFTE Community Radio, an all volunteer run non profit station in Northeast Pennsylvania. Our community includes Mt. Cobb and Scranton, which we serve on two frequencies -- 90.3 in and around Mt. Cobb and 105.7 in Scranton -- now we need your help to replace our aged transmitter in Mt. Cobb.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $50,000 in our time frame. This buys our new transmitter, secures tower leases, upgrades our computer system, allows us to hold community events, and purchases backup equipment. You get a station that you can listen to for years to come, via the air waves, the Internet, and your cell phone. Your contribution is also tax deductible.

The Impact

Your contribution means the difference between having to shut our doors and fall silent in an area where we are providing a different voice for the community. A station giving a voice to the voiceless with both local and national programing centered on community building, sustainability, and coexistence of the human race.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! Share this with your friends and family. Want to volunteer? Distance means nothing in this day and age! Contact us: arnold@wfte.org or cheryl@wfte.org

story:
We are raising money for the water project and save the children foundation . Our goal is to help the lives of the thirsty, and ultimately change their life for the years to come. Our motto is "Give water, Save a Life!" so we would be greatly thankful if you help us achieve our goal. 

Some Facts

1 out of 9 kids don't have clean water to drink.

Nearly 1 billion people in the world don't have enough money in the world.

Diarrhoea is a leading killer of children, accounting for 9 per cent of all deaths among children under age 5 worldwide.  In 2013, this translated into 1,600 young children dying each day.  


What You'll Be Getting in the End

In the end if we are able to reach our goal of 2,000 USD we will showcase photos of our contributions from the water project and save the children foundation themselves. This will allow you to see the joy, happiness, and gratefulness on the face of the people you helped in this project. 

Aidan's Blog

Andre's Blog

Our other site

Water Game

story:
Changing Lives

I have a passion for teaching and mentoring young men. I wanted to be a part of the solution to the problems at-risk teens and young men face by providing leadership to help them navigate through the early and critical stages of life.

Our goal is to find people with a heart of compassion for the problems and challenges facing disadvantaged and at-risk kids. We also want to help lower the risks for good kids who lack positive male role models, mentors and relationships with adult males. We're determined to help prevent some of these youth from succumbing to influences that derail them by getting caught up in the streets through negative examples and peer pressure.


Platform Principles:

Our program consists of teaching four principles:

  • Reading: to include good books, engage in open discussion, analysis, critical thinking, and to form a basis for the development of public speaking skills.

  • Writing: to include short assignments to enhance and improve what they've read, build and enhance their ability to communicate their thoughts in print and to enhance their creativity.

  • Respect: to teach and model respect for themselves and others including adults, authority figures, the opposite sex and pride in their work.

  • Revenue creation: to stimulate their interest and creativity in developing ideas for business, problem solving with a view to commercializing their ideas. Emphasis on the digital world to teach them to be proactive in creating business opportunities and taking risks.

How the Idea for Boys2Business Originated

The idea for Boys2Business developed during the past summer when I began working with my grandsons. The younger, was entering 12th grade and the older one entering his sophomore year in college.

They, like many young men, wanted to sleep late, eat like horses, play ball and stay up late at night.

I decided this would not happen, at least not unrestrained. I had the father son talk with them. I told them their behavior was changing as of that day. Starting the next day they would get up at 7 a.m., meet me on the patio with a book in their hands where we would each read for an hour.

After reading we each would discuss with the others what we read and I would comment, question and counsel them as necessary. This would be their routine every day for the rest of the summer.

Needless to say, they didn't like it at first. I made sure they read books on goals, self-development, finances, and history.

The discussions served a two-fold purpose, one educational, and the second was a means of holding them accountable to ensure they actually read the books.

Following each week of reading and discussions, they were required to make five-minute presentations usually in a church service to help develop their communications and public speaking skills.

This also gave them the chance to reinforce what they learned, engage with a live audience and get direct feedback from a supportive group, usually in a church or public setting.

After a few weeks, their attitudes significantly changed. They became totally excited and began setting goals for their future. The eldest began seeking and receiving opportunities to speak in public.

Our discussions became more engaging. They chose books based on their goals and aspirations and began to apply very positive messages to their lives. They were participating in their own personal development.

Shortly thereafter, they mentioned it to a couple of their friends who also wanted to be mentored. I announced to others that we would begin a formal program for these young males.

I made a couple of public and private announcements about my plans and a few adult males, expressed interest in volunteering their time to assist me in mentoring. A parent asked if his young son who has challenges communicating publicly could participate. An aunt wants her three nephews involved.

A couple of people expressed an interest in supporting the effort once we began the formal classes.

Our Current Resources Are:

Four male volunteer mentors and two verbal commitments for support. Other resources include a thirty years in ministry and self-development, access to the internet, computer skills, an email marketing platform, some communications equipment, temporary location and social media pages.


I have committed five hours per week, two hours of which is allotted for the classroom, with the other time for administration, preparation and development, marketing and promotion. Volunteers will spend one to 2 hours per week or as schedules permit.

Our Current Team Includes:

Myself to supervise and direct the program, my wife as an admin assistant, three adult male mentors, (an owner of a general insurance agency, a stock broker with real estates sales experience and a commercial and residential home inspector. and finally one female videographer.

First Year Successes

Our success will build on the positive results already achieved, while consisting of more of the same with at least 25-30 youth participating in the program and double the number of mentors. To recruit other young men who positively influence their peers, engage in the community, improve their grades, confidence and public speaking and raise expectations for their own success. Lastly we will evaluate, refine and enhance the program and as we establish ongoing support.

Long Term Goals


Our long-term goals include recruiting active and retired teachers, to assist in tutoring various subjects and specific skills identified to maximize their learning and development, and to help enhance the program with trained teachers.

Invite and recruit businessmen who can share their experiences and knowledge with young men to keep an influx of ideas flowing, and to give other volunteers the opportunity to give back to the community by inspiring these youth.

We also want to inspire the young men to help encourage others to participate and upon their success to return to the program to become mentors.


Funding Needs

Our funding needs will allow us to file for a non-profit organization, establishing an office and eventually rent space, to create marketing and promotional materials, purchase books, audios,

To obtain digital equipment for producing training resources: audios, DVD's short video projects.

To create manuscripts, reports and booklets for distribution, postage and shipping costs, obtain supplies and materials, two computers, a membership website portal design and development.

We also seek to fund transportation needs for short field trips to expose youth to community opportunities that will allow us to build and deepen relationships so these young men can have more time in different settings and experiences with male mentors.

Crowdfunding enables people with a great business idea to ask the general public for the funding they need to set up or expand. The business sets a target for the money it wants to raise and explains how it will use the cash. People can then make pledges for small amounts of money in return for a reward if the target is reached.

story:
Our Story

The official term “Mudskipper Cafe” has only been in use since 2009, but our camp has been around much longer but with other names and was more like a camp that developed over time rather from one single plan or idea.

The Mudskipper Cafe grew out of a group of burners that used to be a part of the huge collective village know as “Avalon Village” in a camp known as UT or “Uncharted Territories”. Since Avalon disbanded as a village it was decided to change the name during the 2009 “Evolution” since this would be the first year in several that “Avalon” would not register together but rather as different camps. So like the Mudskipper taking it’s first step onto land from water, the Mudskipper cafe took it’s first step to being an entity in itself.


Why do we need money?

I'm glad you asked! You probably don't think about all of the factors that go into running a camp (especially one known for serving up ice-cold awesomeness in the middle of the desert). 

  • Because of the overwhelming response to our café last year, we are extending our café hours! That's a lot of fruit, juice, cups, blenders that need to be replaced from harsh playa conditions, and of course, ice!!
  • We run a pretty sick craft lounge which helps the inhabitants of Black Rock City get creative and make items to wear or gift!
  • Crack is Whack. Seriously. We team up with The Pickle Joint to create a Saturday party to end all Saturday parties!
  • A coffee workshop so you can pick up key information and pretend to be a coffee connoisseur.
  • A photo booth to show all of your friends back home how much better your week was than theirs!
  • And if we EXCEED our Goal, it will allow us to add some extra goodies... Like a "build your own" Bloody Mary bar including insane condiments and a gluten-free Bloody Mary mix.
  • And Possibly a quaint little make-up day with fingernail polish, flash tattoos, some make-up to make people pretty.
  • Plus, all of those other details. All of our structures are stored in a storage space which we pay for in Reno.
  • Know what else is in storage? A freezer, electrical equipment, lighting, tables and chairs, our scaffolding, the shower contraption open to all of our campers, cozy seating, supplies to run the cafe, and lots more! This brings me to...
  • ...truck rental and gas. Oy, it takes a lot to get all of this to and from the playa!
  • Gas for the generators which power our lighting, blenders, and DJ equipment!
And good gosh, who knows what else our campers may want to do! 

Who cares?

Apparently, a lot of overheated playa participants who enjoy fruit smoothies! It's why we're extending our hours!!

Is this different from our camp fees if we're camping with the Mudskippers?

Yup. The camp fees go toward all of the above and those fees just about cover the essentials. For us to go above and beyond and actually host really cool events, we need some petty cash. It's what helps us do incredible things!

story:
A Placencia Treasure

50 year old Brenda was born in the community of Placencia, Belize and for over 15 years has worked as a food vendor, selling Caribbean style delicacies to locals and tourists alike for Brenda’s Kitchen, a business she started. The food stall is located at the very end of town at the pier, and is even recognized internationally. Trip Advisor wrote an article about Brenda’s kitchen saying, “Don’t be taken back by her modest kitchen, we ate there twice and it was the most amazing food we experienced in Placencia.”

About 10 years ago she was also on an issue of the Guinness Book of World Records.

But this modest grandmotherly cook is facing some challenges, because according to her, the village council has given her notice that she must move her little kitchen shack.

Through tears she explained her ordeal...

Brenda:

“I started from scratch.  I started from cooking at my house, bringing my food out here, [and] sit over there.  Then I started working my way in.  Then I got my little tent.  I started with a little small barbeque.  I came by the tree, by the beach.  Then I started working myself in.  Now I’m getting international.  People get to know me. 

I’m just getting on my feet, when they take the bread out of my mouth.

They just give me one month, after 15 years I’ve been slaving for my community, and they’re trying to take bread out of my mouth.

It’s hurting me to see how they don’t treat the locals the way they should be treated.   That’s why the foreigners are going to come in here and take this away from us.  They’re taking a diamond.  It’s a soul.  Some of them give their life for the community.

No Warning, No Notice

According to Brenda, the chairman of the village council brought the letter to her a few weeks ago without any prior notice.

Brenda:

“Nobody didn’t talk to me about nothing, they just came on my birthday.  I was having a party.  They came and they gave me a letter and said, ‘Well, this is for you.’   I read the letter and I was totally hurt. 

I said, ‘Why are you doing this to me?’ 

She said, ‘To break this down and put a police Booth here.’

They have just got a brand new Police Station,  You have a lot of [locations] around that they could find, but they just don’t want to see the local people prosper in this country.”

Louis Wade:

“Now did you have another location where they assigned you to?”

Brenda:

“No. They just told me they need me to move in one month, otherwise they’re going to make the law take me away from here.”

In the mean time, she said she is trying to see what she will do when that day comes that she must move.

What Brenda Needs:

Please help this sweet lady raise funds to cover the cost of relocating her kitchen to another location!  In Belize, there is no legal protection for someone such as fair compensation for the local government forcing them from their business location for public use.

All funds will be given to Brenda so that she can get her business up and running again.

Check out her reviews on Trip Advisor:

http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g291977-d3397228-Reviews-Brenda_s_BBQ-Placencia_Stann_Creek.html#REVIEWS

Make An Impact

Your donation will make a real difference in Brenda's life, and will also help preserve a mainstay of the Village of Placencia!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, you can make a difference by contacting the Placencia Village Council (http://www.placenciaproud.com/) and urging them to find a better location for the Police shack.
story_txt:
A Placencia Treasure 
50 year old Brenda was born in the community of Placencia, Belize and for over 15 years has worked as a food vendor, selling Caribbean style delicacies to locals and tourists alike for Brenda’s Kitchen, a business she started. The food stall is located at the very end of town at the pier, and is even recognized internationally. Trip Advisor wrote an article about Brenda’s kitchen saying, “Don’t be taken back by her modest kitchen, we ate there twice and it was the most amazing food we experienced in Placencia.”
About 10 years ago she was also on an issue of the Guinness Book of World Records.
But this modest grandmotherly cook is facing some challenges, because according to her, the village council has given her notice that she must move her little kitchen shack.
Through tears she explained her ordeal...

Brenda:“I started from scratch.  I started from cooking at my house, bringing my food out here, [and] sit over there.  Then I started working my way in.  Then I got my little tent.  I started with a little small barbeque.  I came by the tree, by the beach.  Then I started working myself in.  Now I’m getting international.  People get to know me. 
I’m just getting on my feet, when they take the bread out of my mouth.
They just give me one month, after 15 years I’ve been slaving for my community, and they’re trying to take bread out of my mouth.
It’s hurting me to see how they don’t treat the locals the way they should be treated.   That’s why the foreigners are going to come in here and take this away from us.  They’re taking a diamond.  It’s a soul.  Some of them give their life for the community.
No Warning, No Notice

According to Brenda, the chairman of the village council brought the letter to her a few weeks ago without any prior notice.
Brenda:
“Nobody didn’t talk to me about nothing, they just came on my birthday.  I was having a party.  They came and they gave me a letter and said, ‘Well, this is for you.’   I read the letter and I was totally hurt. 
I said, ‘Why are you doing this to me?’ 
She said, ‘To break this down and put a police Booth here.’
They have just got a brand new Police Station,  You have a lot of [locations] around that they could find, but they just don’t want to see the local people prosper in this country.”


Louis Wade:
“Now did you have another location where they assigned you to?”
Brenda:
“No. They just told me they need me to move in one month, otherwise they’re going to make the law take me away from here.”
In the mean time, she said she is trying to see what she will do when that day comes that she must move.
   What Brenda Needs: Please help this sweet lady raise funds to cover the cost of relocating her kitchen to another location!  In Belize, there is no legal protection for someone such as fair compensation for the local government forcing them from their business location for public use.
All funds will be given to Brenda so that she can get her business up and running again.
Check out her reviews on Trip Advisor:
http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g291977-d3397228-Reviews-Brenda_s_BBQ-Placencia_Stann_Creek.html#REVIEWS   Make An Impact Your donation will make a real difference in Brenda's life, and will also help preserve a mainstay of the Village of Placencia!

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't help financially, you can make a difference by contacting the Placencia Village Council (http://www.placenciaproud.com/) and urging them to find a better location for the Police shack.

story:
A Passion with Potential

Three years ago I made a mistake that just may not have been:

Three years ago my family was forced to sell our third generation lakefront cabin. The economy in NY raised our taxes, and ruined our incomes, the property that had been promised to me since I was five years old was sold for pennies on the dollar to make life a little easier on our family. Well I admittedly didn't take it well, I immediatly starting looking for some way to salvage what I was forced to give up so that my children could one day enjoy what I spent my whole childhood till I was 30 enjoying myself. The woods, nature, waterfront, we had to no heat, no A/C no hot water  no cable nothing but woods and water and it was paradise. So I thought to myself where could I find that again affordable, I literally had a budget of less than 100 dollars and a dream. So I scoured the ads, online and Craigslist and came upon a very promising 1968 one owner Apache Mesa pop up camper, and I made offers and deals and could not get it within budget, three months later I recieve an email from the owner saying he still had it and he was with ready to sell it or scrap it. Long story short,  a two hour drive and a fifty dollar bill later I was its proud second owner. Well, I thought so, let's just say I've had three years of experts laugh, restorers laugh and my wife occasionally mock my purchase as well. I had made a mistake, my fifty dollar camper was in need of upwards of 2000 dollars in repairs. A little heartbroken and a aware of where to go next I tucked it away in the back yard and moved on. Lately I've been looking online, researching and idea searching for how to use the poor thing for SOMETHING and I happened across an article from the UK about a man in a similiar situation and his ingenious solution....

The Idea

We are in the age of environmental impact, we are seeing a huge trend on self reliance, downsizing, and returning to a simpler existence while leaving smaller  impact and lesser carbon footprints on the planet. A huge trend and one I'd love to contribute myself to is the MicroHousing craze. Microhouses are as they sound, very small housing, only the essentials and very often self sustaining. Beds, stoves, toilet, sink,  solar lighting and some source of heat and seating. The article that caught my eyes took this all one step further and added the recycling of a used pop up camper to make the foundation and make the whole microhouses mobile!
My idea takes it yet a small step forward from there, I have a background in furniture restoration and refinishing, I've also found myself walking into collapsing buildings upon owners requests and pulling out beautiful tongue and grove flooring, hundred year old planks, left to rot fixtures and hinges and bracers and beautiful doors as well. So I would like to combine it all and attempt not only up cycle my pop up into my first prototype mobile microhouse but I'd love to attempt to make it as much as possible out of reclaimed product. Luckily I have contacts in multiple historical societies and know when and where buildings with salvage potential will be popping up for the scrapping.

Risks & Challenges

Granted this is a new kind of challenge for me, as it would be for almost anyone but the handful of people paving the way on projects like these. But I am far from new at building with wood, before wood restoration was ever in my future I spent my childhood in my grandfathers garage building anything and everything I could from scratch and scraps, I've build sheds, I've built small structures and I have family who are in construction and housing as well. The risk in these projects look minimal, the pop up itself will be the support, the frame, the structure and the dimensions. I know somebody out there is looking at my funding goal and asking why so high for such a small place. That's in the challenge for me, my challenges lie in the design and weight for the overall project. I'll need to create a lightweight fairly aerodynamically freindly and eye catching self sustaining structure with basic plumbing, lighting and utilities. I want to make sure the prototype has the best impact it can, so I'm now talking chemical or composting toilets, solar electric panels for heat and lighting, propane showers and stoves, soybean sprayfoam insulating,  and  other means of self reliant and enviromentally sound product.

Also I am quite luckily surrounded by builders, artists, and electricians and have great confidence in our potential.  And when this one hits the road what's stopping the next from being better? What's to stop another Craigslist salvage camper to become someone's Summer cabin, or fishing shed, or home away from home... OR HOME!!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

How can people help? Have confidence in what we are doing, this isn't for me, this isn't for the money, this is for the future, this is for cabins by the water, waking up in the woods, amazing mobile escapes for a fraction of the cost of rv's, campers, hotels and it's good for the planet!!  Tires saved from the dump, pop ups saved for a second life, reclaimed lumber, reduced carbon footprints and it travels with you!
On top of that I'll gladly accept suggestions on design, engineering, looks, and enviromentally freindly routes I can take in building these.

story:
Hello

We are the Samosa Queens!  We are Abida, Hasina, and Lutfun, three women who live in Jamaica, Queens, N.Y. We like to say it’s little Bangladesh. We all met here, in New York, at the Wishwas community sewing class but we are all originally from Dhaka, Bangladesh.  We used to sell food at small Bangladeshi fairs in Queens but now we would like to bring our traditional foods to all New Yorkers.  We would like to start selling our food at the Queens Night Market and Smorgasburg.  We would like your help to start our small street food business.  

We will be selling the best:
Samosas – stuffed pastry pockets: Chicken Keema, Vegetable Paneer, Coconut, and Cheeseburger
Pakoras – vegetable fritters made with spinach, kale, onion, and eggplant
Piyaju – crispy lentil fritters with fresh curry leaves
Chicken Biryani – roast chicken, fragrant rice and veg. with a traditional salad and yoghurt sauce
Pitu Sandwich Wraps – rice flour crepes with grilled chicken and vegetables (a kind of Bengali taco)
Jolopy – traditional sweets
Everything is served with our homemade tamarind sauce and mint cilantro sauce

What We Need To Be Successful
We want to raise $1000 for small startup costs for a street food business.  With your money we’ll purchase an outdoor grill, vending permits, and kitchen supplies.  We need two coolers with wheels to keep the food cold and fresh, a new folding table, and a dolly to carry heavy items like our deep fryer.

If we do not reach our goal, we still need to buy these things.  Our first items are the permits and an outdoor grill.  We need the grill to make our Pitu Sandwich wraps. The wraps are made out of rice flour dough and hold meat and veg.  It’s a kind of Bengali taco made with a rice flour crepe.


The Impact It Will Have
We are all full-time mothers.  We share passions for gardening, sewing and embroidery, but we love cooking the most.  We love to cook and to feed others.  We would like to grow the Samosa Queens business with food stalls in Brooklyn & Manhattan, and one day a restaurant!  We hope to  provide jobs for other women from our community.  We hope you believe in us and we hope that you will soon enjoy our Homemade Bangla Yummy Snacks!

Please visit us at the Queens Night Bazaar on Saturdays July 11th, July 25th and every Saturday in August.  From 6pm to Midnight, at the New York Hall of Science in Flushing Meadows Corona Park, Queens (take the 7 train).  If our campaign is successful we will join Smorgasburg in August.


Thank You,

Abida Sultana
Hasina Ahsan
Lutfun Nahar


Please tell all your friends!  Also we have a facebook

story:
Who are we?

We are two local people trying to make a difference in our community!  Ed and Alison have marketing degrees and a passion for helping others.  Ed has owned other business and has been in sales and marketing his whole life.  Alison has a Human Resources background, working in HR for 20 years placing individuals in new career opportunities. She truly enjoys watching others succeed.  We both love to try new restaurants, and to support family run restaurants instead of the big chains. We believe localchester.com supports local restaurants and supports local charities, all while families try new places to eat and save money!!



What is localchester.com?

Our website offers 50% certificates of participating Chester County restaurants. Customers that visit the website and can search Chester County restaurants by location, name or type of food.  Restaurants are displayed on the site with professional photographs, and a short video, both funded by localchester.com (not the restaurant).  The site has the menu of the restaurant, a map and address/phone of where it is located, a link to their website and any other additional information that the restaurant owner would like to share on our site.  Once a patron chooses a restaurant  they would like to buy a certificate from they go through a payment process to pay online for a certificate, which is emailed to them.  They enter their name and address and email into our database while paying so we can capture that information for marketing purposes and to insure that only one certificate per household per 60 days for each restaurant is being upholded.  If the patron has a promotional code for a local charity, they enter that code at checkout, which will alert Localchester to pay that charity 5% of our half of the portion of the certificate amount.

We offer a partnership with the restaurants, and only only succeed when our partner restaurant succeeds.  We split the face value of the certificate with the restaurant, when the certificate is redeemed.  There is no money asked from the restaurants up front which now provides the small business owner to be able to be a larger local name WITHOUT the gamble each month and/or the large cost to advertise. Basically known as production based marketing and EVERY industry should have some form of opportunity to do this. It provides the small businessman a chance to survive in harsher economic times without the risk. We NEVER ask for money and only give to the restaurants when people redeem certificates.

Here is a video we produced for one of our participating restaurants, The Bacon Press in Malvern, PA.  Please visit the gallery for more videos and pictures!


Where is localchester.com?

In Chester County Pennsylvania, a suburb of Philadelphia, made up of rolling hills and bustling main streets.  We want to preserve the mom and pop/family run restaurants in the county by giving them the exposure they need.


How does it work?

Check it out...




What We Need

We need funds to get our website live to start helping these restaurants and charities.  We currently have 25 participating restaurants - and counting!  We want to get to close to 50 restaurants before opening our "doors", so customers have a great variety to choose from.   We have put all of our heart and soul (and dollars!!) into this idea and we really believe in it!    We need money to advertise our site on TV, radio, billboards in Chester County and social media (of course!), to get people to use it, and we want to upgrade our site to give our customers a quality experience while on our site.   Please visit our gallery tab to see videos we have produced and pictures from some of  our participating restaurants and charities!  We really appreciate anything you can give (thank you!)!
THANK YOU SO MUCH AND CHEERS!

story:
Short Summary

Two Sergeants Brewing was founded by 2 veterans, Kevin and Keith. With 46 years of combined service to the Canadian and British militaries, we are now embarking on a new adventure as entrepreneurs. Our venture, currently operating as a contract brewery, needs your help to take the next step....building our own facility in Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta.



We have contracted Ripley Stainless Limited, out of Summerland BC to build our brewing equipment, which is scheduled to be delivered in September.


We have found the perfect location in the vibrant downtown core of Fort Saskatchewan. We envision a fusion of a traditional English Style Pub, and East Coast bar, coupled with a brewery. Our theme will be good beer, better company and live music.

What We Need 

We have set our goal at $75,000. 
If we reach it, that will allow us to buy the rest of our equipment in cash, which in turn will decrease the amount of total project financing required. It will also give us some operating capital.
If we don't reach our goal, your pledges don't go to waste.  Every dollar we raise is one less dollar we have to finance.  
This isn't kickstarter, it's NOT all or nothing.
We have set enough pledges that we can raise MUCH more than our goal, and we truly hope that we do. The sky is the limit
What You Get

all of our perk levels are priced so, most importantly we raise the money we need, but a very close second, so you...our very valuable supporter...know you are getting quality items for your money. All of the products are unique, useful and made by the highest quality suppliers. 

Above, is the challenge coin bottle opener proof design, These will be made by the leading manufacturer of genuine military challenge coins.

Below are two photos of the stainless steel, magnetic insulated beer can koozie. Like the description, it is made out of high grade 304 stainless steel, insulated with neoprene foam and has an industrial magnet inside. the bottom has a soft rubber pad, so you wont worry about scratching polished surfaces like truck hoods. This is no dollar store novelty!

Below is an image of the 64oz growler box/pint glass packaging. This will also come with a high quality sticker and 4 pub quality coasters.

This beautiful copper mug, is a genuine, hand-made 20oz Moscow Mule Mug, with the Two Sergeants Brewing logo engraved into it. 

The Impact

This campaign is not only about raising money. It is about building a relationship with our customers. We have created a company that we think people can identify with, and we are building a brewpub that will be friendly and welcoming. We hope that we have also built a campaign that you can be comfortable with...Your support will go a LONG way to making our dream a reality...But remember. This Brewery and Pub we are building is not just about us! It's for you!!


Legal Stuff

UPDATE: 

We have been notified by AGLC that the 100 free pints per year included in the SERGEANTS MESS PACKAGE must be served as off sales. According to current regulations, giving free beer inside a licenses premise would be in violation of current regulations. We are still honoring the terms of the package in it's entirety, and you will receive FULL VALUE as stated, however please note that your 100 free pints must be consumed off premise. Therefore we will provide them to you in the form of six packs, singles, extra growlers, whatever you prefer. Furthermore, we are working closely with AGLC, and as lifetime members, if there is a change in policy or a loophole to be found, we will revert to in house free beer. In the end this is still a CRAP LOAD of "free beer"

AGLC has advised us that it is illegal for fellow Alberta Licensee's to directly participate in our crowdfunding campaign.

We are also obliged to mention, that the "free beer" provided in the different support levels, are contingent on us being granted the requisite license for our premises....obviously 

Finally....we will ship any perk, anywhere....however, please note that shipping is not included in the perk price. We will find the most economical and reliable shipping method at the time of shipping, and you will be billed directly.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, don't sweat it.... spread the word

tell your friends, tell your enemies....tell strangers....tell EVERYBODY

All it takes is a click and a share!!!

We have created a company that we think people can identify with, and we are building a brewpub that will be friendly and welcoming. We hope that we have also built a campaign that you can be comfortable with...Your support will go a LONG way to making our dream a reality...But remember. This Brewery and Pub we are building is not just about us! It's for you!!

Legal Stuff
UPDATE: 
We have been notified by AGLC that the 100 free pints per year included in the SERGEANTS MESS PACKAGE must be served as off sales. According to current regulations, giving free beer inside a licenses premise would be in violation of current regulations. We are still honoring the terms of the package in it's entirety, and you will receive FULL VALUE as stated, however please note that your 100 free pints must be consumed off premise. Therefore we will provide them to you in the form of six packs, singles, extra growlers, whatever you prefer. Furthermore, we are working closely with AGLC, and as lifetime members, if there is a change in policy or a loophole to be found, we will revert to in house free beer. In the end this is still a CRAP LOAD of "free beer"
 AGLC has advised us that it is illegal for fellow Alberta Licensee's to directly participate in our crowdfunding campaign.
We are also obliged to mention, that the "free beer" provided in the different support levels, are contingent on us being granted the requisite license for our premises....obviously 
Finally....we will ship any perk, anywhere....however, please note that shipping is not included in the perk price. We will find the most economical and reliable shipping method at the time of shipping, and you will be billed directly.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially, don't sweat it.... spread the word
tell your friends, tell your enemies....tell strangers....tell EVERYBODY
All it takes is a click and a share!!!

story:
Freedom Farm For Vets is a non-profit working farm with a main purpose of growing vegetables, offering animal interaction and providing a peaceful and purposeful place for veterans to go. 

The farm is open to all veterans and their families, giving them a positive place to be a part of and to visit.

Veterans are free to work in the gardens and take home vegetables to their families, interact with the animals or simply sit under the apple trees and observe farm life.

Vegetables grown on the farm are donated to a local food pantry and sold in the local community to raise funds to be used to help our veterans in any way possible.

You can learn about how the Balen family farm inspired our organization’s mission on our website Freedom Farm for Vets

If you’re interested in supporting us in some way or visiting us on the farm feel free to get in touch.

We are seeking funding for several different necessities and projects including:

  • Duck pond improvements
  • Well for fresh water
  • Barn Improvements
  • Equine Program
  • Flush Toilets

Aside from the day to day assistance we offer here at the farm, we have also recently assisted (with the generous help of a grant from The Home Depot Foundation) a veterans' family remove unhealthy mold from their home.  
We have also (with the generous help of Tuff Shed) built some club houses for the Veterans Kids (from Kids Rank) who get so much from their time spent at the farm.

Everything we do is in support of the veterans who have served this great country of ours and it is all done through volunteer efforts.  

We appreciate any and all help we receive, no amount is too small to help in some way.  

If you can't donate financially, consider coming out to the farm and donating some time instead.  We'd love to see you.

We'd also appreciate it if you could share our cause with friends and family who could help or who possibly know a person or a business who is interested in helping our veterans.
