story:
Short Summary

With almost 1,000 people being deported daily, migrant shelters along the U.S.-Mexico border are crucial in the battle against abuses towards migrants. Oftentimes migrants are deported into Mexico with no money and no way to get back home. Casa del Migrante, a migrant shelter in Tijuana, provides these migrants with many services, including shelter, meals, first aid, spiritual help, counseling, and legal services, job training and placement. 87% of the migrants at Casa are deportees. Others are refugees awaiting humanitarian visas from the U.S.  While they wait, they need a safe place to stay. Migrants are a vulnerable population, often suffering from kidnappings, extortion, rape, or worse. Please help Casa del Migrante continue helping migrants in transit.

Con casi 1,000 personas deportadas cada dia, albergues para migrantes en la frontera son muy importantes en la batalla contra abusos hacia migrantes. Muchas veces los migrantes son deportados a Mexico sin dinero y sin ayuda para volver a su tierra natal. Casa del Migrante, un albergue en Tijuana, proporciona a migrantes muchos servicios, como alojamiento, comidas, atencion medica, apoyo espiritual, consejeros y abogados, y entrenamiento de trabajo. 87 por ciento de los migrantes en Casa han sido deportados. Otros son refugiados esperando recibir asilo en los Estados Unidos. Ellos necesitan un lugar seguro en donde quedarse. Los migrantes son muy vulnerables a los abusos. Por favor ayuda a Casa del Migrante a seguir ayudando a los migrantes. 

Casa del Migrante

                   Calle Galileo No. 239, Postal, 22416 Tijuana, BC, Mexico
          +52 664 682 5180

  • WHO I AM:  My name is Reyna Grande. I am the author of the books, Across a Hundred Mountains, Dancing with Butterflies, and The Distance Between Us. My books have received an American Book Award, the El Premio Aztlan Literary Award, among others. I am originally from Iguala, Guerrero, Mexico. I came to the U.S. as an undocumented immigrant at the age of nine after being separated from my parents for many years. As an immigrant myself, my work and my activism is all related to immigrant rights issues. I believe that all migrants should be treated with dignity, respect, and compassion.
  • WHY I AM DOING THIS;  When I was a migrant, I was only a child, and luckily, my father took good care of me during our border crossing. We never ended up at a shelter. We were never stranded in the middle of nowhere, without money, without a helping hand, without hope, with nothing but broken dreams. I was one of the "lucky" ones. I managed to get to the U.S. and five years later I received a greencard, which allowed me to pursue my dreams of going to college, having a career, and making the American Dream my own. I succeeded, but many don't. The journey is perilous and much is at stake.  Migrants are human beings that deserve respect, compassion, and dignity, but often they are made to suffer all kinds of abuse. Please join me in making their journey less ardous and painful. Together, we can make a difference in their lives and their pursuit of a better life.
  • ABOUT CASA DEL MIGRANTE: Casa del Migrante (Tijuana B.C.) was founded in 1987, and is a faith-based non-profit temporary shelter run by the Scalabrinian Priests. the facility provides assistance to men who have been deported back to Mexico from the United States. Oftentimes these men return to Tijuana with no money and no way to get back to their home. They receive 3 meals a day, a shower, clean clothing, and are allowed to stay at the center for up to 12 days. The center also provides medical care, counseling, resources for job traning and placement, and spiritual guidance. Unlike the days of two decades past, when virtually all of the migrants receiving help were people attempting to cross into the U.S. without papers, 87% of the shelter’s clients are deportees from the United States. Others are refugees from Central America and all regions of Mexico, where violence has driven people to flee.

  • QUIEN SOY: Mi nombre es Reyna Grande. Soy la autora de los libros, A través de cien montañas, Bailando con las mariposas , y la distancia entre nosotros. Mis libros han recibido un American Book Award, el Premio Literario Aztlan, entre otros. Soy originaria de Iguala, Guerrero, México. Llegué a los EE.UU. como una inmigrante indocumentada a la edad de nueve años después de haber sido separada de mis padres durante muchos años. Como inmigrante, mi trabajo y mi activismo es para pelear por los derechos de inmigrantes. Creo que todos los migrantes deben ser tratados con dignidad, respeto y compasión.

  • POR QUE HAGO ESTO:  Cuando yo era una migrante, yo era una nina, y mi padre me cuido mucho durante el cruce. Nunca tuvimos que buscar asilo en un albergue. Nunca fuimos abandonados en un lugar extrano, sin dinero, sin ayuda, sin esperanza, sin nada mas que suenos rotos. Los Migrantes son seres humanos y se merecen respeto, compasion, y dignidad. Pero muy seguido son maltratados y perseguidos. Por favor ayudame para hacer que sus jornadas sean menos dificiles y dolorosas. Juntos podemos lograrlo! Juntos podemos apoyarlos mientras buscan una vida mejor.
  • CASA DEL MIGRANTE: Casa del Migrante (Tijuana B.C.) fue fundada en 1987, y es una organizacion no lucrativa de acogimiento temporal de los misioneros  Scalabrinianos. El albergue da ayuda a hombres que han sido deportados a Mexico de los United States. Muchas veces estos hombres regresan a Tijuana sin dinero y sin manera de regresar a sus hogares. En CASA ellos reciben 3 comidas al dia, una ducha, ropa limpia, y pueden quedarse hasta 12 dias. CASA tambien les da atencion medica, servicios de consejero y abogado, entrenamiento de empleo, ayuda en encontrar trabajo, y apoyo espiritual. A diferencia de hace dos decadas, cuando casi todos los migrantes en CASA eran gente queriendo intentar cruzar la frontera, hoy en dia, 87 por ciento de los migrantes en CASA son personas que han sido deportadas de los Estados Unidos. Otros son refugiados de America Central o de diferentes partes de Mexico, gente que esta huyendo de la violencia. 

What We Need/ Lo Que Necesitamos

Your donation will help Casa del Migrante provide basic services to thousands of migrants who are stranded at the US-Mexico border far from home and their loved ones. It will also help Casa del Migrante provide extra services to victims of kidnappings and extortion. 
Su donacion ayudara la Casa de Migrante proporcionar servicios a los miles de migrantes en la frontera, lejos de sus hogares y sus seres queridos. Tambien ayudara a la Casa del Migrante proporcionar servicios a victimas de secuestros y extorciones, quienes necesitan atencion mas especializada.
When you donate/ Cuando hace una donacion: 
  1. $10--You feed a migrant for one day./ Alimenta a un migrante por un dia.
  2. $25--You give a migrant shelter for a day, (includes bed and shower)./ Dale posada a un migrante por un dia (incluye cama y ducha)
  3. $50--You give all of the above plus clothes and hygiene products/ Todo lo de arriba mas ropa y articulos de higiene.
  4. $100--You give a migrant psychological, medical, and legal services./ Dale a un migrante servicios de psicologico, medico, y abogado
  5. $250--Help Casa del Migrante buy an industrial size washing machine. / Ayuda a Casa del Migrante comprar una lavadora industrial                                                   


Other Ways You Can Help/ Otra Manera de Ayudar

Please share this fundraiser campaign with your friends and family. 

Por favor ayuda a difundir esta informacion y motiva a tus amigos que hagan una donacion.

story:
Who we are:



Hello to each of you! Gypsy & Sons food truck is run by husband and wife team. PJ and Nicole Noblett, who have two sons in the Buffalo NY region. Our journey into vegansism began six years ago. As we have lived this plant based lifestyle, we have seen the need for a greater option in our area. After many business plans, hopes, and dreams, we have finally decided to move forward.  We have dedicated our entire lives to this project.  No longer do we work for anyone else but ourselves. 


Our Vision:



We are passionate a out bringing fresh, organic, and local goodness with amazing flavor to your plate. Comfort food with a plant based twist is our forte. We want to show everyone how great vegan foods can be. We want to create a lasting impression on your palate! Our goal is to impress not just the vegans in our community, but everyone from foodies to the most picky of eaters!


What is next?:




We have done the research, and secured the truck.  Many things we are able to fund ourselves, but we need some support from our friends, family, and foodie community to finish what we have started.  We are raising money to support with retrofitting process of our 27ft rv. We will soon make it into a fully functional food truck. If we are able to exceed our goal, we will be able to set up solar panels on top to help reduce our carbon footprint.  Any dollar amount will be so very helpful!  We have lined up some amazing perks for your donations.  Check them out, and see what interests you.  If you love the cause, but do not live in the Buffalo area, there are still some perks for you as well!  We have teamed up with a some amazing groups to help give you more options to choose from!  And don't forget to SHARE SHARE SHARE! Together we can make this happen for all of us!  We thank you from the bottom of our hearts, and look forward to meeting and feeding you!

Together we can make this happen for all of us!  We thank you from the bottom of our hearts, and look forward to meeting and feeding you!

story:
Honeycomb Village, Sustainable modular houses, globally wise

by

SUNLIGHT

Welcome to Honeycomb Village

We've designed housing for 1 Million people in India. You might be asking yourself "Why is housing in technology?". Once you see our Pavilions and techniques we have developed to build a new sustainable industry you'll understand Why and want to contribute. Honeycomb Village is light, modular, and affordable pavilions set on a raised platform to create a clean and healthy environment for people. This semi-permanent housing can be lifesaving, a stepping-stone for millions of people who need quality housing for a limited time anywhere in the world. Please enjoy the video and see how significant your contribution will be to so many people’s lives. I never knew how important my contribution was until this summer.

photo by John Warner

This project was born a few months ago when I was invited by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology- Media Lab to come to India. I brought my semi-permanent housing concept and sketches to serve millions people who attend Kumbh Mela (the world's largest human gathering). Since the day I set foot in India, hundreds of people from students to professionals have volunteered their time and effort to work for change. After the first week MIT-ML asked me to extend my stay. A year may be to short to realize a project of this magnitude, so I've committed to stay indefinitely. The opportunity to provide affordable housing exists around the world and it include housing for:

·  Humanitarian relief after earthquakes, tsunami, wildfires, and floods
·  Construction workers
·  Agricultural workers
·  Transportation projects
·  National Parks
·  Slum re-development
·  Homeless transitions.

Neither governments, nor private interests have adequately met the housing challenge. So, together we are the forming a partnership to move the tipping point for people away from poverty, and we need your help!


Endorsements:

Project / Career / Academic / Personal 

" Mr. Knox's expertise and experience in engineering, architecture, and urban design would be valuable in contributing to this year's success in Nashik. His design and architectural experience gives Mr. Knox a systematic understanding that will facilitate his teaching, mentorship, and promote a design for temporary housing that may ultimately benefit people around the world."

Dr. Ramesh Raskar- Associate Professor, Head of Camera Culture Group

Massachusetts Institute of Technology- Media Lab




I was prepared for the technical challenges. As an architect, I’ve worked on the vanguard of large-scale and high-tech projects from Airports to Semiconductor ChipFabs. I’ve traveled in North, South and Central America, Europe, and now Asia. I’ve applied principles of sustainable design and urban planning to fashion the best out of high-tech to serve people in sustainable housing. 

I was not prepared for the overwhelming acceptance. The support I’ve received to to seek answers to Why people need housing? is inspiring. The answers are embedded in a context where critical inquiry and experience blends with feeling, function, and form. Where better to take a stand with human dignity than here?


“ There are writers I admire for their sensitivity to the place and context in which they write. Scott has a similar understanding and command of the contemporary condition within his field and the historical applications. The proposals he has authored, his research and development, and his attention to detail show a strong commitment. I would recommend few candidates to contribute to the restoration of the Parthenon (knowing the Parthenon marbles from my own research and writing), but Scott is an exception. I can think of no better candidate and no better use of today’s science and technology than in the service of such a noble cause.” 

Christopher Hitchens- Author


Honeycomb Village: beautifully simple

We’ve placed self-supported tensile structures on a honeycomb platform. The raised floor (from ChipFab design) integrates utilities below deck. The roofs harvest rainwater and capture sunlight to generate electricity (via photo-voltaic). Crucial to people’s health is indoor plumbing and sanitary conditions on-deck. Inside each Community Pavilion is plumbing in bathrooms and kitchen. Bio-digesters (located below deck) transform the contents of the sanitary system into cooking fuel, irrigation water, and fertilizer. All these standardized systems are combined into a sustainable model for both house and a village that’s scalable.

Honeycomb Village is completely modular from set-up to dismantle from deck to roof, and no tools are required for assembly. After each use HV can be disassembled and packed into standard containers and shipped anywhere around the world. Sustainable, Modular, Safe, and Healthy: a recipe for promoting people’s lives with dignity and we’re here to prove it!

Some believe poverty is rooted in people, whether in slums or uprooted by disaster, people tainted by poverty will remain in chaos or homelessness. I believe there are thresholds throughout human history. Thresholds that bar many people from making significant changes in their lives.

One significant threshold is the barrier many people face in their lives to reach permanent housing from destitution or despair. From the lowest rungs this stretch is too great, the cost too high, the treadmill of life doesn't allow them to make ends meet, and battling unsanitary surroundings saps their health and will to do little more than let them survive, and for all-too-many, not even that.

Honeycomb Village can provide safe, efficient, and affordable housing to people in need or displaced by circumstances. They’ll have a direct role raising pavilions in which they live and in-turn housing people around them. This constructive act may build skills, engender a sense of ownership and responsibility, and promote their contribution to society. The ultimate goal of improving surroundings is have people live investing their time, energy, and money in themselves. Self-worth may single most important stance against poverty. People who elevate themselves and clear that “threshold” of poverty in a few, smaller steps may lift society with them. A society that abandons its responsibility to promote a safe and healthy infrastructure will carry the reproductive weight of human neglect.


“As a medical professional and medical technologist I see Honeycomb Village as a balanced environment for serving people’s needs. Integrating Tele-Clinics and Educational Forums into the network of housing shows foresight that is essential to successful urban plan designed to lift people beyond their situation in life. The design of the structure is such that it is easy to maintain the necessary hygiene and sanitation in these pavilions of the Honeycomb Village, making them an ideal place for Tele-Clinic services.” 

Dr. Pankaj Parashar- MBBS, PhD Indian Institute of Technology,

Delhi/ AIIMS New Delhi 


Who else can help make this happen?

We are talking with International Red Cross, USAID, and others who provide essential services for earthquake and tsunami humanitarian relief. We’ve presented HV to construction and agriculture interests who see decent housing with medical and school pavilions for workers and their families. Event and resort interests see on-site housing for visitor accommodations. An outdoor enthusiast saw HV as accommodations in national parks with minimal impact on the natural surroundings. I’ve met few people who don’t see some shared aspect in Honeycomb Village.


“Specifically, due to the position I have held for many years in connection with the Parthenon reconstruction I constantly receive visits and correspondence from individuals …who aspire to make a contribution to the work of the Parthenon. The volume of these requests is very high and given that the time that I can devote to them is limited I only concentrate on the ones that are most promising. Among those that I regard as the most serious proposals is the one submitted by American architect Mr. Scott B. Knox for the production of primary digital documentation of the Parthenon with actual on-location use of laser scanning techniques to produce a high-resolution three-dimensional computer model.”….” I wholeheartedly support Mr. Knox, not only because I know precisely what useful purpose it will serve but also because, following a careful study of his accompanying documents, I concluded that both he and his associates have the required technical knowhow and the proper professional attitude.”

Dr. Manolis Korres- Parthenon Head Architect,

Committee for the Conservation of the Acropolis Monuments, Athens, Greece.


Why Crowdfund Honeycomb Village?

The first “anything” is more expensive than each of the thousands that may follow. Economies of scale will drive down costs for each pavilion, but few people can self-fund a project of this scale alone. This project’s goals are too large not only in the monetary sense, but in the practical sense as well. I helped design and build the nano-technology industry in New York and learned the power of Public Private Partnerships. Nanotechnology hardly existed there a few decades ago. Now, with the kick start it received from broad support the semiconductor industry is a multi-billion dollar engine for growth. Semi-permanent buildings are more than an inexpensive housing design, they can be a new industry in a country with a great need for safe and affordable housing. This is where crowdfunding come in: we need your help to fill the gap. India builds quality permanent housing, but for a LARGE percentage of her VERY LARGE population the leap from no/low quality housing to that permanent house is just too great. Once we crowdfund this project with help from many stakeholders, then Honeycomb Village will have an opportunity to build an industry, create jobs, and generate income. The result may provide a stepping-stone, a transitional point, for people at the lowest rungs to reach a permanent housing and be the true gift of your donation. Imagine, you can help make ALL housing more affordable, build a new industry from the ground up, and plant seeds to grow a middle-class! Sound like a grand challenge? It is, but we can’t do it without your help.


Honeycomb Village- a sustainable and modular solution.


“ When I first heard about the HoneyComb Village concept, I was amazed. I never imagined that this type of well-thought through "semi-permanent" housing concept is possible! In India, we have huge problems when it comes to housing for the poor. This type of concept could be an answer to our current situation. This model will not only provide housing to the poor but can actually build industry, create jobs and provide a stepping stone for them to reach permanent place to live. What I like the most about HV concept is it's architecture and color coding system. It's unique and easy to understand for both the literates and the illiterates, which is extremely important. This kind of housing concept should not only be looked at during some kind of disaster, but should be looked at for turning the rural villages into smart cities. I think this is a very innovative concept and it may be the NEXT THING in housing sector! ”

Aria Ohi, Mumbai India


Official Honeycomb Village Tee Shirt

Please join us by making a DoNation?

This phase is the first step to manufacturing 25,000 pavilions. Our goal is to eventually house 1M people in health and dignity. Let's IndiegoGO and begin Honeycomb Village. I have boot-strapped this project since it’s inception. We're engaging professional architects and engineers, government officials at State and local levels, national organizations like the Red Cross and Rotary, doctors, specialists in sustainable design from rain-water harvesting, solar photo-voltaic, and bio-digesting. We now greatly need your support to launch Honeycomb Village into production and seed a new economy for people and affordable housing in India and around the world.


“ Scott was often relentless to make cross-disciplinary connections as well as making cross-disciplinary critiques. His insights and questions were challenging both to me and to his student colleagues. In a fashion that is typical for him he labored assiduously to consider every facet of the design from urbanistic issues to political implications to details. Overall, Scott was one of the most mature, self-directed, and highly motivated students I have come in contact with in our graduate program. ”

David Bell, Architecture Faculty 
Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute



Why Crowdfunding?

Indiegogo is a proven start-up platform, whose community of “early adopters” vets, funds, and helps refine new designs and spur social entrepreneurship in an efficient, timely manner. Therefore, we highly value the Indiegogo  community and its role in supporting innovation and hope that together we can launch Honeycomb Village!

Please Share Honeycomb Village's Kickstarter Campaign on ALL your favorite social medias: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, 


“ I have known Scott Knox for over 25 years, and highly recommend him because I have seen his dedication to work and family. I know that because he has been working in and around building construction as both a tradesman and an architect, his balance of theoretical and practical experience helps him grasp a wide scale of projects. Scott’s comfortable communicating and expresses himself well in everyday circumstances and under pressure. I expect you would find him to be a great asset to your organization, and someone people truly enjoy working with.” 

Jeffrey Kosmacher, Director of Media Relations & Public Affairs
Vassar College


Competition, risks, and challenges

        What other semi-permanent housing solutions are already available? From Pup-tent to mobile-homes when you need 1 liter of fresh water you have to walk and carry water back each time you run out. There are too few solutions that incorporate indoor plumbing, proper sanitary waste management, and sustainable utilities in an affordable solution. Most simply do not adequately provide necessary utility service.

       Risks are inherent in manufacturing. We’ve taken precautions to prepare drawings, model known conditions, and document logistics from manufacturing through deployment. The risk is in the unknown conditions that will arise in the process. Our response to the rise will be to collaborate with our design, manufacturing, and distribution partners and overcome the challenges. We are dedicated to keep our backers updated on the HV website and inform them about issues and our efforts to resolve them as they arise.

       The challenge of designing Honeycomb Village was to integrate all the basic services within each pavilion and throughout the village. Making a sustainable infrastructure affordable is meeting the challenge. The price estimate will be confirmed and economies of scale will bring them down. The raised platform is a proven solution in high-tech industries around the world. Data centers, ChipFab's, and other process industries have developed and tested the functionality of access floor services. But, how will these "high-tech" services work in housing? Therein lies some risk. To residents these utility lines are invisible. The utility infrastructure will only be accessible to platform maintenance staff of Honeycomb Village.

Critics say we risk not providing 100% utilities sustainably. We use the 80/20 rule throughout Honeycomb Village (HV). Rain Harvesting, PV's and bio-digesting are goals, not sole ideals. Locations will have some resources available. When there's no rain in Ujjain, trucks can deliver water and plug into the central water line of HV to top-off our tanks. When the Photo-Voltaic (PV) micro-grids supply is outstripped by demand our network is connectable to a central utility or generators to re-charge our batteries. We call it being pragmatic. Save where you can, use when you must. This dovetails with our approach to form a Public-Private-Partnership with institutions to promote sustainable utilities and a manageable infrastructure. Good housing design is applied to all components of HV for maintainability, fire-resistance, safety, and accessibility.
story_txt:
Honeycomb Village, Sustainable modular houses, globally wise
bySUNLIGHT

Welcome to Honeycomb Village
We've designed housing for 1 Million people in India. You might be asking yourself "Why is
housing in technology?". Once you see our Pavilions and techniques we have developed to
build a new sustainable industry you'll understand Why and want to contribute. Honeycomb Village is
light, modular, and affordable pavilions set on a raised platform to create a
clean and healthy environment for people. This semi-permanent housing can be lifesaving, a stepping-stone for millions of people who need quality housing for a
limited time anywhere in the world. Please enjoy the video and see how
significant your contribution will be to so many people’s lives. I never knew
how important my contribution was until this summer.

photo by John Warner
This project was born a
few months ago when I was invited by the Massachusetts Institute of
Technology- Media Lab to come to India. I brought my semi-permanent
housing concept and sketches to serve millions people who attend Kumbh Mela (the
world's largest human gathering). Since the day I set foot in India, hundreds
of people from students to professionals have volunteered their time and effort
to work for change. After the first week MIT-ML asked me to extend my stay. A year may be to short to realize a project of this magnitude, so I've
committed to stay indefinitely. The opportunity to provide
affordable housing exists around the world and it include housing for:· 
Humanitarian
relief after earthquakes, tsunami, wildfires, and floods· 
Construction
workers· 
Agricultural
workers· 
Transportation
projects· 
National
Parks· 
Slum
re-development· 
Homeless
transitions.Neither governments, nor private interests have adequately met the housing challenge. So, together we are the forming a partnership to move the tipping point for people away from poverty, and we need your help!

Endorsements:
Project / Career / Academic / Personal " Mr. Knox's expertise and experience in engineering, architecture, and urban design would be valuable in contributing to this year's success in Nashik. His design and architectural experience gives Mr. Knox a systematic understanding that will facilitate his teaching, mentorship, and promote a design for temporary housing that may ultimately benefit people around the world."Dr. Ramesh Raskar- Associate Professor, Head of Camera Culture GroupMassachusetts Institute of Technology- Media Lab
I was prepared for the technical challenges. As an architect, I’ve worked on the vanguard of large-scale and high-tech projects from Airports to Semiconductor ChipFabs. I’ve traveled in North, South and Central America, Europe, and now Asia. I’ve applied principles of sustainable design and urban planning to fashion the best out of high-tech to serve people in sustainable housing. I was not prepared for the overwhelming acceptance. The support I’ve received to to seek answers to Why people need housing? is inspiring. The answers are embedded in a context where critical inquiry and experience blends with feeling, function, and form. Where better to take a stand with human dignity than here?“ There are writers I admire for their sensitivity to the place and context in which they write. Scott has a similar understanding and command of the contemporary condition within his field and the historical applications. The proposals he has authored, his research and development, and his attention to detail show a strong commitment. I would recommend few candidates to contribute to the restoration of the Parthenon (knowing the Parthenon marbles from my own research and writing), but Scott is an exception. I can think of no better candidate and no better use of today’s science and technology than in the service of such a noble cause.” Christopher Hitchens- AuthorHoneycomb Village: beautifully simpleWe’ve placed self-supported tensile
structures on a honeycomb platform. The raised floor (from ChipFab design)
integrates utilities below deck. The roofs harvest rainwater and capture sunlight
to generate electricity (via photo-voltaic). Crucial to people’s health is
indoor plumbing and sanitary conditions on-deck. Inside each Community Pavilion
is plumbing in bathrooms and kitchen. Bio-digesters (located below deck)
transform the contents of the sanitary system into cooking fuel, irrigation
water, and fertilizer. All these standardized systems are combined into a
sustainable model for both house and a village that’s scalable.
Honeycomb Village is
completely modular from set-up to dismantle from deck to roof, and no tools are
required for assembly. After each use HV can be disassembled and packed into
standard containers and shipped anywhere around the world. Sustainable,
Modular, Safe, and Healthy: a recipe for promoting people’s lives with dignity
and we’re here to prove it!
Some believe poverty
is rooted in people, whether in slums or uprooted by disaster, people tainted
by poverty will remain in chaos or homelessness. I believe there are thresholds
throughout human history. Thresholds that bar many people from making
significant changes in their lives.

One significant threshold
is the barrier many people face in their lives to reach permanent housing from
destitution or despair. From the lowest rungs this stretch is too great,
the cost too high, the treadmill of life doesn't allow them to make ends meet,
and battling unsanitary surroundings saps their health and will to do little
more than let them survive, and for all-too-many, not even that.

Honeycomb Village can provide safe, efficient, and affordable housing to people in need or displaced by circumstances. They’ll have a direct role raising pavilions in which they live and in-turn housing people around them. This constructive act may build skills, engender a sense of ownership and responsibility, and promote their contribution to society. The ultimate goal of improving surroundings is have people live investing their time, energy, and money in themselves. Self-worth may single most important stance against poverty. People who elevate themselves and clear that “threshold” of poverty in a few, smaller steps may lift society with them. A society that abandons its responsibility to promote a safe and healthy infrastructure will carry the reproductive weight of human neglect.









“As a medical professional and medical technologist I see Honeycomb Village as a balanced environment for serving people’s needs. Integrating Tele-Clinics and Educational Forums into the network of housing shows foresight that is essential to successful urban plan designed to lift people beyond their situation in life. The design of the structure is such that it is easy to maintain the necessary hygiene and sanitation in these pavilions of the Honeycomb Village, making them an ideal place for Tele-Clinic services.” 
Dr. Pankaj Parashar- MBBS, PhD Indian Institute of Technology,
Delhi/ AIIMS New Delhi

pavilions for workers and their families. Event and resort interests see

story:
• Intense security features to ensure safety of both parties (Including resume uploads, previous work experience, identity verification)
  • Free for all
  • Caters for anyone regardless of age, race, experience, skill set, and so on
  • Any skill set can be offered on the website (cleaning, babysitting, petsitting, tutoring)
  • Offered to both companies and individual freelancers 
  • Giving freelancers with a language barrier, less experience etc. the opportunity to still find the right kind of work tailored for them.

Development 

  • We have the design and development ideas and plans all ready. We need extra funds for the web customisation and additional features. 

Example of how a freelancer could use our website

  • A student is bussing home from University, her shifts just been canceled, but she still wants to make money that night so she can do things on the weekend. She logs onto her account on Work For Today, and goes into the ‘urgent’ page, where clients have posted ‘urgent’ jobs that need attention now. She spots that a family needs a babysitter for the night. She ‘bids’ for the job. Parents can interview her via the integrated video/voice call system, check her profile, her previous work experience and ratings and based on that will select her for the job.
  • This is easy for anyone... Simply: 

1) Sign up for free and verify their identity through various security measures

2) Select their demographics and previous work experience so that we can pair and match you to your appropriate employer

3) Start working by bidding on jobs that have been posted by employers/ or wait for employers to approach you!

*This is just one example out of hundreds of how a freelancer could utilise our site*

Timeline

  • December 2015/Jan 2016: Website development completed 
  • Jan 2016: Website development + content ready for soft launch
  • February 2016- November 2016: Soft launch continues during this period allowing us to analyse and adjust for different traffic and user demographics.
  • December 2016: Ready for full launch 

The rewards!


Risks & Challenges

Work For Today is almost ready. 

We have all the plans and ideas required for the first soft launch which we have been working on for 6 months now. We now need to begin the last few details of website development/ design/ content, to ensure it's up and running smoothly and correctly. 

While there are always risks with any technical project, our main concern lies within the potential delays and operation interruptions whilst using our offshore contractors 

We'll do our very best to make sure everything goes smoothly after the Kickstarter is over

However, if the postage of your rewards do get delayed for some particular reason, we'll be sure to give you plenty of notice 

We are working incredibly hard to have this service delivered and ready for the first stages of introduction by the end of 2015/ beginning of 2016.

We appreciate your support A LOT, and even if you don't back us, we are grateful of your time and consideration for our project.

story:
The central question facing the online & mobile dating industry today is:

How can online matchmaking drive more real-world dating?

Today, what users want isn’t more or better matches on the screen: What they want is an easier and faster ways to meet them in real life (IRL). Therefore, the big thing now is offline and the next business model for this rapidly growing and transforming industry is offline driven. 

The answer to both users and industry needs is BISE 

BISE marries online dating with offline dating. BISE empowers singles to meet their future mates and to discover cultural or entertainment hotspots in their cities or abroad. 

BISE is turning online dating industry sets of values and business model upside down.

BISE is a new mobile dating business model that transforms mobile dating & online dating markets by using and combining innovative technologies.

Business Outline


BISE Uniqueness 

BISE is a disruptive mobile dating service that provides singles with an easier and faster way to meet at their favourite hangout IRL, rather than locking themselves in endless virtual exchanges. 

BISE is a user-oriented service, offering the ability to more quickly connect person to person with others from the network, who are in one’s precise environment offering personal connections that would otherwise not happen: at the market, at an event, at a museum, at a restaurant, at a bar, at a nightclub or anywhere, making BISE a social entrepreneurship venture that empowers single people to meet and rate/exchange useful tips on hangouts across their city and abroad. These useful tips are enabling users to discover in a fun & ludic manner, new Points of Interest (POI) across their city or on a trip, making BISE a useful application for local tourism and economy. 

BISE innovative business model 

It is composed of 4 key components: (1) A matching service with free & paid features, (2) A mobile app that combines more accurate geolocalisation and PoIs check-in as enablers to IRL encounters at the hangout users are in, (3) BISE exclusive network build on users’ ‘trust’ with a high potential for merchandising similar to social networks such as ‘ASmallWorld’, (4) Local hangouts promotion/rating between BISE users’ growing community (1 single over 2 is using online dating services in the US) and advertising between users. 

BISE unique selling points

  • Enables users to have better, more rapid and relevant introductions IRL.
  • Enhances online connections by taking conversations offline instantly.
  • Offers more suitable connections from their immediate circles of activities that result in more opportunities to find the right partner.
  • Explores hotspots in your city & abroad. Enhances Quality of Life for Users.
  • Increases Employment (BISE, restaurant, bars & nightclubs industry, cultural & tourism industry, singles market industry).

BISE pre-commercialisation phase (6 months) & crowdfunding objectives

BISE crowdfunding objectives are to further enhance its Business Plan, develop BISE mobile app - version 1.0 and implement Funding/Marketing/Promotional Activities to commercialise BISE at the end of the pre-commersilaisation period (Month 7).

BISE - Business outlines BISE - Business outlines BISE total funding requirements estimate at 250K EUR include 

(1) Enhanced business plan (2) Commercially exploitable BISE app vers.1.0 (3) Marketing & promotional campaigns for creating a critical mass of users based community in respective markets (500k users) for a 1 year period.

BISE is developed & powered by 2 innovative SMEs 

InnoGage Limited is a dynamic and truly European International Innovation Lab & Digital Consultancy based in London, Brussels and Paris, who has a strong in-house experience in implementing innovation projects, is leading BISE concept and business development, as well as its marketing in Europe. Pivot Technology Limited has 15 years’ experience developing applications, launching mobile/web companies and building start-ups from scratch across many verticals including consumer, retail and ecommerce. Pivot is also heavily experienced in building marketing and public relations brand awareness campaigns both online and offline. Pivot is leading BISE technical development & contributes to the detailed business plan in terms of baseline & specifications, business model development, marketing activities & commercialisation plan for North America (US & Canada).

Risks & Challenges 

BISE is developed & powered by 2 innovative SMEs: InnoGage and Pivot, with a valuable experience in open innovation and digital marketing/communication in various complementary domains (i.e. eGovernment, eParticipation, stakeholders’ engagement, social media, smart cities, mobile and telecommunication industry) of the Information and Communication society (ICT), making BISE a social entrepreneurship project by empowering people to meet and rate/exchange useful tips on hangouts across a city.

InnoGage and Pivot teams are multi-disciplinary and well balanced between men and women to offer a multi-gender vision to BISE.

InnoGage & Pivot central objective is: to use their relevant expertise, experience and know-how in open innovation, mobile applications, social media, stakeholders’ engagement and in the markets of Europe and North America (targeted BISE markets) to develop, market and commercialise BISE in European and North American cities.

BISE solution: BISE is a new mobile dating business model that transforms mobile and online dating markets by using and combining innovative technologies like more accurate geolocalisation and PoIs check-in as enablers to real-life encounters at the hangout users are in.

BISE current stage of development: InnoGage & Pivot joined forces during Quarter 1 2015 to develop, market and commercialise BISE in Europe & North America. 

This partnership offers 2 essential key success factors: Innovation & Technical expertise, BISE markets knowledge & foothold.

BISE key milestones until now: 

MS0.1 (Quarter 1-2015): Business idea & Business models. 

MS0.2 (Quarter 2-3-2015): BISE technical specifications, costs and timeframe (145 days development time).

MS0.3 (Quarter 2-3-2015): Field interviews with potential users (men, women) at different PoIs in Europe (i.e. pubs, afterworks, social events, friends get-togethers). Refinement of Business concept & technical features.

MS0.4 (Quarter 2-2015): Setting-up BISE team with complementary skills & know-how, with a gender balance to develop a product and service that will fit both genders needs & wants. Design of a temporary logo.

MS0.5 (Quarter 3-2015):  Seeking funding sources (public & private) as well as investors coaching.

BISE partnership is composed of 2 innovative SMEs, InnoGage and Pivot that are complementary with clearly defined roles in the set-up, development, implementation and commercialization of BISE. 

The Envisioned BISE Solution: Since the current online dating services can no longer keep up with the fast evolving needs of the users, BISE offers a highly south after mobile dating application, which bring additional benefits for the users and economical and cultural stakeholders compared to existing application by providing: (1) a customized pool of choice for the users by narrowing down the category of matchers according to the user’s preferences, i.e. by PoI such as restaurants, museums, market, festivals, bars, nightclub, etc.; (2) specific features for the users such as (a) profile differentiation: the option to upload 5 pictures instead of only one; (b) incorporating features form Facebook and other social networks; (c) match agenda keeper: splash screen when there is a match, plus “Make your move” or “Later” options to keep track of your matching steps; (d) new discovery settings: gender (M, F, other – additional feature for transsexuals); age range from 18; manual/auto check in; search the most popular PoIs following ratings from users; (e) visible at all times or hidden; (f) anonymous registration option; (g) Like justification feature, etc. (2) advertising opportunities for commerce & cultural sectors (banks, telecom companies, stores, retailers, shopping centres, pubs, restaurants, nightclubs, museums, etc.).

BISE overall plan to reach market: BISE pre-commercialisation phase (6 months), will enable BISE team to further enhance its overall plan to reach market with (1) an detailed business plan (2) develop BISE mobile app – version 1 (3) Set-up its key funding/marketing/promotional activities to ensure its foreseen 1st year marketing and promotional launch in its targeted markets (target 20% of overall markets) (4) build its critical mass users based community to ensure success.

IPR Management & Regulatory Issues: InnoGage owns the IPR. No patent protection is being sought at this time as the technology behind the combined unique product features along with the organic market build out will put the product at least 6 months ahead of competition. However, patent protection would be sought once we saw potential for competition. Regulatory concerns involve Privacy Rules within Europe. The InnoGage –Pivot collaboration will manage according to all Privacy rules and regulations, for example Article 8, of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) which provides a right to respect for one's "private and family life, his home and his correspondence", subject to certain restrictions . Users of the technology are paid participants free to post their own information on the site and no data will be shared without their consent, given by signing up for the site service and in choosing their applicable add-on features and functionality. For our users’ protection, we will in all cases, notify users of the features impact on their privacy and they would agree at purchase.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • To get the word out and make some noise about BISE campaign.
  • To use the Indiegogo share tools to share BISE campaign amongst your friends & Contacts!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
The central question facing the online & mobile dating industry today is:How can online matchmaking drive more real-world dating?Today, what users want isn’t more or better matches on the screen: What they want is an easier and faster ways to meet them in real life (IRL). Therefore, the big thing now is offline and the next business model for this rapidly growing and transforming industry is offline driven. 
The answer to both users and industry needs is BISE 
BISE marries online dating with offline dating. BISE empowers singles to meet their future mates and to discover cultural or entertainment hotspots in their cities or abroad. BISE is turning online dating industry sets of values and business model upside down.BISE is a new mobile dating business model that transforms mobile dating & online dating markets by using and combining innovative technologies.Business OutlineBISE Uniqueness BISE is a disruptive mobile dating service that provides singles with an easier and faster way to meet at their favourite hangout IRL, rather than locking themselves in endless virtual exchanges. BISE is a user-oriented service, offering the ability to more quickly connect person to person with others from the network, who are in one’s precise environment offering personal connections that would otherwise not happen: at the market, at an event, at a museum, at a restaurant, at a bar, at a nightclub or anywhere, making BISE a social entrepreneurship venture that empowers single people to meet and rate/exchange useful tips on hangouts across their city and abroad. These useful tips are enabling users to discover in a fun & ludic manner, new Points of Interest (POI) across their city or on a trip, making BISE a useful application for local tourism and economy. BISE innovative business model It is composed of 4 key components: (1) A matching service with free & paid features, (2) A mobile app that combines more accurate geolocalisation and PoIs check-in as enablers to IRL encounters at the hangout users are in, (3) BISE exclusive network build on users’ ‘trust’ with a high potential for merchandising similar to social networks such as ‘ASmallWorld’, (4) Local hangouts promotion/rating between BISE users’ growing community (1 single over 2 is using online dating services in the US) and advertising between users. BISE unique selling points
Enables users to have better, more rapid and relevant introductions IRL.
Enhances online connections by taking conversations offline instantly.
Offers more suitable connections from their immediate circles of activities that result in more opportunities to find the right partner.
Explores hotspots in your city & abroad. Enhances Quality of Life for Users.
Increases Employment (BISE, restaurant, bars & nightclubs industry, cultural & tourism industry, singles market industry).

story:
The Stats

  • 70% of children who abuse prescription drugs admit to getting them from family or friends*
  • Over 3 million U.S. teens abuse prescription drugs*
  • Every day, 3,300 more children begin experimenting with prescription drugs**

The Story

My name is Frank Salvato, the creator of the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System, and am a former commissioned firefighter and certified paramedic. When I rode the ambulance, nothing bothered me more than going on a call involving a child, teenager or elderly patient where an accidental overdose of prescription medication was involved. These tragedies – and they take place across the United States and, indeed the world, every day – are senseless and avoidable. They take lives and destroy families. Hence the idea for a deterrent system that can easily and affordably be integrated into existing in-home medicine cabinets.

It is my hope that the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System will – when brought to market – help to prevent, and therefore greatly reduce, the number of potentially tragic results we hear about every day due to unwanted access to prescription medications in the home. Your funding will allow us to bring the gifts of security and peace of mind to families of both the new and the old. Please make your generous funding today towards our goal of $50,000. In addition, I respectfully ask that you pass the cause’s link on to everyone you know. Together we can make a difference.

The Competition

The closest competition offers full-box units that are not designed to secure - and/or often times even fit - into your existing medicine cabinets. Many are offered as stand-alone boxes that can literally be taken from the home by those determined to access the prescription medications held within.

Additionally, with prices ranging from $100 to $229, the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System's proposed retail price of $29.95 (plus shipping and handling when applicable) is at least four times less than the closest competition, even as it exists custom designed to your specifications. This affordability allows those with modest budgets to attain the peace of mind that the affluent have only been able to afford...until now.

The Product

ScripSentinel®, LLC will manufacture (initially), market and sell the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System; a customized locking shelf component that integrates into existing medicine cabinets for the purpose of establishing a basic security/privacy deterrent barrier for medication and other personal products.

(Image shows Proof of Concept Performance Model)
The ScripSentinel® Deterrent System is designed as a customizable basic security/privacy barrier assembled from items produced of third-party vendors, delivered to the customer as a kit (see pic below) which will contain the following items: a high-quality, durable material (polycarbonate, nylon, glass and/or wood) custom created door; pre-manufactured polycarbonate micro-hinges; a pre-manufactured combination lock; adhesive strips to anchor to existing cabinet shelves; system hinges; simple directions for installation (.


Funding Requirements and Use

I am requesting funding in the amount of $50,000 USD which will provide product-to-market development and beginning revenue generation from initial sales. The initial goal is to generate sales that would garner interest in Series "A" funding for scaling to mass market production and distribution using contracted third-party manufacturers and proven mass-market distribution networks, respectively.

Preliminary Cost Considerations

Preliminary cost considerations for start-up of the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System initiative would include raw materials, storage, assembly & packaging and initial printing for instructions and advertising and marketing materials.

  • Design Production & Raw Materials

Research would be executed on the costs and producers of raw materials needed for production including door material, adhesive, aluminum piece acquisition and locking mechanisms.

  • Storage

Initially, a modest self-storage unit would be utilized for all of the storage needs, as well as to serve as an embarkation point for the drop shipping of larger orders. This facility would also serve as a pick-up point for product to be personally delivered by any sales staff.

  • Assembly & Packaging

Initially, ScripSentinel® staff would be used to assemble orders, graduating to the employment of a part-time, minimum-wage workforce based on the availability of working capital gleaned from profits. Eventually, a shrink wrapping machine would be leased or purchased, based on the best of cost-to-profit scenario and the product, along with the printed insert and installation instructions would be shrink-wrapped into the final product package units.

  • Printing, Marketing and Advertising

Print design for the product packaging (including installation instructions, disclaimer information, etc.) would be done in-house. Additional expenditures for marketing and advertising execution.


The Benefits and Impact

The ScripSentinel® Deterrent System

▪ Secures harmful medications from young children
▪ Deters teenage prescription drug experimentation
▪ Aids in preventing accidental overdoses in in-home care of seniors 
▪ Provides privacy from curious eyes

  • Young Children


When installed in a house that has young children, the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System provides an affordable, protective deterrent barrier that prevents children from accessing medication – both prescription and over the counter (OTC) – and/or other substances and objects unsuitable for younger children.

We have all heard of the tragic cases where a young child has been severely compromised by the accidental ingestion of prescription or OTC medications. In many cases, children have died from what is an innocent curiosity. Inquisitive by nature, the child stumbles across prescription or OTC medications thought to be out of reach in the family medicine cabinet. A child ingests colorful pieces of "candy," actually prescription or OTC medications, subjecting that child to a potentially life-threatening event.

With the installation and employment of the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System, parents can easily and safely sequester potentially dangerous prescription and/or OTC medications in a locked internal compartment, concealed inside their existing family medicine cabinet, thus substantially reducing the potential for a life-threatening event while offering peace of mind at an affordable price.

When compared to the emotional and physical trauma of a life-threatening event caused by accidental ingestion of prescription or OTC medications by a child, not to mention the cost of hospitalization, rehabilitation and the increase in health insurance rates, the investment in a ScripSentinel® Deterrent System is a preferable and affordable alternative and a smart practice in prevention.

  • Teenage Drug Experimentation

Sad, but true, the recreational use of prescription medication by teenagers is a reality. Most of the prescription drugs acquired by teenagers for this use are attained through access to unsecured prescription medications in the home.

By installing the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System, parents can easily and securely sequester prescription medications in a locked internal compartment concealed inside their existing family medicine cabinet, deterring teenage prescription drug experimentation and eliminating undetected access to prescription drugs to all but the intended patient, thus eliminating the potential for a life-threatening event due to the temptation that unfettered accessibility affords.

When compared to the emotional and physical trauma of a life-threatening event caused by the recreational use of prescription medication by teenagers, not to mention the cost of hospitalization, addiction rehabilitation and the increase in health insurance rates, the investment in a ScripSentinel® Deterrent System is a preferable and affordable alternative and, again, a smart practice in prevention.

  • In-Home Care of Seniors

With the cost of managed care facilities rising and life expectancy increasing, many families are faced with the prospect of caring for their aging loved ones in their homes. Although great strides have been made in the treatment of Alzheimer's and other related senior memory disorders, these maladies continue to attack our senior family members making day-to-day tasks, such as taking scheduled prescription medication, and exercise in drug therapy micro-management.

With the installation and employment of the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System, adult children caring for their senior parents can easily and securely sequester prescription medications in a locked internal compartment concealed inside their existing family medicine cabinet, eliminating erroneous access to prescription drugs by seniors afflicted with memory disorders, thus significantly reducing the potential for a life-threatening over-medication due to the inability to self-monitor dosage schedules.

When compared to the emotional and physical trauma of a life-threatening event caused by the over-medication of a memory-challenged senior, not to mention the cost of hospitalization, rehabilitation and the premature loss of loved ones, the investment in a ScripSentinel® Deterrent System is a preferable and affordable alternative and, again, an intelligent practice in prevention.

  • Privacy

Everyone knows someone like "Mrs. Kravitz," the beloved nosy-neighbor character from the 1970's program Bewitched. This is the character that enjoys snooping into a neighbor's private dominion. If you are of the social set, you have heard jokes and real-life accounts of people who snoop through the medicine cabinets of party hosts, often with embarrassing results.

With the installation and employment of the ScripSentinel® Deterrent System, nosy neighbors and medicine cabinet snoopers will be denied the opportunity to discover what prescription or OTC medications you take or what personal products you use.


Risks & Challenges

Risk: An action that could result in a positive or negative outcome or no outcome if no action has been taken.

Challenge: I challenge you to take the risk in participating, on YOUR terms, in an initiative that can truly be of help to people and the greater good of society as a whole. 

"I have been first-hand witness, to the emotional and physical damage to individuals and families due to accidental prescription medication ingestion and overdose, sometimes with devastating circumstances. Something had to be created to aid families in the prevention of such tragedies."

~ Frank Salvato, Creator ScripSentinel®

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share the ScripSentinel® website with everyone you know (www.ScripSentinel.com)

And that's all there is to it.

*Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration; 2006 & 2007 National Survey on Drug Use and Health: National Findings.
**Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration; 2007a. A Day in the Life of American Adolescents: Substance Use Facts.

 Deterrent System, nosy neighbors and medicine cabinet snoopers will be 
denied the opportunity to discover what prescription or OTC medications 
you take or what personal products you use.
   
Risks & Challenges  Risk: An action that could result in a positive or negative outcome or no outcome if no action has been taken.
Challenge: I challenge you to take the risk in participating, on YOUR terms, in an initiative that can truly be of help to people and the greater good of society as a whole. 
"I have been first-hand witness, to the emotional and physical damage to individuals and families due to accidental prescription medication ingestion and overdose, sometimes with devastating circumstances. Something had to be created to aid families in the prevention of such tragedies."
~ Frank Salvato, Creator ScripSentinel®

Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Share the ScripSentinel® website with everyone you know (www.ScripSentinel.com)   And that's all there is to it.*Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration; 2006 & 2007 National Survey on Drug Use and Health: National Findings.**Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration; 2007a. A Day in the Life of American Adolescents: Substance Use Facts.

story:
OVERALL SUMMARY:

I am an experienced IT professional (with MEng & PhD from UK) based in London for the past 18 yrs. I noticed that people ordering take away from restaurants for their parties at home are often dis-satisfied with the quality, quantity and the price. Therefore, I want to launch a webportal for this specific need/gap in the market by involving and empowering women having passion for cooking. Initially, as a pilot, in London area (within M25) only for this purpose.

The plan is to register interested ladies/homemakers who are passionate about cooking and want to take it up as their personal business as per their choice and available time on a fleximode. The diversity of this group will have expertise on different types of cuisine like Chinese, Continental, Indian etc. The otherside of the webportal will have the members or visitors wanting to order freshly cooked home made economical food. The value proposition is the price, quality, quantity and healthy yet tasty bites for small gatherings/parties or even daily consumption at home. People ordering food may need to arrange for their deliveries initially (pilot), till a proper delivery logistics partner is sorted out in the third version, as the portal will have another line of self-employment creation channel of engaging with logistics partners (something similar to UBER), in the same way. Thats why the portal will take the details of post-code for the order and try to find the nearest cook(s)/delivery driver(s) for the demand and match it up.


IMPACT & CONTRIBUTION TO THE SOCIETY AT LARGE:

It is important to me as I want to create another kind of self-employment and particularly to empower women who are homemakers and having the inclination to get into self employment & financial independence. I know there is a lot of captive potential available in this market which can be easily on-boarded onto this platform. The first step towards launching this platform is to create an easy to use webportal taking into account all the relevant details and there after take the order and fulfillment thru a process based approach. Something similar to what ebay does, except that it does not take postcode details and matches up with the distance for delivery. Here its important as the orderer will have to take the delivery himself/herself from the seller, initially. The system also need to carry out some background checks (DBS checks & food hygiene certifications) in order to protect interests of both customers and sellers. Also, it will have an interface with some payment gateway for financial transactions. Hence the webportal will be technical, safe, sophisticated and feature packed.


WHY INVESTMENTS ARE NEEDED:

This may need a good investment to design & develop such a portal. Besdies this, the pilot launch will need good digital marketing campaigns on SEO, Social Networking sites and other digital media platforms, coupled with local newsletters advertisements. The entire thing will take some time to take off and get fully operational. Later, networking, word-of-mouth, sponsorships within local community festivals etc will also promote the usage of the webportal. We have a lot of friends and family circle based in different areas within M25 region of London and hence the first level of advertising etc will not be very difficult to get to the start. I am aware of people doing this kind of business on their own but it is currently being done within a limited circle and not open to the masses. On this platform anyone willing to provide such a service will have options to register, list menu, prices, special offers, and quote a price, based on the order menu and delivery date/time. The target customers will be not only party consumers but can also be those people who are sick & tired of eating out everyday (students in universities, singles living alone with a busy job, busy couples & families not able to afford eating out regularly, health conscious people and old age people not able to go out or afford restaurant food etc).


QUANTUM OF FUNDING & LIKELY SPEND AREAS: 

The initial spend will be in development of the webportal, which is going to be the main business platform. This may need approx. 3 months time with a spend of £30-40K. This webportal will however go thru atleast 3 versions before it becomes fully stable. The pilot testing period will be atleast for 3 months for detecting issues and challenges faced and then addressing them. The other portion of funding will be used for hiring atleast 2-3 nos of technical admin people to run and manage the system. The initial few months will be critical as we plan to have tel based support as well. The entire development of the platform is going to be outsourced but under my close supervision on the design and functional features that are essential. At the moment the ballpark estimate to launch this operation is close to £80,000, for the first year. The plan is to make the investors as equity holders (with a min qualifying figure of £10K, to an equity range between 1% - 7.5%) in the business based on the size of investment they make. But its limited to only first 25 nos. Other investers will be on a reward mode (cash or perk) based on the yearly profit. The scheme is yet to be designed and developed. As the webportal membership/registration will be free, the main source of revenue will be from the percentage share of the charged amount of the orders fulfiled. Majority part of the payment from customers will go to the cooks/sellers. The other revenue will be from any advertisements, banners, corporate or SME support provided to the cause of this webportal. I have already so many interested parties (both corporate as well as individuals) keen in supporting this noble cause with a yearly financial contribution ranging from £2K to £10K. This business may take atleast 2-3 years to achieve recognition/popularity & realize full business potential. Eventually I plan to make it a Global Portal connecting all the interested parties into one space. The first step towards this will be to launch it within M25 area of London, then to go to other metros of the UK and thereafter Pilot test another European region or North America followed by Canada & Australia. If this plan does not succeed the funds invested may be sunk, as my own funds are also going to be involved. However, the objective will be to see that all the investors get ATLEAST their principal amount of investment returned in the first 2 years. This idea is creative as it will build self employment of women at home without disrupting their daily lives, with minimum hassles and yet do things that they enjoy. Also, that some of these which are done only by the women who are well connected in their circles will also be practiced by those who may not have a large social circle and less connected.


RISKS & LIKELY CHALLENGES:

One of the major challenges is to design and develop such a comprehensive platform/webportal packed with all the features for capturing all the necessary data points and then fulfilling the order. The end2end process needs to be perfect. This may need good quality architecting, design, development, payment gateway and other technical aspects. Besides this the challenge will be to quickly launch it and make it visible on the web and attract relevant visitors. I have the necessary knowledge and background in IT to address this, but still the risk & challenge will prevail. The down side is the time extension. Evenif most of the challenges are met, the time taken to address these challenges may be longer than anticipated. But, surely, I am confident to make this a success in a fairly moderate time-frame. The management leaders like Late Prof. CK Prahlad - one of the most beloved teachers at the University of Michigan, said that things that can be made for the masses or  targetted towards the grassroot population are the ones destined to succeed. This plan is also having such a noble objective and I genuinely feel it has a good potential to succeed. In order to reflect the economical part of the offering, I also have plans to show the like2like "price comparison"..... if the same menu and quantity was ordered from a set of nearby restaurant(s) coupled with the feedback ratings of the food suppliers. This feature will develop the trust factor and client satisfaction rate will be lot higher. However, this plan can only be deployed after the base platform is built.


GOAL & DREAM:

The dream is to develop a worldwide network of economical & healthy MICRO-MEAL services, by empowering & engaging women.

story:
I would love to see how beautiful this world would become with more awakened people. Children are physically and verbally abused and bullied daily by people they love and trust the most to protect them, closest people to them, even their parents.  I have seen so many children go about without shoes or flip flops, I have seen thousands go without food, I have seen and hear stories of so many children with physical injuries from the beatings of parents, elders and older siblings, but I hope this season and getting into the new year, they would find some happiness with the gifts that you will send them.  We will build homes for children to heal from childhood trauma and fear caused by so called loved ones and the society in general. We will also provide help for people who are ready to get counseling on how to stop abusing their children because they too were abused and bullied by their elders and parents 

My books; the wisdom calls series are available as perks for you donations. God bless you and give you more than you could ever imagine. Beyond your wildest dreams. Happy holidays. Thank you.

story:
We LOVE East London

and we know East Londoners do too.

We love East London SO MUCH that when the global media all disappeared from Stratford in 2012, we felt people from the area needed a voice, something better than all the negative impressions so often heard in the media.

So we built an online radio station. Run by volunteers. Talk and Music. Genuinely different.

And your response was absolutely AMAZING.

Hundreds have come to our local studios to learn and make Radio.

Thousands have listened and supported through Social Media following.

THANK YOU - we're glad you agreed that East London needs a radio station which is for everyone, and gives everyone a voice.

Coming up next on ELR....

With your support, our Community Interest Company has achieved a lot, but we want to take it to the next level.

Every day we get a new volunteer enquiry, and we hate that we can't cope with the demand, and there's a long waiting list of people wanting to be part of ELR.

We want to make sure we can meet our running costs as we offer more studio time in more boroughs of East London, and employ someone part-time to run these spaces , supporting and training more volunteers.

Please help us get to the next level with whatever you can afford, and check out the perks we can offer you in return.

And please share this pages link on your social media. East Londoners are known for their kindness and support of each other in our wonderfully diverse and welcoming community.

Let's continue doing something really special which is BY EAST LONDON and FOR EAST LONDON.

Thank you!


Boring but important bit about taxation - all perks are deemed to be business gifts from ELR CIC to you

story:
EHC Group joins the fight against IS

The Peshmergahs, the Yezidis, the Iraqi Christian Resistance, as well as some institutional actors, oppose a fierce fight to the terrorist organization Islamic State (IS), with some means that are sometimes undersized, an identified lack of training and international relays that are often impaired.

In order to face the advance of the IS, EHC GROUP LLC, a French speaking ESSD (Security and Defense services company, in French “Entreprise de Services de Sécurité et de Défense”), created in 1999 and registered in the United States since 2004, has decided to bring its support and its contribution to the fight against this plague.

With over fifteen years of experience in the areas of military training, operational support, strategic, technical or logistical assistance and security-safety services, EHC Group wishes to provide assistance to the minorities that are fighting Islamic State’s troops.

It will initially be about to provide technical, logistical, administrative and medical support to the different resistance movements. To do so we will seek, create and maintain a local and international network which will enable us to provide to these resistance movements some personnel who would train the volunteers after having identified their weakest skills. They will also be able to support the implementation of medical premises, to provide an administrative support as well as managing and securing some refugees camps.

Furthermore, EHC Group proposes, upstream as well as downstream, to unify and structure the various individual or collective initiatives departure of the international volunteers. Upstream, EHC Group will not only identify the best candidate able to provide the requested support but will also be in charge of the security checks (mainly by checking the reliability of the CVs and the mentioned qualifications). Downstream, EHC Group will monitor the administrative procedures (especially the preparation of candidates’ files) and will focus on leverage our local networks to secure the various stages of the volunteers’ journey.

To run this project EHC Group will partner with a British consulting firm: ATHENA DEFENCE Ltd. The synergy of these two entities will enable the provision of a personal pool of French and English speaking people, highly trained, deployable at very short-notice and able to deliver on the ground a high quality assistance, running from a few days to several weeks.

Furthermore, aware of the obvious lack of communication in and from the combat zones, EHC Group wishes to set up a monitoring unit that will manage in real-time an international communication channel accessible worldwide.

In order to finance the first step of this project EHC GROUP LLC and ATHENA DEFENCE Ltd are therefore launching a private fundraising.

story:
The bakery that I moved to indiana to work for is doing great, and the opportunity has been given to me to buy it and make it my own. I am beyond thrilled and I know that with my hard work and drive and your support I can makr it amazing! This has been my dream for a long time and it means so much to me. Many of you have had cakes or other desserts from me and your business and support means so much. I promise that I will rock the bakery world and I will also have a very special private tasting/grand opening for all my supporters!

This is something not only for me but for my kids as well. To teach them, help them grow and leave something for them as well!

I have a great team at the bakery now and we will continue to grow. With hard work, great product and excellent service we will strive to be the best indy bakery!
