story:
Youth Hostel Pinesta is a young, vibrant, funky, slightly crazy but extra homey hostel we're working on.



What We're All About

Two months ago, Andreea & Sara came to Croatia to open a hostel. Lack of funds inspired us to build it out of old materials, unwanted furniture and with our own handiwork.

We are building on local resources and the concept of upcycling & do-it-yourself to create a beautiful temporary respite for travelers, a home lost in time and space. Imagine: hammocks to rest in under the sky full of stars, a common room in a tree house, pine cones and paper birds hanging from the walls, old tyre swings and candles in acorn jars.

All that's missing is a community, some love and a proper renovation.


(Current dorm rooms.)

The Why's and How's

Pinesta is an old tourist resort for children and youth, built more than fifty years ago - at the height of socialist Yugoslavia. Although registered as a youth hostel for many years, the world's ideas of a hostel have left Pinesta behind.

We want to bring it back to the present. Situated in a pine forest with almost four hundred meters of beach, the site is perfect. But with old communist-style buildings, dilapidated furniture and no money for maintenance, we need a little bit of help from the outside.


(The property lies in a beautiful pine forest on the beach.)

The owner of the place has already signed a deal with us. It's already registered as a hostel. The next stage is to renovate it and thus our crowdfunding campaign.

What You Get

We have two types of rewards: handcrafted gifts for you or your loved ones OR various packages to visit our hostel.


Handcrafted gifts are inspired by our place and work: dreamcatchers made of pine needles and cones, old bike tyres and sea shells that Andreea will make especially for you. Or move over to Sara's specialty, origami birds on a string made from colourful leftover paper and beer bottle caps.


What We Get

The funds raised from our campaign will go to:

  • installation of a common kitchen in the hostel ($3000)
  • renovation of the bathrooms ($4000)
  • heating and cooling systems in the hostel ($2000)
  • outdoor terrace ($1000)
  • equipment and extras: hammocks, duvets, second hand books and music instruments, furniture paints, faster internet connection (any surplus)

Our aims

While working in Reykjavik, we were inspired by how Icelandic hostels were more than just a place to sleep; that was where people went to socialize, read, work, sing, and dance. We dream of creating a hostel with its own social life and a tight-knit connection with the local community. When we first moved to town, they laughed at us when we asked where the young people gather. We want to change that.

Recycling and the ecological footprint is all the world talks about these days. However, less than a year ago a local Croatian was explaining to us about what he described as 'this brand new science called ecology'. We want to enhance the awareness in Croatia about reusing materials, waste management and self-sustainable living.

Lastly, we want to contribute to the dynamics of local tourism by offering a space to backpackers, hitch-hikers and nomads – all year long.


How To Contribute

Our biggest problem is the lack of funds. But if you want to help in other ways, it would mean a lot to us if you shared this project among your friends. We always need volunteers; you're welcome to come here yourself, grab a hammer and get your hands dirty.

We also love gifts; if you have something you think we could use, why not send it to us via post or bring it yourself? As long as it's not pine needles, we can use almost anything - paper birds, old posters, casette players, tyres, rope, paint, books, herb & flower seeds (or plants!), cups, your soul.

What We're All About Two months ago, Andreea & Sara came to Croatia to open a hostel. Lack of funds inspired us to build it out of old materials, unwanted furniture and with our own handiwork. 

We are building on local
resources and the concept of upcycling & do-it-yourself to create a beautiful temporary respite for travelers, a home lost in time and space. Imagine: hammocks to rest in under the sky full of stars, a common room in a tree house, pine cones and paper birds hanging from the walls, old tyre swings and candles in acorn jars.
All that's missing is a community, some love and a proper renovation.

(Current dorm rooms.)The Why's and How's
 
Pinesta is an old tourist resort for children and youth, built more than fifty years ago - at the height of socialist Yugoslavia. Although registered as a youth hostel for many years, the world's ideas of a hostel have left Pinesta behind.
We want to bring it back to the present. Situated in a pine forest with almost four hundred meters of beach, the site is perfect. But with old communist-style buildings, dilapidated furniture and no money for maintenance, we need a little bit of help from the outside.

(The property lies in a beautiful pine forest on the beach.)

The owner of the place has already signed a deal with us. It's already registered as a hostel. The next stage is to renovate it and thus our crowdfunding campaign. 

What You Get
We have two types of rewards: handcrafted gifts for you or your loved ones OR various packages to visit our hostel.
 

 
Handcrafted gifts are inspired by our place and work: dreamcatchers made of pine needles and cones, old bike tyres and sea shells that Andreea will make especially for you. Or move over to Sara's specialty, origami birds on a string made from colourful leftover paper and beer bottle caps.
   

What We Get

The funds raised from our campaign will go to:

installation of a common kitchen in the hostel ($3000)
renovation of the bathrooms ($4000)

heating and cooling systems in the hostel ($2000)
outdoor terrace ($1000)

equipment and extras: hammocks, duvets, second hand books and music instruments, furniture paints, faster internet connection (any surplus)



 Our aims
While working in Reykjavik,
we were inspired by how Icelandic hostels were more than just a place to sleep;
that was where people went to socialize, read, work, sing, and dance. We dream
of creating a hostel with its own social life and a tight-knit
connection with the local community. When we first moved to town, they
laughed at us when we asked where the young people gather. We want to
change that.
Recycling and the ecological footprint is all the world talks about these days. However, less than a year ago a local Croatian was explaining to us about what he described as 'this brand new science called ecology'. We want to enhance the awareness in Croatia about reusing materials, waste management and self-sustainable living.  
Lastly, we want to
contribute to the dynamics of local tourism by offering a space to
backpackers, hitch-hikers and nomads – all year long. 




How To Contribute
 
Our biggest problem is the lack of funds.
But if you want to help in other ways, it would mean a lot to us if you shared
this project among your friends. We always need volunteers; you're
welcome to come here yourself, grab a hammer and get your hands dirty. 
We also love gifts;
if you have something you think we could use, why not send it to us via post
or bring it yourself? As long as it's not pine needles, we can use almost
anything - paper birds, old posters, casette players, tyres, rope, paint,
books, herb & flower seeds (or plants!), cups, your soul.

story:
LETTER AGREEMENT

( Contract of Limited partnership )

This letter of agreement, also known as a contract of limited partnership, is an agreement between the crowdfunder investor and American Family Registry Service (American Family Registry Service  also herein known as AFRS).

This agreement grants the Investor a limited partnership with American Family Registry Service (1) based on the amount of investment and based (2) based on the amount of total investors and (3) based on a time period set by American Family Registry Service of 1 year.  The 1 year time period starts on the day of the public launch of the APP – APP#3.  1 year constitutes or equals 365 days.

All funds raised in this crowdfunding campaign will go towards the development of a particular APP that at this time we will call APP#3.  Currently, details of APP #3 are proprietary as there is currently no other APP on the market like APP#3.

APP#3 is unique in that there is no other app currently on the app markets like it.  This APP will be downloaded for a standard fee and certain use of the app will cost a fee for that particular aspect use of the app.  So in theory, the app will raise revenue in three (3) ways (1) download revenue and (2) certain use revenue and (3) the certain additional use aspect of the APP can produce revenue in of itself so ultimately there will be three ways the APP will generate revenue.

The term limited partner between the investor (s) and American Family Registry Service only refers to a partnership in the sharing of the profits for a set amount and a set time period as stated above.  Limited Partnership in this case by contract does not constitute any other vested interest in the business.  A Limited Partner will not possess management or supervisory authority in any aspect of American Family Registry Service.  Investors in this campaign will only have the ability to profit from the APP which will be developed from this campaign ( aka APP#3 ) for the purpose of this contract.

If there are multiple investors the profits shared between American Family Registry Service and the Investors will be based on (1) the amount invested and the amount of profits gained by the sales revenue of the American Family Registry Service app for a set time period as stated above.

ONLY INVESTMENTS IN THE RANGE OF $1000- TO $50000- WILL BE ABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE POSSIBLE PROFIT SHARE PROGRAM.  ALL LOWER CONTRIBUTION ARE CONSIDERED ANGEL FUNDS WITH NO RETURN AND –AFRS- GREATLY APPRECIATES ANY AND ALL CONTRIBUTIONS.  THANK YOU.

IF- there is only one investor, and AFRS Profits permit, and profits exceed the investors investment that single investor will, if applicable, receive up to but not more than triple their investment ( investment X 3 ) profits permitting.

Example – If 1 person invests $20,000- dollars and after 365 days has passed from the date of public launch of the app and AFRS receives $160,000- gross profit but after expenses.  The single investor will receive the total cost of the investment of $20,000-  plus a portioned share  of profits of $40,000-.  Therefore the total return to the investor would be $60,000-.

If -2 or 3 or more – investors – contributed investment amounts, their share(s) of profits at the end of one year(365 days) will be determined (a) based on the amount they invested and up to but not more than two times their initial investment.

Example – If Investor#1 invests $5000- and Investor#2 invests $10,000- and Investor #3 invests $15,000- and after the determined 1 year (365 days ) has expired and AFRS receives $160,000- ( after expenses ) Investor#1 would receive their initial $5000- investment plus $5000-  in profits.  Investor#2 would receive their initial investment of $10,000- plus $10,000- in profits.  Investor#3 would receive their initial investment of $15,000- plus $15,000- in profits.

Example – If the total AFRS gross profits ( after expenses ) is $160,000- And total investments equals $100,000- the investors will receive their investments of $100,000- and the remaining $60,000- will be divided proportionally between the investors based on the amount of their investment.  The larger the investment the larger proportional profit the investor will receive. – Example – If 3 investors invest $5000- each and 1 investor invests $85,000- and total Profits is $160,000- the investors investing $5000- each will receive their $5000- each plus $3000- each in profits and the single investor who invested $85,000- will receive their $85,000- investment plus $51,000- in profits.

The funds of this campaign will go into the development of our APP creation ( APP#3) and towards initial marketing of the APP.  The funds will not be used for other company expenses such as income or travel expenses or entertainment expenses.

Once the application has been created, perfected and published from the time of going public with the APP or from the time the APP is put on the market the CLOCK STARTS TICKING.  The moment the clock starts ticking as per the agreement of this contract and 365 days has passed after the start of the proverbial clock, PROFITS from the APP sales and receipts will be calculated.

AFRS does not imply or state that they will receive any profits from sales or revenue from APP#3 at all after the aforementioned 365 day period.  AFRS does not know of any APP on the market equal to their app creation so it is very difficult to state what sort of profits can be made from the APP.  It is AFRS’s full intentions and hopes that this app (APP#3) development and sales and revenues will generate profits.  The purpose and function of this app is created to generate revenue through its use after the initial sales download of the APP.  AFRS sole reason and hope for the production and development and launch of this particular APP (APP#3) is to generate a profit.

story:
The M7 Con is California's Premiere Old West Convention. In the past we have focused solely on bringing actors in from The Magnificent Seven.

While this convention will always honor The Magnificent Seven, this year we have expanded to include actors from film and TV show westerns as well. We are hoping to book actors from Deadwood, Young Riders, Yellow Rock, and the recently FAN saved Longmire.

 All donations help us pay for expenses for our convention


What expenses do we have??

First and foremost the funds will go to cover the costs of the rental of the rooms at the Los Angeles Convention Center.

Secondly, And this is a BIG one. We need funds to secure actors.
And lastly we do cover some costs for panelists (mostly parking at the LACC)

 Not a single penny raised will go towards any of the staff. We do this for fun, we are all volunteers.

Any money left and any profits made from our convention at the end of the event is paid forward to various charities.  This year we have chosen to support the  John Wayne Cancer Institute and the Good Shepherd Shelter of Los Angeles

           




 

Here is a basic example of the poster that is included in the top perk tiers. I stress it is a basic example. The finished product will contain the names of the attending actors.



THIS IS AN EXAMPLE OF THE PHOTO COLLAGE (I couldn't use photos of the con as it hasn't happened but I used some I took on a vacation) but it gives you an idea how the collage will look

 

 

 


EXAMPLE OF THE 4X6Print

story:
My name is Kate Rhea Hesson and I own a wonderful little business in Shreveport called Zombee Candle. Zombee Candle offers quality, handmade, soy candles since 2010. Over the years, thanks to my loyal customers, my little business has grown. The time has come for me to take the next step, but I can’t do it without your help! A Home for Zombee Candle is a campaign to put money back into the community; an opportunity to invest in your area and support a local business with big plans. By purchasing a custom, single-batch, limited edition Zombee, you’ll be contributing to the start-up cost for Zombee Candle’s new storefront.

With your help, ZC will be able to open a storefront in Highland and contribute to the betterment of this historic area. This storefront will not only house Zombee Candles, but also Coven Co. natural body products, other handmade goods as well as used and rare books. From this store, we can continue our plans to make Zombee Candle a household name. We love representing Shreveport, Louisiana, and the Gulf Coast and hope to become the premier source for quality bath and body products.

What We Need & What You Get

The start-up costs for this store front are low, luckily. But, in order to ready the space for the Zombees, we will need some paint – well, a LOT of paint! The store space needs to have the floors painted and sealed and all the walls painted with two coats. 

If your donation meets or exceeds the $30 mark, you'll receive a custom Zombee exclusively made for donors of the store. All money donated during this campaign will go to renovating the space; paint, shelving, and window repair are the main repair goals.

The Impact

This is an important project, not just for Zombee Candle, but for Highland and the greater Shreveport area. The movement to support local businesses is slowly picking up momentum; people are realizing that putting money back into the community is good for us all.

Highland is an ever-changing area, but the heart and soul of the neighborhood is that of artists, craftspeople, families of all ages and races who want to live in a safe and prosperous community and keep Highland moving in a positive direction. The more successful and respectable businesses we can put in our neighborhood, the better. 

Zombee Candle started out in a spare bedroom on Creswell Avenue and is now sold in five different stores in the area as well as stores in Alabama and Texas. The possibilities are endless and we look forward to expanding our business and continuing to proudly represent Shreveport.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to help monetarily, please pass this campaign info along to others! And if you’d like to be contacted about helping us paint and work in the space, please contact us on Facebook or at www.ZombeeCandle.com
